loans.name: María Auxiliuadora

texts.es:
EL en la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Santa Rosa Del Blanco. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente que son muy visitadas por sus playas y su rica y variada gastronomía.
En este lugar vive la señora María Auxiliadora, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 21, 19, 17 y 14 años de edad, los tres menores estudian en colegio. Su esposo es agricultor.
Doña María Auxiliadora es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y así contribuir con los gastos de su hogar, ella tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa, allí ella prepara deliciosos desayunos y almuerzos los mismos que son el deleite de sus clientes que a diario visitan su restaurante y se sirven sus platos, ella siempre varia su menú de acuerdo a los días lo cual le agrada a sus clientes,  trabaja con la ayuda de su nuera a quien le paga por su trabajo, ella también parte de este crédito se lo va a dar a su marido el cual necesita para poner fertilizante a sus cultivos y así tener mejores cultivos que le sirvan para salir adelante. Para ella los créditos siempre le son de mucha ayuda razón por lo cual está muy agradecida con la Fundación y con quienes hacen posible que lleguen estos créditos.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito.  Sus sueños es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa del Blanco Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  The town is known for its traditional culture, for being a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente, and for the rich and varied cuisine.

María Auxiliadora, 40, lives here.  She's married and they have four children, ages 21, 19, 17, and 14.  The three youngest are in school.  Her husband's a farmer.

María Auxiliadroa's a woman who has always liked to work and help with the household expenses.  She has a small snack bar in her home where she prepares delicious breakfasts and lunches that delight her customers who eat the meals she prepares there every day.  She always varies the menu according to the day, which her customers like.  She has the help of her daughter-in-law , whom she pays for her work.

She's going to use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish, and other provisions to prepare her dishes, as well as fertilizer for the crops.  She's going to give part of this loan to her husband for the fertilizer to improve his crops, which will help the family get ahead.

María Auxiliadora has been with the group for two years.  The loans are always a big help to her, so she's grateful to the foundation and those who make it possible for her to get the loans.

Her dream is for her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, and other provisions

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana es madre soltera de 5 hijos; desde hace aproximadamente 6 años se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, actividad que aprendió de manera empírica y que surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos para el sustento de su familia; ofrece todo tipo de productos como ropa, accesorios, calzado, entre otros y cuenta con la ventaja de que diariamente conoce nuevas personas a las que les puede ofrecer su mercancía, mejorando cada día sus ventas. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor como blusas, jeans, zapatos, accesorios, perfumería, entre otros, así podrá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda mejorando su nivel de ingresos.

Ana, con empeño y dedicación, desea seguir trabajando para sacar adelante su negocio, ya que para un futuro cercano, sueña con tener la posibilidad de montar un almacén en un local comercial donde pueda ofrecer mayor variedad de artículos y que le genere una rentabilidad y una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a sus hijos una excelente educación y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is single and has five children. She has been working as an independent businesswoman for six years. She had to learn by herself when she realized the need to generate an income to sustain her family. Ana sells all kinds of products, such as clothes, accessories, and shoes. The advantage she has is that she can offer her products to the people she meets every day, which helps her to increase her sales.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy products in large quantities, such as blouses, jeans, shoes, accessories, and perfumes. In this way, she will have more products to offer in order to satisfy her customers’ demands and improve her income.

Ana wants to continue working hard in order to get ahead with her business. Her dream for the short term is to open a store where she can offer a wider variety of products and make more profits in order to reach financial stability and be able to offer her children a high-quality education and better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy products in large quantities, such as blouses, jeans, shoes, accessories, and perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction material as he needs to adapt his commercial space.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 45 años de edad, soltero vive junto con sus tres hijos de 17, 8 y 5 años de edad los cuales mantiene gracias a sus dos actividades que son agricultura y cría de cerdos a las cuales le quiere añadir un impulso a su segundo negocio y es el motivo por el cual se encuentra solicitando un préstamo pues desea ir convirtiendo su terreno poco a poco en una granja.
Decidió inclinarse más por los animales ya que es una actividad que no absorbe tanto tiempo y puede estar un poco más pendiente de sus hijos.

Con el dinero solicitado adecuara un espacio, construirá la cochera para los cerdos, pagara la mano de obra y comprara una cerda de cría y 4 lechones.
texts.en:
Luis is a man of 45 years of age. He is a bachelor and lives with his three children of 17, 8, and 5 years of age. He supports them thanks to his two businesses, farming and raising pigs, to which he wants to improve his second business (raising pigs). 

That is the reason why he is applying for a loan, because he wants to turn his land slowly into a farm.

He decided to lean more toward the animals, since it is a business that does not absorb so much time, and he can be a little more focused on his children. With the money loaned, he will adapt a space, build the carport for pigs, pay for labor, and buy a breeding sow and 4 piglets.

loans.use: to start another parallel field business, to build a carport and to invest in buying a breeding sow, and 4 piglets.

loans.name: Jose Rogelio

texts.es:
Desde 1979 el señor José lleva ejerciendo la actividad de cría de animales una profesión que hoy sigue en pie y ha evolucionado pasando de vender pollos y cerdos a comerciar ganado. Inicio su trabajo por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente aprendiendo todos sus conocimientos de su padre y ahora con su negocio puede devolverle un poco de todo lo que le ha dado puesto que lo ayuda brindándole dinero para comida y pago de servicios públicos.

José vive junto con su pareja e hijos, su mayor propósito es poder brindarle una educación e ir cambiando un poco esa imagen de las personas del campo, puesto que dicen que son personas muy trabajadoras pero sin estudio y él quiere que sus hijos se conviertan en los primeros con título universitario en su familia.

José quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de ganado, con el monto ajustara dinero para comprar unas 8 reses, para alimentarlas, engordarlas y posteriormente venderlas.
texts.en:
Since 1979, Jose has been raising animals. This is work that he now pursues, and he has evolved into selling chicken and pigs to trade livestock. He started his work for pleasure and as a calling to independent work. He learned everything he knows from his farther, and now, with his business, he can give back little by little all that he has been offered to him, including help with money for food and paying for public services.

Jose lives with his partner and children. His biggest goal to be able to offer his children an education and to continue changing—little by little—the image of farmers, since it is said that they are very hard working people, but that they don’t have any education. He wants his children to because the first college graduates in their family. 

Jose wants to request a loan, which he will invest in buying livestock. He will do this with the goal of having enough money to buy eight farm animals to feed them, fatten them, and then sell them.

loans.use: to buy livestock, with which he will have better commercial opportunities.

loans.name: Voguely

texts.en:
Voguely, aged 49, is the principal of a primary school in Leogane, a community located at 35 km from Port-au-Prince. He is married and has one kid. 

To develop his neighborhood, he has been involved in business activities with women in the area. He buys and retails local food products to them. He has made profits from it. Thanks to that he had access to small loans that he repaid on time. 

As the number of customers are increasing, Voguely nows needs a loan to supply his business and satisfy the clientele. Your contribution will help Voguely save at least 17% after six months. 

To incentivize young people to become retailers, Voguely gives them free training in electronics and plumbing. Voguely is portrayed left with two co-workers: Marie Renette in the middle and Jean Carlo on the right.

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of food products to sell to customers

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: EUGENIA: Es una señora cordial de 33 años de edad. Originaria de Waspam-Rio Coco, se trasladó a Puerto Cabezas por motivos laborales. Está casada con 3 hijos: 2 adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria y un pequeño de 5 años de edad. Desde hace 4 años habita en casa de familiares. Con el propósito de iniciar la construcción de su vivienda de tambo y madera esta solicitando su primer financiamiento para comprar: madera cepillada, zinc, clavos, postes de madera y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella sueña en construir su vivienda de concreto, ya que es de mayor durabilidad y seguridad para su familia.
texts.en: Eugenia is a friendly 33-year-old woman. Originally from Waspam-Rio Coco, she moved to Puerto Cabezas for work. She is married with 3 children: 2 teenagers studying in primary and secondary school and a little one who is 5 years old. They have been living with relatives for the past 4 years. In order to start the construction of her wooden stilt house, she is requesting her first loan to buy planed timber, corrugated zinc sheets, nails, and wooden studs, and to cover labor costs. She dreams of building her house in concrete, because it is more durable and safer for her family.

loans.use: to start the construction of her wooden stilt house.

loans.name: Jesus Arturo

texts.es:
Don Jesús Arturo tiene 63 años y 2 hijos bajo su cargo, los ingresos son limitados ya que el hongo de la roya afecto sus cafetales, ahora Don Jesús está en la producción de miel orgánica la cual comercializa por medio de COCAFCAL de la cual es socio.
La producción de miel orgánica es un producto de muy buena aceptación en los mercados tanto nacional como internacionales y la producción la región donde don Jesús habita tiene las mejores condiciones para una excelente producción el clima es el adecuado y la diversidad de plantas hace que la producción sea excelente 
Don Jesús solicita un crédito para comprar materiales necesarios para los cultivos orgánicos de sus abejas tales como: mantos excluidores y cajas. La miel será comercializada (exportada a los USA) a través de COCAFCAL.
El crédito ayudara a Don Jesús Arturo a cultivar sus colmenas con cuyas ganancias se ayuda para mantener las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Don Jesus is 63 years old and has 2 children under custody. His incomes have been limited because of puccinia or rusts that affect their plantations. Currently, Don Jesus is in the production of organic honey which is being sold through a partner COCAFCAL.

Organic honey is a well-accepted product in both domestic and international markets. Production in the region where Don Jesus lives has the best conditions for excellent production. Climate is right and the diversity of plants makes production excellent.

Don Jesus requests a loan to buy necessary materials for organically cultivated bees, such as excluders and boxes. Honey will be sold (exported to the USA) through COCAFCAL. 

The loan will help Don Jesus grow their hives from which earnings will help maintain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase 5 excluders for his hives and a new hive for his apiary.

loans.name: Jessica Maria

texts.es: JESSICA MARIA: Es una mujer jovial, luchadora de 31 años de edad. Originaria de Puerto Cabezas de la etnia miskita. Casada con un hijo de 7 años que estudia su 2do grado de primaria. Su esposo es conductor de un taxi. Ella lucha día a día por sacar adelante a su hijo. Desde 30 años habita en casa de familiares, con el propósito de reducir el hacinamiento e iniciar la construcción de su vivienda de tambo y madera, solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar: madera rústica, madera cepillada, zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella sueña con tener una vivienda que le brinde las condiciones adecuadas a su hijo.
texts.en: Jessica Maria is a jovial woman, a determined 31-year-old. She is from Puerto Cabezas and is of Miskito ethnicity. She is married with a 7-year-old son who is in the 2nd grade in primary school. Her husband is a taxi driver. She struggles day to day to get her son ahead. For the past 30 years, she has lived in a relative's house. With the goal to reduce the overcrowding and begin construction on her stilt house of wood, she asks for her first loan to purchase rough-sawn wood, planed wood, zinc, nails, and to pay labor costs. She dreams of having a house that will offer appropriate conditions for her son.

loans.use: to begin building her stilt house made of wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase adobe, clay tile and wood to build the home that her son and his partner will live in before the rainy season begins.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 20-year-old single man from the city of Khan Younis. He lives with his parents in a small house in the city. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Sami would like to help his family and improve their living conditions.

Sami took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to start a new project, which is a chicken barn. He has a space next to his house but he needs to build a barn and buy feed and chicks.

Sami appears in the photo.

loans.use: to start a new project, which is a chicken barn.

loans.name: Karem

texts.es:
Karem vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, su mama es costurera y su papá es empleado de una empresa.
Ella está estudiando para ser psicóloga y sus metas futuras son la de recibirse y trabajar en lo que va ser su profesión, seguir estudiando y obtener el título de Doctora y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder estudiar.
texts.en:
Karem lives with her parents and siblings in the city of San Lorenzo. Her mother is a seamstress and her father is employed by a company.

Karem is studying to become a psychologist. Her goals for the future are to receive her degree and work in that profession, to continue studying towards obtaining a doctorate, and to help her family.

She is requesting this loan so she can pay the fees for her degree and thereby continue studying.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
Estefania es de la ciudad de concepción, viene de una familia de escasos recursos, y es por eso que ella está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser una buena profesional.
Está estudiando para poder ser una odontóloga, pone todo de sí para poder destacarse en lo que está estudiando.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello estar en camino de cumplir con su meta.
texts.en:
Estefania is from the city of Concepción and comes from a family of limited means. Therefore, she is doing her best to become a successful professional.

Estefania is studying to become a dentist. She is doing everything she can to stand out in her studies. Estefania is requesting a loan in order to pay her degree fees, which will help her stay on track toward fulfilling her goal.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosario es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su madre, ella pose una tienda desde hace 5 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia y adicional a eso también elabora antojitos, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan duce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Rosario is a single mother and lives in her own home with her three children and her mother. She has had a store located in her home for five years, and in addition to that also makes snacks. She has many customers because of the variety of products and the good prices. With what she gets from her sales she manages to pay for some household expenses. 

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy soups, eggs, basic staples, soft drinks, candy, sweet, bread etc., and this way have better income.

loans.use: To buy soups, eggs, basic staples, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN JOSE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Maximiliana, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de flores, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua vendiendo diferentes tipos de flores como margaritas, calas, rosas entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar claveles entre otros para su negocio.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "San Jose". This communal bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Maximiliana is one of the members. She continues with her flower sale business. Maximiliana gives thanks to those who are part of her dream through this loan, and she promises to make her payments according to the established terms. She continues selling different types of flowers such as daisies, lilies, and roses, among others. The member is a responsible and determined person, and this is the way that she moves her family forward.
                                                                                                                                                                                            
Maximiliana is requesting a loan to buy carnations, among others, for her business.

loans.use: to buy carnations, among others, for her business.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en: Diosdada is a 56-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has had a sari-sari store business for 30 years. Diosdada sells items like canned goods, soft drinks, shampoo, coffee, milk, chips and soap. She works hard to improve her business and her family's living situation. This is also her way of helping her husband who works as a farmer. Diosdada requested a loan to buy more merchandise to replenish her stock. When her shelves are fully-stocked, it  looks more attractive to her customers and she has a better chance to increase her income. She hopes that this loan will help improve her business. This will also allow her and her husband to prepare for old age.

loans.use: to buy canned sardines, noodles, liquor, soft drinks, and clothes and food for her family.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and fund her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Aside from her small variety store, Anecita also operates her food stall business and she will also use part of the loan to improve her profit from this. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es: Cindy tiene la edad  de 30 años, está casada, vive con sus hijos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos para la siembra de una plantación de chile, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de chile. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia  y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Cindy is 30 years old, married, and lives with her children who are her highest priority.  She will use the money from her loan to buy fertilizer, fungicide, and pay for labor on her pepper plantation.  She will also take advantage of the soil’s fertility, climate, and other favorable conditions for raising peppers.  She hopes to increase her earnings and quality of life my making these improvements, as well as meeting some of her goals.  This will be her first loan through FUDECOSUR and she has not had any previous loans through state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan easily and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Los Amigos De Polo Group

texts.es: Raúl, tiene 47 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 4 hijos, y reside en una comunidad que pertenece al municipio de San Pedro Sula. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura cultivando café. Esta producción es su fuente de ingresos para la familia desde hace varios años. El café lo vende en el mercado local. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo en forma grupal por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos y fertilizar su finca de café y poder obtener mejor cosecha. su plan es seguir mejorando la finca para tener siempre su fuente de ingresos. El grupo se llama Los Amigos de Polo, integrado por cinco miembros que viven en la misma zona y realizan la misma actividad. el monto de préstamo es por 50,000 lempiras que invertirán en la fertilización de su finca. En la foto se identifican así: Carlos a la izquierda, Sigue Norma, Idania, Francisca y Raúl  a la derecha.
texts.en:
Raúl is 47 years old and lives in a free union relationship with his partner and their four children. They live in a community that is part of the municipality of San Pedro Sula. He has always been a coffee grower and its production has been his source of income for the family for several years. He sells the coffee at the local market.

Raul has decided to ask for a loan of 10,000 lempiras as part of a group so he can buy manure and fertilizer for his coffee plantation to attain a better crop. His plan is to continue improving the plantation so he will always have a source of income. The group is called Los Amigos de Polo and is made up of five members who live in the same area and who all are engaged in coffee production. The loan is for 50,000 lempiras which will be spent on fertilizing the crops. 

In the photo they are Carlos, on the left; then Norma, Idania, Francisca and Raul on the right.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for his coffee plants.

loans.name: Wuilsón Oswaldo

texts.es:
Wuilson es una joven de 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Chimaltenango.
Wuilson para poder obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la herrería desde hace cinco años, él cuenta que gracias a esta actividad ha logrado mejorar sus ingresos.
Wuilson ahora quiere mejorar la calidad de sus servicios a la clientela, pero para poder hacerlo necesita de una compresora para poder mejorar la calidad de sus servicios, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder comprarlo por tal razón solicita un crédito.
Wuilson sueña con poder comprar más herramientas para que su negocio pueda  generarle mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Wuilson is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the community of Chimaltenango. 

In order to earn income and help his parents with household expenses, Wuilson has been an iron worker. He states that thanks to this work he has been able to increase his income. Now he wants to improve the quality of his service to his customers, but to do this he needs a compressor and doesn't have the money to buy one. This is why he is asking for a loan.

Wuilson's dream is to be able to buy more tools so that his business can generate more income.

loans.use: to buy a compressor for his ironwork service.

loans.name: Nacaf

texts.en:
Nacaf was born in 1972. He is married and has two children. The elder is studying the second course of college and the other graduated school and learned the car master profession. Nacaf lives in the Absheron region but already for 22 years they have been IDP (internally displaced persons) from Fuzuli city. He has been in the repair-construction business for 10 years and loves his job.

Today he applied to Komak Credit Union for a loan in the amount of 800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair the necessary apparatus for his work. Nacaf says “Dear Kiva organization and dear lender, you helped me a lot”. In the future he wants to help his children to get married and build a house.

loans.use: to repair his necessary apparatus, increase business, and in the future to help his children to get married and build a house.

loans.name: Luis  Benjamin

texts.es: Luis de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, sus dos hijos y su suegra, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz, arroz y frijoles se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 30 años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños y con las ganancias que obtener logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Luis está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas semillas, abonos, fertilizante, herbicidas, etc. y así continuar con sus cultivos para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Luis is 49 years old and lives in his own house with his wife, his two children and his mother-in-law. He earns a living in farming, he grows corn, rice and beans and he has been doing this for 30 years. When the harvest is ready he sells his products in the surrounding towns and with what he earns he manages to pay some of his household expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilisers, weed killer, etc. and therefore continue growing his produce in order to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertiliser, weed killer, etc.

loans.name: Pedro Alejandrino

texts.es: Pedro de 70 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de elotes y arroz, tiene 45 años de experiencia en el rubro, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, gracias a sus ventas es cono el ha podido salir adelante con su familia, Pedro está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder tener  mejores ingresos  económicos.
texts.en: Pedro is 70 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He earns a living in agriculture, especially growing corn and rice. He has 45 years of experience in this. When the harvest is ready he sells his produce in the different markets close to his home. Thanks to he sales he has been able to get ahead in life with his family. Pedro is asking for a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilisers, weed killer, pest control, etc. and therefore be able to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more seeds, manure, fertiliser, week killer, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 26-year-old married mother of one child. Her husband drives a van to provide for the family. Due to the family’s poor financial circumstances she decided in 2012 to start a job from home preparing homemade foods to sell. She is very happy and is gaining a good reputation in her hometown.

Today, Zeinab is requesting an 810,000 LBP loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy more ingredients and merchandise to develop her business. She hopes that in the future she might open her own store, and surely additional loans from Kiva will help her to realize her dream.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and merchandise to develop her business.

loans.name: Kamile

texts.en:
Kamile, a 53-year-old single Lebanese woman living with one sibling, is the main income source of the family. She and her brother cooperate to fulfill their life needs.  

In 2013, Kamile opened a small room in her house to use as a bakery to produce breads. She is now requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase baking machinery and others items. She states that this machine will help her increase her business productivity which will yield higher profits. She says that she will be a permanent customer in order to further develop her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase baking machinery and other items

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. He is 54 years old and has one child. He and Julieta, his wife, manage a tomato distributing business and their income from the business helps with their everyday needs and expenditures.

Alejandro buys fresh tomatoes directly from a pier nearby and delivers and sells it to market vendors on a wholesale basis. He profits well from this kind of business since tomatoes are a very common ingredient in native Filipino dishes. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.

Alejandro is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to purchase more supplies to sell. He will use his loan to improve his sales and his additional revenue to improve his family's general living conditions.

Aside from becoming successful in business and future plans, Alejandro also hopes to make life easy for his child and give his family a better quality of life. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies of tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Dodo

texts.en:
Dodo, 42, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Georgia’s Tsalka district. The family farms a hectare of land where they grow potatoes to sell locally at a good price. They also own five cows that produce dairy products to sell.

Dodo wants to open a small grocery and has applied for a 5,000 USD loan through the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. With the loan she will purchase a stock of products to open and operate her grocery, a venture that will give the family a stable income. She will use the store’s profits to gradually develop the business.

loans.use: purchase a stock of products to open and operate her grocery

loans.name: Maria Dilcia

texts.es: María, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, reside en una aldea de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara junto a una hija. Hace 5 años que ella decidió por tener su propia fuente de ingresos y puso una pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser azúcar, arroz, manteca, huevos, pan,  churros, refrescos, frijoles y otros. Actualmente solicita un préstamo por 11,000 Lempiras para comprar productos y surtir la pulpería con mas productos como azúcar, arroz, manteca, productos de limpieza, huevos, pan etc. Su meta es que el negocio crezca y le genere mayores ganancias para ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en: María is 36 years old and a single mother with 3 children.  She lives in a village of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara with her daughter.  Five years ago, she decided to have her own source of income and started a grocery store to sell basic household goods like sugar, rice, butter, eggs, bread, beverages, beans, and others.  Currently, she is requesting a loan for 11,000 Lempiras to purchase products and stock the store with more products like sugar, rice, butter, cleaning products, eggs, bread, etc.  Her goal is for her business to grow and generate more income to help her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, butter, cleaning products, eggs, bread, etc. to stock and sell.

loans.name: Elsieta

texts.en:
Elsieta, a 40-year-old woman from San Miguel, Bohol, has been engaged in rice farming for 19 years now. Her husband is an electrician and they both work hard to earn a living so they can support their five children, who range in age from eight to 17. 

Elsieta is requesting a loan to pay for pesticides, fertilizer and labor. She is determined to work hard so that she can send her children to school and also expand her business.

In the future, Elsieta hopes to have an abundant life and children who are professionals.

loans.use: to pay for pesticides, fertilizer and labor

loans.name: Nashon's Group

texts.en:
Nashon is 67 years old and has six children. He is a group leader and is representing his group, formed by 15 farmers in Butere District, Kenya.

Nashon has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Nashon also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Nashon's Group will be able to receive a total of 12 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Zira Dalia

texts.es: ZIRA DALIA: Es una mujer alegre, emprendedora, originaria de Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas, tiene 43 años de edad,  casada, tiene cuatro hijos que estudian su secundaria y carrera universitaria. Su esposo es pescador artesanal, sin ingreso fijo, por lo que ella   decidió emprender su pequeño negocio hace 18 años. En el corredor de su vivienda de tambo y madera estableció su pequeña pulpería en la que vende productos básicos, caramelos, galletas, generando ingresos propios con lo cual asegura la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Está solicitando un crédito para comprar más mercadería, para diversificar su oferta, comprar en Managua: ropa usada. Su sueño es llegar a ser una exitosa comerciante con un negocio próspero.
texts.en:
ZIRA DALIA is a happy, enterprising woman from Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. She is 43 years old and married with four children who are in secondary school and university. 

Her husband is a small-scale fisherman who doesn't have a steady income, so she decided to start up her small business 18 years ago. She runs her small grocery store out of the hallway in her stilt home and sells basic items such as candies and biscuits, generating her own income and ensuring that she can pay for food and her children's education.

She is asking for a loan so she can buy more merchandise to diversify her stock and to buy used clothing in Managua.

Her dream is to become a successful businesswoman with a thriving business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to diversify her stock, and to buy used clothing in Managua.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijoles tiene 5 años de experiencia en la agricultura,  comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes, semillas, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young person whose face has been blurred is 26 years old and lives in a high risk area. He earns a living in farming and he grows corn and beans. He has five years of experience in this. He sells his products in the surrounding areas of where he lives. With his earnings he is able to pay for some of his household expenses. He lives in his own house with his wife. He is asking for this loan to buy manure, fertilisers, seeds, pest control, etc. and improve the land that can be seen in this photograph in order to be able to continue with his sales and in this way have a better income.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilisers, seeds, pest control, etc. and improve his land.

loans.name: Zulma Del Carmen

texts.es: Zulma de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su dos hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 15 años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los pueblos aledaños, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar  algunos gastos de su hogar, Zulma esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. y asi poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos para una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Zulma is 33 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her two children. She has earned a living growing corn for 15 years. When her harvest is ready she stores in in the granaries that can been seen in this photograph in order to sell it later in the surrounding towns. With what she earns from her sales she manages to cover some of her household expenses. Zulma is asking for this loan in order to buy manure, seeds, fertilisers, etc. and in this way be able to improve her income in order to have better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilisers, etc.

loans.name: Sarafina Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha, who is in her early 40s, is single with four children, one son and three daughters, who are still going to school.  She has been a food vendor for four years. She works from 6 am to 9 pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Mwanaisha's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to keep increasing her food stock, and has repaid all of her loans successfully. She is happy with the loans, and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group, whose members can now support their families. She used the increased profit to pay school fees, loan repayments, and household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy chairs, tables, and utensils, and to increase her food stock in order to serve more people. She dreams of making her business grow.

Mwanaisha will share this loan with her loan group, Sarafina, which has seven members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, and utensils, and to increase her stock of food, in order to serve more people

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en: Cristita hails from San Miguel, Bohol. She is 52 years old, and married, with three adult children. Cristita has been operating a Sari-sari store business for 28 years. She would like to refill her shelves, but lacks capital for her planned expansion. She is asking for a loan to buy food storage, vita plus products, canned goods, chips, seasoning, and toiletries. Cristita hopes to manage her business well for a better return on her investment. In the future, she hopes to make her store bigger and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy food storage, vita plus products, canned goods, chips, seasoning, and toiletries

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy has been engaged in weaving and selling native baskets for almost two years. She is a 37-year-old married woman with three children, ages 9, 6, and 4. Her husband earns a living by farming. She is in need of capital to sustain her livelihood.

Lucy is asking for a loan to buy materials like oway (twisted pine rope) and bamboo. These  will enable her to produce and sell more baskets to her  customers. This will increase her income, and she will be able to prepare healthy meals for the whole family.
 
Lucy hopes that, someday she can own a sari-sari (variety) store, which would help improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials like uway(twisted pine rope ) and bamboo

loans.name: Lyndelou

texts.en:
Lyndelou is a married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She owns a Sari-sari store business within her home, where she sells basic commodities such as spices, canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, gasoline, soft drinks, and chips. Her business started in 2007. She is asking for a loan to buy supplies of soft drinks, noodles, canned goods, cooking oil, seasoning, chips, and candies. By increasing her inventory, she can be confident of a steady flow of customers.

Lyndelou hopes to expand her business, so that someday when she has children, she can support them well and give them a better future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, noodles, canned goods, cooking oil, seasoning, chips, and candies for her store

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
Annalie farms rice for a living. She and her family live in the community of San Miguel, Bohol. She has been farming rice for 14 years to support the needs of her children, who are 1, 6, 8 and 14. Annalie is asking for a loan of 18,000 PHP to pay for hired labor, fertilizer and pesticides for her farm. She is optimistic about the impact of the loan on her business. She hopes that with her hard work she can support the schooling of her children and give them a healthy diet.

In the future, she hopes to expand her farming to increase profitability.

loans.use: to pay for hired labor, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Melitona

texts.en:
Melitona is a 51-year-old woman from San Miguel, Bohol. Her husband is a farmer and also works as a carpenter. She also supports two adult children who are still studying.

Melitona runs a sari-sari, or general store in the Philippines. She sells items such as sugar, coffee, condiments, noodles, toiletries and canned goods.

Melitona would like to start raising pigs but lacks the money to do so. She has now applied for a 12,000 PHP loan from Kiva’s partner CEVI to buy piglets and feed for them. She will also use part of the loan to buy canned goods, seasonings, toiletries and soft drinks to restock her store. Her financial aim is to cover tuition fees for her children and provide healthy meals for them all.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, seasonings, toiletries and soft drinks to restock her store, plus piglets and feed for them

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine, 51, is married and has four children, one of whom goes to school. For the past 26 years she has been the proprietor of a bar. She also has a farm for additional income.

A hard worker, Justine would like to develop a wholesale business and upgrade her house. Insufficient capital, however, is a big challenge, so she has applied for a 1,500,000 UGX loan from Kiva’s partner Hofokam to buy sand, cement and bricks to improve her residence.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and bricks to improve on her residential house.

loans.name: Leotina

texts.en:
Leotina has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own buy-and-sell business for more than five years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having a better income, to provide their children with better education.

To improve sales, Leotina would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional merchandise to sell. With PHP 15,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of merchandise items such as doormats, tupperware items, biscuits, toys and other supplies needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Leotina hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family and expand her business gradually through savings. She also prays for more strength within the household and continuous growth of their faith. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more quantities and varieties of merchandise items to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.es: MERLYN: Es una joven alegre, originaria del municipio de Waspam Rio Coco, pertenece a la etnia Miskita, tiene 22 años de edad, casada. Se trasladó a Puerto Cabezas desde hace 5 años con el propósito de estudiar su carrera universitaria. Desde hace 2 años habita en casa de familiares en una casa de tambo y madera. Está solicitando su primer préstamo para comprar un terreno y en fututo poco a poco construir su propia vivienda de madera. Ella sueña con terminar su carrera universitaria de administración de empresas, ser una profesional exitosa y brindarle a su familia una vivienda con las condiciones adecuadas.
texts.en: Merlyn is a happy young woman, native of the municipality of Waspam Rio Coco. She belongs to the Miskito ethnic group. She is 22 years old and married. She moved 5 years ago to Puerto Cabezas with the purpose of attending college. She has lived for 2 years with relatives in a stilt house made of wood. She is requesting her first loan to buy a lot of land where in the future, little by little, she can build her own house of wood. She dreams of finishing her college career in Business Administration, being a successful professional and giving her family a house with adequate conditions.

loans.use: to buy a lot of land.

loans.name: Christo Nti Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called "Christo Nti." The group is made up of five women. One is married, and the other four are single. On average, they are 30 years old and have one child. They live in traditional families in the Teshie neighborhood in the city of Accra. They know one another through the neighborhood, friendship, and business ties.

To strengthen their financial capacity in order to better run their businesses, they joined ID Ghana, a micro finance institution, with whom they are on their third loan. The previous two loans were paid back properly. This group of women sells drying pegs, mosquito coil, underwear, foodstuffs, salt and waakye (cooked rice and beans).

Naomi sells drying pegs and mosquito coil. She will buy from the wholesalers in Accra. She makes her sales from door to door. She plans to make a very big profit from this loan cycle, which will be reinvested in the businesses and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more more drying pegs and mosquito coil, which she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rose N's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Rose N., who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by eight farmers in Butere District, Kenya. She is married and is the mother of three children, known by her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Rose N. joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Rose N. plans to buy a cow.

Between the eight farmers in Rose N.'s Group, a total of 3.75 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfumes and mobile phone accessories in bulk.

loans.name: Cristo Es Vida Group

texts.es: La Sra. Alicia tiene 49 años de edad, está conviviendo con el Sr. Hilario quien se dedica a vender electrodomésticos en una empresa conocida y con quien tiene 5 hijos que dependen de ellos. Alicia es presidenta de la alcancía comunal “CRISTO ES VIDA” el cual está conformado por 5 personas muy responsables y deseosos de prosperar. Alicia tiene como fuente de trabajo la venta de emoliente y todo tipo de bebidas, así de esta manera ayuda a su pareja en los ingresos que necesitan para cubrir los gastos de casa. El préstamo lo invertirá en su negocio para comprar más bebidas, implementos y utensilios que necesita. Su plan a futuro es implementar una gran bodega en su propia casa. En la foto grupal Alicia se encuentra de pie junto a las demás personas sentadas.
texts.en:
Alicia is 49, and lives with Hilario, who sells electrical appliances as part of a well known company. They have 5 children who are all dependents. 

Alicia is president of "Cristo es Vida" (Christ is Life) communal bank, which is made up of 5 responsible people who are all eager to prosper. Alicia makes her living selling emollient herbal tea, as well as many other types of drinks, so that she can earn an income to help her partner to cover the household costs. She will use this loan to buy more drinks, as well as implements and utensils that she needs. 

Her plan for the future is to install a large store in her home. In the group photo, Alicia is standing up next to the other people who are sitting down.

loans.use: to buy different types of drinks

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, necesita de más capital para continuar trabajando en la agricultura, podrá comprar insumos agrícolas y pagara tanto el alquiler del terreno como a los obreros que le apoyaran a realizar la próxima siembra de granos básicos.
La inversión anterior ha tenido un resultado positivo porque la ha recuperado con ganancias, su familia continua igual, la diferencia es que sus hijos han crecido y eso le genera un poco más de gastos pero dice que con la administración adecuado de los ingresos está logrando salir adelante.
texts.en:
José needs more capital so that he can continue his farm work. He will be able to buy farming supplies and pay the rent on his farmland on which his workers help him with planting the next crop of basic grains.

His previous investment had a positive result because he was able to recoup his earnings. His family continues to do well, with the only difference being that his children have grown. José has had a few more expenses, but he says that he has been able to manage his income adequately so that he can stay ahead.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and pay the rent on his farmland.

loans.name: Gabina

texts.en:
Gabina is 66 years old but still works hard to cater to her businesses. She is from San Miguel, Bohol. 

Gabina is engaged in farming rice and operating a sari-sari store business. These two make her not only busy but healthy because she has to move from place to place to keep her business. 

She is asking for a loan of 21,000 PHP to buy cooking oil, salt, canned goods, noodles, soy sauce, vinegar, shampoo, and body soap. 

Her income will be for food and reinvestment in the same business. Gabina hopes to save for old age so she can live in comfort and prosperity.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, salt, canned goods, noodles, soy sauce, vinegar, shampoo, and body soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cocoa

loans.name: Mercenario

texts.en:
Mercenario is 37 years old. He lives in Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines, and is married to Rosalie and has four children. As a way of generating income, he has been engaged in a buy-and-sell business within his community for three years now. Together with his wife, he works hard to provide for the everyday needs of their family.

His business basically sells rice cakes, which are common delicacies in the Filipino diet. And since rice cakes are priced inexpensively, ordinary people commonly buy them in relief of their hunger. Furthermore, it is also an advantage to Mercenario that his stall is located just along the way where people tend to pass by. Therefore, Mercenario gets a good profit from this inventory. He also sells other merchandise and various items like groceries, soft drinks and bottled water.

However, due to financial insufficiency, Mercenario  wants to make his business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, he would like to avail himself of a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional supplies of products that are needed in his business. He is hoping that he will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Mercenario hopes for his business to prosper and for his family to be always in good condition and getting more strength and guidance from the Lord. He meets up with his fellowship group* every week to share stories of his life and business and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of products that are needed in his food stall.

loans.name: Eveketi

texts.en:
Eveketi, who lives in Bundibugyo-Uganda, is a hard-working woman, dealing in cocoa buying and selling. She got involved in the business to earn income, and meet increasing family demands. Eveketi has a cocoa garden where she generates additional income. She is challenged by bad weather, and limited capital that hinders expansion of her cocoa business.  

Eveketi has asked for a loan to buy more cocoa seeds for resale to her customers.

loans.use: To buy cocoa seeds for resale to her customers.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab, 41, lives with his wife and three children in Georgia’s Ozurgeti district. He is a farmer who grows corn and potatoes. He also has cows that produce dairy products that he sells.

Merab wants to open a bakery. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, will enable him to get a 5000 GEL loan with which to build his bakery. He plans to buy a supply of flour to bake a Georgian bread he can sell in order to increase his family’s income.

loans.use: to open a bakery

loans.name: Hellen's Group

texts.en:
Always recognized as a very friendly person, Hellen, 36, has eight children and has been a farmer for more than twenty years. She is also the leader of a One Acre Fund group comprised of seven members in Kenya’s Butere district.

In 2010 Hellen started working with the One Acre Fund. She decided to do so because she wanted to have access to their quality training and learn new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve and has been able to consistently provide food for her family. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

With this 60,010 KES credit Hellen’s Group will receive farming inputs such as maize seed and fertilizer to plant a total of 3.75 acres of land. Additionally, six of the farmers in the group will be receiving solar lights.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds, fertilizer and access to 3.75 acres of farmland

loans.name: Reham

texts.en:
Reham is a 26-year-old single lady, living with her family in Mafraq. She is in her fourth year to get a bachelor's degree majoring in geology.

She is one of five members. Reham's father is retired but his pension is not enough to meet all of the semester fees and expenses of the house. That has led to delays for Reham at the university but that did not prevent her from trying to complete her education; therefore she requested an education loan to cover her semester fees. 

She hopes to find a job after she graduates immediately to help her family with their household expenses.

loans.use: To cover her semester fees and achieve her dreams

loans.name: Jackson's Group

texts.en:
Jackson is a 36-year-old proud father of 5 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and he is representing his group of 6 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Jackson has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Jackson described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Jackson’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Rajab's Group

texts.en:
Rajab is a 34-year-old proud father of 5 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and he is representing his group of 11 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Rajab has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Rajab described his harvest as very good last year, but he believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge his phone. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Rajab’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6 acres of land and purchase a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Humphrey's Group

texts.en:
Humphrey is a 61-year-old proud father of 6 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing his group of 10 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Humphrey has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Humphrey described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Humphrey’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land, and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jared's Group

texts.en:
Jared's Group was formed by 13 farmers in Butere District, and is being represented by Jared, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 46 years old, is married, and has 4 children. Jared has been a farmer for one year, and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Jared isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2012, and has since noticed his life has changed. He has had a healthier life, due to better nutrition. This year, Jared will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. He is very excited about this addition, since now he will be able to have an improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Jared's Group will purchase a total of 12 solar lights, and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve the maize  harvest.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es: 13.	EMILIANO: Es un señor jovial, es promotor comunitario voluntario de la comunidad miskita Sahsa, que significa comunidad donde abundan las plantas de junco (es utilizada para enjuncar camas y sillas). Esta comunidad pertenece al municipio de Puerto Cabezas, se localiza a 85 kilómetros de Bilwi. Él  es agricultor y también realiza  actividades pecuarias.  Está casado con 4 hijos adolescentes que estudian su secundaria.  Está solicitando su primer financiamiento para invertirlo en la crianza y engorde de cerdo que después comercializará en Bilwi y sembrar frijoles. Su sueño es tener una finca con cultivos diversificados, con buenos rendimientos y manejo agronómico, que le generen buenos ingresos también, para crear mejores condiciones para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Emiliano is a cheerful man, he is a volunteer community promotor of the miskita Sahsa community, which means a community where there are many reed plants (used to make cane beds and chairs). This community belongs the the Puerto Cabezas municipality, situated 85km from Bilwi. 

He works in agruculture and also tends livestock. He is married with four teenage children who are doing their secondary studies. He is asking for his first loan to invest in the raising and fattening of pigs, that he will then sell in Bilwi, and in sowing beans. 

His dream is to have a farm with a diversity of crops, with good yields and agronomic management which would also generate a good income for him, in order to create better conditions to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the raising and fattening of pigs, and in sowing beans.

loans.name: Blema Tesa Group

texts.en:
Regina and her colleague are part of the group called Bleama Tesa. Regina is in her late 30s and single. She sells baby dresses, which she has been doing for four years. She works from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM daily and is able to earn a good monthly profit. 

Regina requested her second loan from ID-Ghana, which she will use to buy more baby dresses to sell. She used the profits for household expenses and to invest in her business. She dreams of owning a wholesale business so she can supply to retailers. Regina will share this loan with her borrowing group members, which has a total of two members. They will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase baby dresses

loans.name: Virginia

texts.pt:
A senhora Virgínia tem 41 anos de idade,casada, mãe de 5 filhos, todos menores de idade, 2 deles frequentando o ensino secundário, 2 frequentando o ensino primário e  1 ainda é menor de idade, mas vive na sua casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar feijão, repolho, tomate, batata, amendoim, caldo e açucar para reforçar o seu negócio.
Seu sonho e esperança para o futuro é  ver seu negócio a crescer e adiquirir mais bens.
Diz que tem como desafio a insuficiência de fundos  e para ultrapassar-lo faz xitique mensal como forma de poupar. com vista a concretizar seus planos irá terminar o presente credito sem entrar em moras e solicitar mais créditos.
texts.en: Virgínia is a 41 year old married mother who lives in her own home with her 5 dependent children: 2 of whom attend secondary school, 2 more are at primary school and the youngest is still of pre-school age. She plans to use this loan to buy beans, cabbage, tomatoes, potatoes, nuts, stock and sugar so that she can restock her business. She dreams of seeing her business grow in the future along with her wealth. She faces a daily challenge due to her lack of money and she is part of a xitique, an informal credit and savings group, as a means to saving money. She intends to repay this loan without getting into arrears so that she can apply for further loans in order to fulfil her plans.

loans.use: to buy beans, cabbage, tomato, potato, nuts, stock and sugar.

loans.name: Lizete

texts.pt:
A senhora Lizete tem 39 anos de idade,casada, mãe de 4 filhos, todos menores de idade, mas  só vive com 3 deles  na sua  casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar carnes, óleo, cervejas, açucar, massas e vinhos para reforçar o seu negócio.
Seu sonho e esperança para o futuro e concluir a sua casa e adiquirir uma viatura para o uso pessoal.
Diz que tem como desafios a insuficiência de fundos  e para ultrapassar esta situação faz xitique como forma de poupar e irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en: Lizete is a 39 year old married mother to 4 young children, only 3 of whom live with her in the family home. She plans to use her loan to buy meat, cooking oil, beer, sugar, dough and wine so that she can restock her business. She hopes and dreams of finishing the building work on her home in the future and of buying a vehicle for her own use. She says that the greatest challenge that she faces is in relation to her finances and she is part of a xitique, an informal credit and savings group, as a way of saving some money to help her overcome her difficulties. She also hopes to apply for further loans in order to fulfil her plans.

loans.use: to buy meat, cooking oil, beer, sugar, dough and wine

loans.name: Dometo

texts.fr: Dometo vit avec sa famille(mari et un enfant de 18ans) à Lomé.Pour apporter son aide à la famille, elle a décidé de vendre des denrées alimentaires et divers au Marché lieu où elle s'approvisionne également. Son premier prêt lui servira d'acheter des marchandises afin de revendre aux clients. elle souhaite avoir une boutique et bien nourrir sa famille.
texts.en: Dometo lives with her family (husband and 18-year-old child) in Lomé. In order to help her family, she decided to sell miscellaneous food products at the market, where she also stocks up. Her first loan will help her to buy merchandise to be able to resell to customers. She hopes to have a boutique and feed her family well.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous food items

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Luis, el socio pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
El socio sigue  dedicándose a su negocio de restaurante, el socio  Luis está muy agradecido con KIVA y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio Luis solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite, menestras entre otros.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis is a member of the Communal Bank “El Templo del Inca” (The Incan Temple), which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru. He continues to manage a restaurant business. Luis is extremely grateful to Kiva and promises to complete his payments according to the established terms. He is a responsible and industrious person who works in this manner so that his family can get ahead.

Luis is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, oil, soups, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, soups, and other supplies.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is from the municipality of San Miguel, Bohol. She is 35 years old and married with three children aged 1, 6, and 12. 

Three years ago, she started selling fruits and vegetables in her community. She sells papayas, taro, mongo beans, eggplants, and bananas. 

She is asking for a loan to expand her business and hopefully include other type of fruits. She will utilize her loan to buy squash, eggplants, taro, bananas, and more papayas.

Her income will be for school fees and the healthy diet of her children.

loans.use: to buy squash, eggplants, taro, bananas, and more papayas

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with two grown children. She has been farming vegetables like squash and eggplant to earn a living for eight years now. 

She is asking for a loan of 12,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides to keep her plants healthy. Jocelyn is hopeful that with the loan her vegetable business will flourish and become bigger.

Her income will be for family daily consumption and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 30,000 Kenya Shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Eugenia Mariana

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Carita De Ángel se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Tarqui  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Eugenia, tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes.
Doña Eugenia con la intención de ganarse la vida  y con esto salir adelante y no depender de nadie se dedica al comercio, ella  vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y bisuterías,  su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, sale en horas de la mañana ya que a esta hora es más fresco salir, ella actualmente tiene alquilado un local en el cual espera instalar un negocio de venta de frutas picadas, batidos de frutas, entre otros bocadillos, lleva más de 20 años dedicada al comercio lo cual le ha servido para ir de a poco mejorando su vida y más después de que recibe los créditos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: ropa, zapatos, vasos y una licuadora que necesita para abrir su local. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The group Crédito Carita De Ángel gets together every fifteen days in the neighborhood Tarqui in the city of Manta.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited all year long and for being a beautiful city with many tourist attractions.  

Eugenia lives here.  She is 57 years old, is a single mother of three older and independent children.  Dona Eugenia does not want to depend on anyone and so, with the intention of earning a living, she works in sales.  She sells all types of clothes, shoes, and costume jewelry door to door.  She leaves in the morning as it is cooler.  She presently has rented a space in which she hopes to install a business selling fruit, snacks and smoothies, among other snacks.  She has more than twenty years experience in sales which has served her to better here life little by little and will help even more when she receives a loan.

She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise such as:  clothing, shoes, glasses and a blender which she needs to open her shop.  She has four cycles in the Grupo de Credito and she likes it because the loans allow her to better herself.  Her dream is to have a great shop.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, glasses and a blender.

loans.name: Magdalena Janeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Carita De Ángel se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Tarqui  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Magdalena, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 3 y 1 año de edad. Su esposo es maestro ebanista.
Doña Magdalena al ver que su marido no gana mucho y no le alcanza para los gastos, hace mas de 4 años surtió en su casa una pequeña tienda de víveres, allí empezó a vender solo  productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otros víveres pero con la ayuda de los créditos ella ha ido aumentando la variedad de productos, también vende productos Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), estas ventas las realiza en su tienda o sino también sale a recorrer por la localidad. Así ella logra sus propios ingresos con los cuales salen adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, otros víveres y cosméticos Belcorp. Lleva más de 2 años en el Grupo Crédito y le gusta porque con los  créditos mejora su negocio. Sus metas son seguir aumentando su tienda cada día más.
texts.en:
The Loan Group Carita De Ángel meets once a fortnight in the Tarqui district in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular all year round, and for being a city with a beauty without equal and with many tourist attractions.

Magdalena lives here, she is 32 years old, is married and from this relationship has two children who are three and one years old. Her husband is a master carpenter.

More than four years ago, on seeing that her husband does not earn a lot and that it was not enough to cover costs, she opened a small general store in her house. She began to sell only products like rice, sugar, oils and detergents among other provisions, but with the help of loans she has increased the variety of products and also sells Belcorp products (beauty, cosmetic and perfume products and women's accessories). She makes these sales from her shop but also goes out to sell in the local area. In this way she achieves her own income with which they manage to move forward.

She is going to use this loan to stock her shop further, she is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, other products and Belcorp cosmetics. She has been in the Loan Group for more than two years and likes it because the loans improve her business. Her aims are to continue to grow her shop more each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, other products and Belcorp cosmetics.

loans.name: Segundo Filiberto

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Carita De Ángel se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Tarqui  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Segundo, tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de los padres. El lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ha podido mejorar más su negocio.
El señor Segundo es un hombre muy trabajador que le gusta a base de esfuerzo ganarse la vida y con sus ingresos ayudarles a sus padres ya que ellos son de escasos recursos, el hace mas de 12 años surtió en su casa una pequeña tienda de víveres, allí vende todo tipo de productos  como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, carnes, legumbres, artículos de bazar  entre otros productos, también vende ropa de todo tipo pues tiene unas vitrinas en las que exhibe sus prendas y vende al mismo tiempo que sus clientes compran los víveres.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar víveres y ropa de todo tipo. Sus metas son seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The group Crédito Carita De Ángel meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood Tarqui in the city of Manta.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited year round and for being a beautiful city with many tourist attractions.

Don Segundo, 38 years old, lives here.  He is single in lives in his parents' house.  He has had two cycles in the Grupo de Credito and he likes it because thanks to the loans he has been able to better his business.  Senor Segundo is a very hardworking man who likes to earn his living through effort.  With his income he helps his parents who have scant resources.  

Twelve years ago he stocked his home with items for a small supply store.  There he sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, meats, vegetables, bazar items and more.  He also sells all types of clothing and has display windows to show the clothes and sell while his customers are buying supplies.  

He will use this loan to stock his store.  He is going to purchase supplies and clothing.  His goal is to continue increasing his business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and clothing.

loans.name: Benedict's Group

texts.en:
