Benedict is a 47-year-old proud father of seven children. He is a group leader, often described as a very trustworthy person, and is representing his group of 15 farmers in the Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Benedict has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Benedict described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Benedict’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8 acres of land and purchase a total of 14 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sleiman's Group

texts.en:
Sleiman is a 43-year-old proud father of 10 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and he is representing his group of 15 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Sleiman has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Sleiman described his harvest as excellent last year, but he believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Sleiman’s Group will be able to plant a total of 10.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Cairal

texts.en:
Cairal is 39 years old and married. She operates a school in her community, which she has been doing for 14 years. Today, there are 109 students in her school and almost 50% are girls. Cairal employs six teachers, including four women from the same community. She believes in determination, hard work, and attention to detail. These qualities have made her school successful and have given her school a reputation for providing quality education. 

Cairal requested a loan for 75,000 PKR, which she will use to buy a swing set for her younger students and to construct a new classroom to accommodate new students.

loans.use: to purchase a swing set  and to construct a new classroom

loans.name: Zaib

texts.en:
Zaib, 29, has been running a school in her community for the past 5 years. 

Her family always taught her the importance of education, and she knew she would one day open a school to educate deserving children. After several years of hard work and perseverance, today there are almost 250 students in her school, and half of them are girls. 

She wants to continue to improve her school and enroll more children. She requires a loan of PKR 80,000 to buy furniture for her classrooms.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her classrooms.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
32-year-old Farzana has been running a school in her community for the last 4 years. 

Farzana always wanted to contribute to the cause of education in her community, and she feels that all children, regardless of where they are born, have a right to succeed in their lives. Education is the foundation of that success. After a lot of hard work and determination, today there are over 250 students in her school, of which half are girls, and she is proud of all of them. 

Farzana requires a loan of PKR 100,000 in order to buy chairs and desks for her students. She wants to provide them with a comfortable learning environment so that they are equipped to follow their dreams.

loans.use: to buy chairs and desks for her students.

loans.name: Linet's Group

texts.en:
Linet is 27 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has 3 children and is married. As a group leader, Linet is representing her group of 12 farmers in Butere District in Kenya, and she is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Linet's desire to earn enough to feed her family. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

Linet and her group will receive a total of 12 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en: Forty-five-year-old Sergio is a sari-sari store owner from the community of San Miguel, Bohol. He is married with a 12-year-old son.  Sergio has been selling basic items to the community for 25 years now. He is asking for a loan to increase his inventory and to attract more customers. He will use it to buy canned goods, shampoo, dish washing liquid, chips, candies and seasoning. Sergio is aware of how a store that looks full attracts more buyers than the ones that lack displays. Sergio plans to expand his store and introduce more merchandise that he did not previously carry.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, shampoo, dish washing liquid, chips, candies and seasoning

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard engages in a crab vending business. He is a 26-year-old man from Talibon, Bohol. He has three young dependents. To have additional income, he also engages in selling Vita Plus products like health drink, coffee and beauty products. He is in need of capital to continue to operate his ongoing livelihood.

He is asking for a loan to buy stocks of crab and additional capital to purchase Vita Plus products. This will help Richard boost his sources of income. He could now cater to the needs of his customers and augment his income. 

In the future, Richard hopes to be successful in handling both his sources of income to support the needs of his growing children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of crab and to purchase Vita Plus products

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Rosa de Lima  está en su tercer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están a su vez dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza que les permitirá ir mejorando y creciendo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra.  Liz quien en su última encuesta mostro estar en una situación extrema de pobreza, que quiere ir superando por medio de las capacitaciones y el trabajo unido. Ella se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, con lo cual trabaja de una manera humilde para poder tener los medios para ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales para la venta, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en: The group called Santa Rosa de Lima is in its third cycle of the program of the committee for women. All the women are themselves within the program for eliminating poverty, which allows them to keep improving and growing. One of the members is Mrs. Liz, who in the latest survey was shown to be in a situation of extreme poverty, which she wants to overcome through the training and work together. She makes a living selling natural remedies, which works in a humble way to have the means to help her family. She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in buying natural remedies for sale, and with this she will be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell

loans.name: Jessica Katherine

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Carita De Ángel se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Tarqui  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Jessica, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 17, 15, 7 y 3 años de edad, los 3 mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es chofer.
Doña Jessica es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para contribuir con los gastos de la educación de sus hijos y los del hogar, ella al ver que a su marido no le alcanza con lo que el gana se decidió a emprender un negocio, vende ropa de todo tipo y  productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa cuando sus clientes quieren algo,  ella sale a recorrer en las mañanas mientras sus hijos más pequeños estudian, deja sus productos a  crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo para el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y todo lo que ella vende. Lleva más de 3 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella sale adelante. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The credit group Carita De Ángel (Angel Face) meet every fortnight in the Tarqui district of the city of Manta, a city well known for its beautiful beaches which are popular throughout the year, and for being a uniquely beautiful city with many tourist attractions. 

This is where Jessica lives, she is 32 and has a partner with whom she has four children, aged 17, 15, 7 and 3. The oldest three are in school and college. Her spouse is a driver.

Jessica is a lady who likes working in order to contribute to the costs of her children's education and household costs. She noticed that her spouse's income was not covering these costs, so she decided to set up a business selling various types of clothing, and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for ladies). 

She sells door to door, and also sells at home when her customers want to order something. She goes on her rounds in the mornings, while her youngest children are studying, delivers her products on credit, and then collects payments every week or two. She has been doing this for over four years, with which she earns a living for the good of her family.

This loan will be to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and everything that she sells. 

She has been a member of this credit group for over three years, which she likes as the loans help her to get ahead. 

Her dream is to give her children the best education possible.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Eber Alfredo

texts.es:
Eber tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su esposa e hijos en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana del distrito de Zaña, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio, cuenta con más de 6 años de antiguedad en el negocio y con buenas referencias en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería para incrementar el stock de su negocio, de esta manera Eber espera hacer crecer más su negocio lo que le generará mayores ingresos y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Eber is 35 years old and lives with his wife and children in a large community in the city of Zaña, an agricultural and livestock raising community located in Chiclayo province, in Lambayeque, on Peru's northern coast. For the last 6 years he has been running his own grocery store from his home, selling products such as rice, sugar, oil and noodles and he has established a good reputation for himself. He is applying for this loan so that he can buy a larger quantity of merchandise in order to increase his business stock level. Eber hopes that as a result of this loan he will be able to grow his business and increase his profits, which will allow him to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of merchandise so that he can increase his business stock level.

loans.name: Gissella Alexandra

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Carita De Ángel se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Tarqui  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señorita Gissella, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de los padres.
Doña Gissella es una joven que le gusta trabajar para forjarse un mejor porvenir, ella en sociedad con otra persona tiene un bar en un local que arriendan muy cerca de una playa de la localidad, este sector es muy concurrido y le permite obtener muy buenas ganancias, trabajan  de lunes a sábado casi todo el día, allí ellas vende bebidas, sodas, jugos y ciertos bocaditos de picar, solo llevan 7 meses con este negocio pero ha sido muy bueno ya que cada vez tienen más clientela con el paso de los días. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar cervezas, colas, aguas y otras bebidas para surtir su negocio. Lleva más de 2 ciclos en el Grupo Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y a bajos intereses. Sus metas son algún día tener su propio local.
texts.en:
The group De Crédito Carita De Ángel meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood Tarqui in the city of Manta.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited year round and for being a beautiful city with many tourist attractions.  

Here lives Gissella, 24 years old, who is single and lives in her parents' home.  Gissella is a young woman who likes to work in order to make a better future for herself.  She and another person have a bar in a place that they rent very near to the beach.  This area is very busy and it allows them to earn good money.  They work from Monday to Saturday, almost all day long.  There they sell drinks, sodas, juices and some snacks.  They have been doing this for seven months. It has gone very well and they continue to have more customers daily.  

This loan will be used to purchase beer, colas, waters and other drinks to supply their business.  She has more than two cycles in the Grupo Credito and she likes it because the loans are fast and the interest rate is low.  Her goal is to one day have her own store.

loans.use: to purchase beer, colas, waters and other drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling to her customers at better prices.

loans.name: Julius's Group

texts.en:
Julius, pictured above, has six children and is always described as a very experienced farmer, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Julius is representing his group of nine farmers in Butere District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Julius has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Julius is planning to buy a cow.

A total of 4.5 acres will be planted by Julius's Group, and between them they will receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 37 years old and married with four children, three of whom go to school in Kasese, Uganda. Moses sells and mines salt, a business he has operated for three years. He gets additional income from motorcycle transport and cattle farming. He has a dream of educating his children and enriching himself. Moses is faced with a challenge of the lack of protective gear while mining, which affects his health yet he has to provide for his family. Moses needs a loan to buy crude salt from other salt miners to sell.

loans.use: to buy crude salt from other salt miners to sell.

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Ruth, often described as an extremely friendly person. She is 45 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of eight farmers in Butere District, Kenya.  She is married and has four children.

Ruth is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Ruth says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2013, she has had more profits from each harvest, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Ruth will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 3.5 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Omurgazy

texts.ru: Омургазы, 44 года, женат, 2 детей. Он очень ответственный и доброжелательный. У Омургазы среднее образование, с 2000 года он занимается животноводством. Сегодня в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 3 овцы. Ежемесячный доход Омургазы составляет в среднем 15,000 сомов (KGS). Он обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS), на который купит корову для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Омургазы увеличить его хозяйство.
texts.en:
Omurgazy is 44 years old, married, and has 2 children. He is very responsible and kind. Omurgazy has a secondary education, and since 2000 he has been raising livestock. He now has 2 cows and 3 sheep on his farm. Omurgazy's monthly income averages 15,000 som (KGS). 

Omurgazy has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS), which he will use to buy a cow to increase the headcount of his herd. The profits from the loan will allow Omurgazy to enlarge his farm.

loans.use: to purchase a cow in order to increase the size of his herd.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is 38 years old and a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing a stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently to get a boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle the increasing demands of her customers efficiently

loans.name: Juma's Group

texts.en:
Juma is 69 years old and, as the group leader of his group, he is representing 9 farmers in Butere District. He is looking forward to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year, as this means he will have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. 

Juma has been a farmer for more than 40 years and is often described as a very experienced farmer. He decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. With the profits he earns from this coming season, Juma would like to buy a cow.

Between the 9 farmers in Juma’s Group, a total of 6 acres will be planted using the inputs from this loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is 28 years old. She is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Buguma Kulyanwa Group

texts.fr: Suite à une situation délicate liée à l'alimentation de sa famille, Mbirize a pris la résolution de s'adonner à la riziculture. Il espère que ce crédit lui permettra de répondre à son besoin de financement des travaux champêtres; et qu'une fois la production accrue, il pourra aisément assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et d'améliorer son habitat. Président du groupe BUGUMA KULYANA, il tient un carnet sur la photo.
texts.en: Following a delicate situation related to food in his family, Mbirize made the decision to devote himself to rice growing. He hopes that this loan will allow him to meet the financial needs of his fieldwork; and once the crops have grown, he will easily be able to pay for his children’s schooling and to improve his living situation. President of the BUGUMA KULYANA group, he is holding a pink booklet in the photo.

loans.use: to buy hoes and fertilizer and to prepare for harvest

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for labor, hoeing, and harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy secondhand shorts

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Rosa está en su quinto ciclo del programa de comités, todas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y que quieren salir adelante, todo esto para ir superando su situación de pobreza, por medio del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Entre todas se destaca la Sra. Rosa, Directora del Comité, quien es enfermera y además se encuentra trabajando en la elaboración y venta de comidas, es muy buena en lo que hace, y es por ello que le está yendo muy bien. Es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo muy luchadora que quiere salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne, y otros.
texts.en: The group called Santa Rosa is in its fifth cycle of program committees. All of the women are very hardworking and want to succeed. Through the program to eliminate poverty they will all overcome their situation of poverty. Among the members is Mrs. Rosa, director of the committee, who is a nurse and also is currently working in the preparation and sale of food. She is very good at what she does, and that is why she is doing very well. She is a very hard-working person and above all a fighter who wants to succeed and help her loved ones. She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making food such as vegetables, condiments, meats, etc.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, and meat among other things

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Medalla Milagrosa está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, son 20 mujeres muy trabajadoras y unidas que quieren ayudar a sus familias y a sus seres queridos todo por medio de su trabajo.
Ilda integra este grupo, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que a través de la venta de prendas usadas tiene los medios para ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Ella es una persona que quiere capacitarse y de esa forma ir creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas de segunda mano para la venta, como ser jeans, remeras, camisas y otros, y con ello poder seguir creciendo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en: The group called Medalla Milagrosa is in their first cycle of the women's committee program. There are 20 very hard-working and united women who want to help their families and loved ones through all their work. Ilda is a member of this group. She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman. Through the sale of used clothing she has the means to help her family and her loved ones. She is a person who wants to be trained, and in that way grow. She is requesting this loan to purchase second-hand clothing to sell, such as jeans, t-shirts, shirts, etc., and with this be able to continue to grow as she has done. She is grateful for the opportunity to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing like jeans, t-shirts, and shirts, among others

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia owns and operates a variety store. She has been successful in this business for years now, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income through her food stall business.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her profit. She is requesting an amount of PHP 10,000 to buy products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, in larger quantities.

Sofia hopes for her business to grow bigger and better. She dreams of giving her family a good life in the future. She meets with her fellowship group*  every week to share stories of her work and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Tongnooma Group

texts.fr:
Mme SOMPASEKDE est responsable du groupe TONGNOOMA. Elle se porte. Mariée, elle est maintenant mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 04ans et le moins âgé a 06mois. Personne ne va à l’école. Elle a 05personnes en charge.
Mme vend maintenant des pagnes et habits car elle a laisser la vente des condiments  depuis 03 mois. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter une demi balle de pagnes.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de prêt à porter et améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Mrs. SOMPASSEKDE is the head of the TONGNOOMA group. She is doing well. She is married with two children who do not yet go to school, a 6-month-old and a 4-year-old. She supports five people. 

Sompassekde stopped selling condiments three months ago to start selling pagnes and clothing. She buys her merchandise at the local market. She plans to buy half a bale of pagnes.

She wants to reinvest her profits in her activity. Her goals are to open a ready-to-wear clothing boutique and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy half a bale of pagnes for resale.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en: Bahati is 25 years old, single with two children and living in Kasese, Uganda. Despite the risks involved in salt mining, Bahati has persisted in the business of salt mining for five years in order to earn a living. He gets additional income from selling second-hand clothes. He dreams of becoming rich and expanding his business to new areas. He usually complains of long distances to the salt lake and the high cost to transport his goods to the customers. Bahati wants money to buy crude salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy crude salt to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy secondhand bed covers, bed sheets and pillow cases to sell.

loans.name: Kibwe Church Of Uganda Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a 42-year-old married male with six children. He is a member of Kibwe Church of Uganda and lives in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a general store shop has been in business for 10 years. He also earns a salary and practices farming to get additional income. He has a dream of educating his children to the university level. Joseph wants money to buy sugar, soap, cassava flour, maize flour and cooking oil to sell.

He is a member of Kibwe Church of Uganda Group where members guarantee one another for a loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, cassava flour, maize flour and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Hushruz

texts.ru:
Хушруз  родился 1993 году в семьи рабочего. Хушруз женат. Его жену зовут Наргис. Она студентка. Он очень жизнерадостный мужчина. Хушруз живет с семьей в доме, который сами построили. Хушруз живет вместе женой душа в душу. Хушруз мастер по ремонту автомобилей. 
Хушруз обратился в Арванд за кредитом для оплаты договора обучения своей жены. Он заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Hushruz was born in 1993 to a family of workers. Hushruz is married. His wife's name is Nargis, and she is a student. Hushruz is a very cheerful man. He lives with his family in a house that they built themselves, and he and his wife live together in perfect harmony. Hushruz is a master of repairing cars. 

Hushruz has applied to MDO Arvand for a loan to pay his wife's tuition. He is thankful in advance for the support and trust.

loans.use: to pay his wife's education costs.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 33 years old and a married woman. She has 6 children. 

Nusrat is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, thread, and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profits. 

This monetary help can take Nusrat closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, thread, and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profits.

loans.name: Tamanat

texts.en: Tamanat  is 31 years old, a single woman doing the business of animal purchase and sale for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food, and clothing. She has requested a loan of 40000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater for more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater for more customers.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is a 43-year-old proud father of 5 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 15 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, John has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

John described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize because he will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to rent more land to cultivate on.

With this loan, John’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Lila Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras (GEORGINA, LAURENDA, BEATRIZ) originarias de la comunidad de Lamlaya, en lengua miskita significa agua mansa, se localiza a 10 kilometros de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que lucha día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de mariscos, se organizaron hace aproximadamente un años para poder accesar a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. Decidieron nombrar al grupo LILA, porque es un color alegre, como las integrantes del grupo solidario.

Georgina: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer amable, pertenece a la etnia miskita, con cualidades de líder, casada, con  2 hijos: El mayor de 10 años estudia su tercer grado de primaria y un pequeño de 3 años de edad. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de pescado y mariscos, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar estudios de su hijo. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar más productos de mariscos y pescados, venderlos a precios accesibles e incrementar sus ingresos. Ella sueña con establecer una pulpería.

Con el primer crédito otorgado por Pana Pana y Financiado por KIVA, le permitieron a las integrantes del grupo solidario atender a más personas que demandan mariscos y pescados, que es un producto que constituye uno de los alimentos básicos en Puerto Cabezas y con las ganancias mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus familias.
texts.en:
This supportive group is made up of three enterprising women(GEORGINA, LAURENDA, BEATRIZ) natives to the community of Lamlaya, in the miskita language it means calm water.  It is located ten kilometros from the city of Bilwi, town of Puerto Cabezas.  

They are enterprising women who strive day to day to make their small seafood business grow.  They organized themselves a year ago to be able to secure loans in Pana Pana.  They decided to name the group LILA because it is a happy color, like the members of the solidary group.  

Georgina Is the coordinator of the group.  She is a friendly woman, a miskita woman with the qualities of a leader.  She is married with two children.  The older, ten years old, studies third grade and the younger is three years old.  For three years she has worked selling fish and shellfish.  In this manner she generates her own income and contributes to the expenses of the home and the studies of her son.  She is asking for financing to purchase more fish and shellfish products, sell them at accessible prices and increase her income.  She dreams of establishing a food store.  

With the first loan received through Pana Pana and financed through KIVA, the group was able to serve more people who wanted shellfish and fish, which is a product that constitutes one of the basic foods in Puerto Cabezas.  With the earnings they were able to better their lives as well as their families' lives.

loans.use: to purchase more shellfish and fish.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is 49 years old and a married woman. 

The man shown in the photo is Najma’s son, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Najma has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her son. He wants to buy new tires with some spare auto parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Najma is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some spare auto parts

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida, 44 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store with her husband who is also shown in the photo. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Abida needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, and juices to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store

loans.name: Mansab

texts.en: Mansab is a 44-year-old married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Mansab’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Mansab has requested 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Mutula Kiliba Onds Group

texts.fr: Initié par son père il y a 20 ans, Rubaduka éprouve beaucoup de joie lors de la récolte car ses revenus lui permettent de scolariser ses enfants. Très souvent, il a beaucoup de difficultés de faire face aux différentes charges champêtres mais il espère qu'ils seront réglées grâce à ce crédit. Il projette améliorer son habitat, ses conditions de vie et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants. Sur la photo, Rubaduka est souriant et tient un carnet rose dans sa main. Il préside le groupe MUTULA KILIBA ONDS.
texts.en: Initiated by his father 20 years ago, Rubaduka feels a lot of joy during the harvest, as his revenues allow him to pay for his children’s education. Very often, he has a lot of difficulties being able to pay for the different field expenses, but he hopes that this loan will rectify that. He plans to improve his home and living conditions and to ensure the education of his children. In the photo, Rubaduka is smiling and holding a pink notebook. He is president of the MUTULA KILIBA ONDS group.

loans.use: to pay for hoeing, fertilizer, and phytosanitary products

loans.name: Vidalina

texts.es:
La señora Vidalina es una microempresaria de  28 años, está casada con el Sr. Ranulfo con quien tiene 4 hijos, su esposo es policía, y ambos se esfuerzan para poder apoyar la economía de la casa.
Actualmente ella tiene una despensa muy bien surtida de productos de primera necesidad, bebidas, y otros, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante. Ella poco a poco y con la ayuda de su marido quieren salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su despensa, como ser: bebidas, lácteos, verduras, frutas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Vidalina is a 28 year old micro-entrepreneur, she is married to Ranulfo, and together they have four children. Her husband is a policeman and they both make an effort to support the household financially. 

She currently has a store well stocked with essential goods, drinks etc. She is a hardworking lady who is willing to fight to get ahead. Together with the help of her husband, they are hoping to progress.

She is requesting this loan to buy goods for her store, such as drinks, dairy, vegetables, and fruit, among other things. This way she will be able to continue with her work as she has been doing

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy, vegetables, and fruit, among others

loans.name: Mujeres Dinamicas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “mujeres dinámicas” está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo, de la ciudad de Concepción,  la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento.
La Sra. Maria es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad donde sale a vender sus ropas de ao poì que ella misma confecciona. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su grupo, vaya mejorando cada día.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra telas de ao poi, y con ello poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando por poder crecer y salir adelante. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en: The group called "Mujeres Dinámicas" is in their first cycle of the women's committee program. They are a new group in the city of Concepción, which is in an area a little remote from the central area and is still growing. Mrs. Maria is one of the members. She is in a remote area from the centre of the city where she sells her ao po'i (cotton cloth) clothing which she herself makes. She hopes that as time goes by, and through the help of everyone in the group, she improves every day. She is requesting this loan to purchase ao po'i (cotton) cloth, and thus be able to continue her work, fighting to grow and succeed. She is grateful for the opportunity to be able to grow and succeed.

loans.use: to buy ao po'i (cotton) cloth to make ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Leornarda

texts.en:
Leornarda is a 38-year-old married woman with a 12-year-old son. Together with her family, she lives in Antequera, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items like canned goods, cooking oil, soap, condiments, beverages, soft drinks, and noodles. She also runs a hog-raising business.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her store and additional piglets for her hog-raising business. The loan will help her to improve the content and variety of products available in her store, to help her attract more buyers and slowly increase her income. Thus, she will be able to pay her obligations and start to expand her business.

Leornarda is very grateful for the loan that is available to her, and she hopes that she will be able to improve and manage her business successfully in the near future for sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store and additional piglets for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Bilia's Group

texts.en:
Bilia, pictured above, has been a farmer for eight years, and is now proud to represent her group of twelve farmers in Butere District. She is 38 years old, is married and has five children.

Bilia likes to think of herself as a very experienced farmer. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. Bilia plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy more land to cultivate.

In total, Bilia’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor tiene 66 años de edad, de estado civil separado, vive en el distrito de Pomahuaca, en dicho distrito sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, region Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de arroz en buen estado en etapa de sembrado, además se dedica a la venta de fruta, cuenta con muy buenas refrencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El destino del crédito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de arroz y asi poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Flor, 66 years old, is separated. She lives in the district of Pomahuaca. In said district, her main employment is agriculture, trade and livestock. She is located in the Jaén Province, Cajamarca Region, in the Northern mountain range of Perú. 

She makes a living by farming. She has rice crops, in good condition, in the seedling stage. She also sells fruit. She has very good personal and work references in her district. The loan will be used for the purchase of manure and fertilizers. This will allow her to maintain her rice crop, and thus to acquire an acceptable profit, to improve her income, and therefore her quality of life, and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to maintain her rice crop.

loans.name: Anne's Group

texts.en:
Anne is 34 years old and is often described as a very trustworthy person. She has three children and is married. As a group leader, Anne is representing her group of thirteen farmers in Butere District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Anne's desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her, as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

Anne and her group will receive a total of seven solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Benjamin's Group

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 58-year-old proud father of eight children. He is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing his group of thirteen farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Benjamin has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Benjamin described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge his phone. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Benjamin’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of fourteen solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mukono Boarding School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Damalie. She is the head teacher of Mukono Boarding Primary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Mukono, with 700 students. 

Mukono Boarding School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent, clean drinking water and, therefore, has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. 

Installing a water filtration system will, therefore, save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Mukono Boarding School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Damalie ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Jannat

texts.en:
Jannat is a 43-year-old married mother of three children. In order to help her husband take care of the family, she sells both milk and animals, earning enough to contribute to the family's income.  

Jannat has requested a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase more animals to increase her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to generate more income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy brooms and cassava paste.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
El Triunfo es un grupo formado por amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Caaguazú, está en el 9no ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 8  de las integrantes se encuentran en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sady, quien es una de las personas que se encuentra en una situación de pobreza extrema, ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de las ventas ambulantes que hace, tiene los ingresos necesarios para poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Es una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora que quiere ser alguien en la vida.
La Sra. Sady  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de productos varios para la venta, como blusas, pantalones, remeras, camisas, zapatos, bijouteries, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en: El Triunfo is a group of friends and neighbours in the city of Caaguazú. They are in their ninth cycle of the women's committee program, where all work and help to succeed. They are doing the survey of poverty elimination, and 8 of the members are in extreme poverty. One of the members is Mrs. Sady, who is one of the people who is in a situation of extreme poverty. Through effort, continued work, and travelling sales she has the income necessary to give her family what she never had. She is a vey selfless and determined woman who wants to be someone in life. Mrs. Sady is requesting this loan to purchase various products to sell, such as blouses, pants, t-shirts, shirts, shoes, and costume jewellery. This will help her realize her business plan, which will help improve her income. All the members are grateful for the opportunity they receive to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy various products to sell, such as blouses, pants, t-shirts, shirts, shoes, costume jewellery, etc.

loans.name: Duncan's Group

texts.en:
Duncan is a 42-year-old proud father of five children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of ten farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Duncan has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Duncan described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Duncan’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Isaa's Group

texts.en:
Isaa, pictured above, has been a farmer for fifteen years, and is now proud to represent his group of ten farmers in Butere District. He is 45 years old, is married and has seven children.

Isaa likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has had more profits from each harvest. Isaa plans to use the profits from this coming season to invest in a business.

In total, Isaa’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate six acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Juma's Group

texts.en:
Juma is a 54-year-old proud father of seven children. He is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing his group of twelve farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Juma has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Juma described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Juma’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of ten solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Joseline's Group

texts.en:
Joseline, the leader of her group in Butere District, is representing 12 farmers, including herself. Married and a proud mother of four children, Joseline joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for more than 20 years.

Like many other farmers, Joseline decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to earn enough to feed her family. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers who have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to send her children to school.

Joseline's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 8.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of nine solar lights, as some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is a butcher who does farming also to supplement. He is aged 29 and married with two children living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He is in need of a loan to buy cattle for slaughtering to sell. His future plan is to buy land for settlement and to establish a modernized butchery with preserving machines like a refrigerator to keep the meat fresh. He faces hardships of inadequate capital and price fluctuations of cattle.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for slaughtering to sell.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a 52-year-old lady who is married with six children. She lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She trades in cattle and owns a retail shop as sources of income. She is requesting a loan to buy cattle to sell.

Her business plan is to strengthen the business by increasing the working capital, whereas her family goal is to educate her children. Joy complains of price fluctuations, prolonged drought, and inadequate capital to buy enough stock.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, a married man with four children, is a resident of Kyenjojo-Uganda. His main business is cattle trading, alongside dairy sales. This is a business he started with an aim of meeting his family‘s increasing needs. 

Despite being challenged by prolonged droughts leading to lack of water and pastures for his animals and inadequate capital, Paul is determined to take his business to greater heights by trading in better markets with the best prices plus educating his children from the best schools. He intends to use the loan to buy cattle for selling.

loans.use: to buy cattle for selling.

loans.name: Said's Group

texts.en:
Said's Group is formed by 12 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Said, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 54 years old,  married, and has four children. Said has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Said isn’t new to One Acre Fund; he actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year, Said will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Said's Group will purchase a total of eight solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Stephen's Group

texts.en:
Stephen, a 36-year-old married father of three, is often described as a very friendly person. As a group leader, Stephen is representing nine farmers in Butere District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Stephen's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

Stephen and his group will receive a total of six solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of four acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mzisadar

texts.en:
Mzisadar is a 41-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, pensioner mother, and son in the small village of Senaki district. 

The family has a plot of land, where they grow nut trees and sell the harvest locally. Mzisadar wants to start a husbandry business and requested a loan for purchasing a cow. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,500 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase a cow and will start producing dairy products. 

This will increase her family income and with increased income, Mzisadar will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Sylvester's Group

texts.en:
Sylvester is a 39-year-old proud father of six children. He is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing his group of eight farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Sylvester has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Sylvester described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Sylvester’s Group will be able to plant a total of 3.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Cornel's Group

texts.en:
Cornel is a 77-year-old proud father of nine children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of ten farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Cornel has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Cornel described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Cornel’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Abel's Group

texts.en:
Abel, pictured above, has five children and is always described as a very friendly person, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Abel is representing his group of 14 farmers in Butere District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Abel has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. 

His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Abel is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 7.25 acres will be planted by Abel's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Dila

texts.en:
Dila, a villager and a 57-year-old woman, is married and is a mother of four. She is being photographed inside the animal stable that she plans on repairing. She also plans to buy a dairy cow. 

Dila has been doing agriculture and livestock for the past 15 years. She has one dairy cow at the moment and she sells roughly 12 liters of row milk per day, at a price of approximately USD 0.4 per liter. She also sells one calf a year, at an approximate price of USD 600. 

From the fresh agricultural products that she produces herself, she sells dried beans and cabbage.  For her personal use, she has about 20 chickens and she plants seasonal vegetables and has some orchards, like plums, cherries, peaches, and grapes.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and repair the animal stable.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle for fattening and sell them

loans.name: Mujeres De Trinidad Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres de trinidad  está integrado por 19 mujeres, todas ellas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que gracias al esfuerzo de todas ya están en su ciclo número 3 del programa de mujeres emprendedoras.
La Sra. Leonidas, una de las integrantes, quien tiene una despensa surtida, es una persona que está creciendo y luchando cada día y quiere ir mejorando es por ello que busca capacitarse.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas como jugos y gaseosas y golosinas, para poder seguir con su negocio bien surtido como lo viene haciendo. Es una persona muy buena en lo que hace, y está con muchas ganas de poder crecer.
texts.en:
The group called “Mujeres de Trinidad” is composed of 19 women, all of them very hard-working and enterprising.  Thanks to the efforts of all of them they are in their third cycle of the program of women entrepreneurs.

Leonidas, one of the members, has a small grocery store.  She is a person who is growing and persisting every day.  She wants to improve and it is for this reason that she is looking for training.

She is asking for this loan to buy drinks such as juices and soda pop and also snacks.   In this way she can continue with her business well-supplied as she has been doing.  She is a very good person in what she does and has much desire to be able to grow.

loans.use: to buy drinks such as juices, soda pop and also snacks to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary lives in rural Lyantonde. She does agriculture: both farming and animal rearing but on a small scale.

Because she needed a source of income, she resorted to rearing the goats and then selling them. She would buy the goats from farmers within the community, who were having challenges of cash, at a cheap price and then rear them and sell at a profit. She has since progressed and the business is growing steadily. She is able to educate her children and also meet their needs. Rosemary is hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy goats for fattening and selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle for trade.

loans.name: Asman's Group

texts.en:
Asman is a 52-year-old proud father of nine children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of nine farmers in Butere District. 

Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Asman has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.  Asman described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge his phone. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Asman’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Bektash

texts.en:
Bektash is in the photograph with Sadet, his wife, who has been sick for long time now and on a continual basis she must visit health practitioners.  They are both parents and the loan that Bektash is requesting will be used to pay for her medical expenses.  

They live in a village that is way too dry according to the villagers; it doesn’t have running water all the time and there is only one water tap in the center of the village where almost all villagers line up everyday for two hours to fill their buckets with water, most of the time arguing with one another about the water supply or the scarcity of the water. During the winter months they melt snow instead.

For the past 15 years, Bektash’s focus has been on livestock; he’s got some sheep and sells raw milk and lambs to locals. In the agricultural land he owns, he plants fodder only for his animals.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's medical expenses which are ongoing

loans.name: Tzununa Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank group 'Tzununa' is located in the small, Kakchiquel-speaking Maya village of Tzununa, located on the shores of the beautiful Lake Atitlan. The ladies of Tzununa have successfully finished their first loan cycle with Kiva investors. The loans were of great benefit for their small businesses. 
 
Lucía is the 28-year-old President of Tzununa. She is responsible for making certain that all the meetings run smoothly and loans are paid on time. Lucía sells snacks in her store and is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory.  She also wants to expand and sell turkeys that are very marketable in the nearby city of Solola. She is requesting a new loan for both businesses and is hopeful that Kiva investors will learn of her businesses.

Lucía is a very feisty woman who believes that even without a formal education, she can improve the quality of her life. That is why she enjoys the monthly trainings that the Friendship Bridge Trust Officer provides. Lucía especially likes the trainings on women’s issues - self-esteem, empowerment, health and hygiene. The business management trainings are also extremely useful. Topics like accounting, bookkeeping, and customer service and marketing help her grow and make her business very successful.

The members of the Trust Bank Tzununa group, along with Lucía, are very happy with Kiva investors’ loan and for their unconditional support. Thank you!

loans.use: to buy supplies for her snack business.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David, who is a cattle trader, is a single parent aged 33 with two children living in Kyenjojo,Uganda.  He also deals in milk sales to supplement his income. He ventured into business to be able to support his family who lacks a mother. His future plan is to get married and supply his cattle across borders where prices are high. David will use the loan to buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Y Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo “mujeres alegres y trabajadoras” está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción,  la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, y que lucha por crecer, ya que es una zona eminentemente rural.
La Sra. Maria es una de las integrantes, ella vende harina de maíz que ella misma prepara, compra el maíz, lo procesa y de eso tiene la harina de maíz para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere ser alguien en la vida, y con ello poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar maíz en cantidad, y con ello poder seguir haciendo sus productos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group “Mujeres Alegres y Trabajadoras” is in their first cycle of the program of the committee of women.  It is in the city of Concepcion, which is in an area a bit far from the central area and still is growing. It is an area difficult to access and that fights to grow since it is an especially rural area. 

Maria is one of the members.  She sells corn flour that she prepares herself.  She buys the corn, processes it and in this way she has the corn flour to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.  She is a hard-working and enterprising person who wants to be someone in life and in this way be able to help her loved ones.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy corn in quantity and with this be able to continue making her products to help her family.

loans.use: to buy corn to make corn flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fifty 100-kg sacks of cereals for resale.

loans.name: Yunus's Group

texts.en:
Yunus, pictured above, has eight children and is always described as a very experienced farmer, which is why he was selected to become the group leader of his group. Yunus is representing his group of 13 farmers in Butere District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Yunus has been a farmer for more than 30 years and, in order to earn enough to send his children to school, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Yunus is planning to send his children to school.

A total of nine acres will be planted by Yunus's Group, and between them, they will receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Wilfred's Group

texts.en:
Wilfred, pictured above, has six children and is always described as a very experienced farmer, which is why he was selected to become the leader of his group. Wilfred is representing his group of 13 farmers in Butere District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Wilfred has been a farmer for 15 years and, in order to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, he decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting as that means he will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Wilfred is planning to buy a cow.

A total of six acres will be planted by Wilfred's Group, and between them, they will receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Nyakisi Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Joseph, a member of Nyakisi Tweyimukye group, is a married man man living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He is a farmer who also carries out produce buying and selling. Because of the need to have an established source of income, he ventured into business. He has a great desire of being economically well off and buying a motor vehicle to ease his movements. Joseph complains of price fluctuations of produce limiting his expected returns. He will use the loan to buy maize to sell.

He is a member of Nyakisi Tweyimukye group, where members guarantee one another for a loan since they don't pledge security.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver. Gabriel has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story: "It's been more than 30 years since I got started in handcrafted jewelry,' says Gabriel. 'Now is when I most treasure what I enjoy doing, because it has allowed me to bring food to the table and provide my children with an education." "This microcredit will allow me to invest in important materials and continue growing as an artisan. It will really feed my creativity and bring me joy. Thanks for all your support." Use the link below to view Gabriel's handcrafted jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/8680

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver

loans.name: Taj

texts.en: Taj is a 54-year-old married woman. She work on hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy spools of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hoping to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams of her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa works as a kitchen helper in a restaurant in La Paz, while her husband works as a doorman. Although Teresa is in a better job, the money she makes is not enough to feed her family or to support the home. Teresa's eldest daughter is going to college now, and she needs your help. Teresa is asking for a loan to buy a laptop for her daughter. It will be very useful for her to do her homework and other things. 

This picture shows Teresa (on the right) with her husband and their daughter, who will be using the laptop

loans.use: to buy a laptop for her daughter.

loans.name: Mujeres La Union Group

texts.en:
Santa Cruz el Quiche is the capital of the Guatemalan Department of El Quiche in the Western Highlands.  The city has an ancient history.  It was founded by Pedro de Alvarado after he burned the Maya capital city of Q'umarkaj where some believe the Maya sacred book “Popol Vuh” was written.  It is here that eight members of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, Mujeres La Unión, meet monthly.  The group is asking Kiva investors for their very first loan.

One of the members is 62-year-old Juana who for many years has had a business selling typical Guatemalan clothing called traje. The outfits consist of huipiles (blouses) and cortes (skirts).  Juana is asking for a loan to increase her inventory of merchandise, especially a variety of new cortes, more huipiles, and fajas (belts).  She also wants to buy a variety of accessories that her clients are requesting. 

Juana is extremely pleased to be receiving a Kiva loan because, with the funds, she is able to increase her income.  And, through the Friendship Bridge Microcredit Plus program, that combines loans and education, she is a better business-woman.  At the monthly meetings, she has learned accounting and bookkeeping techniques, as well as customer service and marketing.  Juana is very grateful to Kiva investors for providing the financial support that has helped her to grow and helped to increase her income.  She says, “Mil gracias!”

loans.use: to buy a variety of new cortes (skirts), more huipiles (blouses), and fajas (belts) to sell.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 35 years old, married and has four school-aged kids. The family lives in Banglay, Tangub City. Ellen is engaged in running a grocery store. She has been operating her business for five years, and earns a monthly net income of 3,500 PHP. 

In 2012, Ellen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and develop her skills and business ideas. Ellen has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Ellen is now requesting her seventh loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more kilos of fruit to sell.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of fruit to sell.

location.town: Tangub - Banglay, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Glenna

texts.en: Glenna has started her small sari-sari (general store) business and has become profitable. This has helped her sustain the basic needs for her family. She has managed to have enough inventory and has used her capital to gain more profit. Everyday she made good sales because of her good salesmanship and characteristic effort. Recently she approached Paglaum for her much needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. In the future, she hopes to arrange a decent house for the family.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Ibrahim's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Ibrahim, often described as an extremely experienced farmer. He is 50 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of eight farmers in Butere District, Kenya.  He is married and has three children.

Ibrahim is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place.
