Concepción is 48 years old. She lives with her husband and two children. She spends her working hours alternating between agriculture and raising farm animals. She is very responsible and has been in the business for a long time. She is very sucessful and she wishes she can cotinue working to support her family.
She is asking for this loan to buy seeds and compost.
All the members of the group are very grateful for this loan and are committed to re-pay it on the scheduled dates.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica engages in a basketweaving business. She weaves and sells native baskets  and delivers them to her respective customers. She is a 45-year-old  married woman with three children from Antequera, Bohol. Her oldest child is 18 and the youngest is 10.

She is asking for a loan to purchase materials like wicker (pliable twigs) and uway (twisted rope). These materials will help produce more baskets to weave. Thus, she could now slowly improve her earnings and start to handle her business. She could be able to prepare healthy foods and continue to send her children to school.

In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase materials like wicker (pliable twigs), uway (twisted rope)  and nito (palm)

loans.name: Renato

texts.en: Renato is a hardworking father who is requesting a loan from Paglaum MPC, which he will use to increase inventory for his peanut processing business. He wants to pay for more kilos of peanuts and buy additional cooking equipment and utensils. This way, he will be able to sell more of his products made with peanuts, which will allow him to earn more money and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for more kilos of peanuts and buy additional cooking equipment and utensils

loans.name: Jamel

texts.en:
This is Jamel. He previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more quantities and varieties of accessory products needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another loan of 25,000 PHP to buy additional merchandise items and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jamel wants to expand his business soon for he desires to give his family a good life. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for various accessories and merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert sends you his thanks for your generosity because his previous loan has enriched his business. He was able to buy raw materials and supplies which are needed in his printing business. The loan also helped him provide for his family's daily needs and expenditures.

He is very positive that he could improve his business more if you will let him borrow again in the amount of 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies like paint, screen, and shirts he needs to improve his services and increase his profits. Aside from shirt printing, he also offers tarpaulin and signage printing.

Gilbert hopes to grow his business. He desires to meet his family's daily needs and be able to give more to his children. He meets every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies there.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials like paint, screens, and shirts.

loans.name: Chhun Lieng

texts.en: Chhun Lieng and his wife (both in the picture standing in their house), are farmers with three children in Koh Tamov village. As farmers for over 34 years, Chhun Lieng and wife hope to have a better and more comfortable lifestyle. They devote themselves to working hard with their farming on one hectare of land. Living in a village off of the power grid, Chhun Lieng has experienced difficulty using a car battery. A car battery is unpredictable as to when it will run out, and it also has a shorter and shorter life span after many months' usage. After he saw neighborhoods are so satisfied and live in convenient conditions because of solar home systems, he and his wife decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy high-quality home solar energy. They believe their family condition would be better and safer. They also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for solar home systems

location.town: Koh Tamov Village, Kampong Preahkorki Commune, Bor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for solar home systems

loans.name: Sumber Usaha Group

texts.en:
During six months of maintaining her pigs, Ni Wayan has had no difficulties and problems. She sold all of her piglets after the sow gave birth to 10 healthy piglets, and she earns 400,000 IDR profit per month.This profit increased more than the previous period because the price for superior piglets also increased this month. Because she had a good result, her husband gave full support for her business. This effort proved to fullfill her family’s needs. 

Now, Ni Wayan and other members of the Sumber Usaha group decided to have a new loan to continue the business. Their main goal is to have enough capital by saving, stop getting loans and continue the business with their own money. The needs of today's life are very expensive, and it forces everyone to work hard to make ends meet. Ni Wayan cannot just rely on the income of her husband, she also has to work. Raising pigs is one solution. She got a loan which she used to renovate the cages and she used the rest for feed. Her husband helped her to raise pigs. He feeds and cleans the cage every day. By having a clean, large cage and food hygiene, Ni Wayan hopes the pigs will be healthy and thrive.

loans.use: to renovate the cages and use the rest for feed

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities of grocery items and meat products to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to pay for meat, fish and vegetable products and groceries she needed in her business. The more products displayed at her stall the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mercy dreams of growing and expanding her business and hopes that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners gathering each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fresh and processed meat and add some grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Leus

texts.en:
Leus sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expense of her children and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stock of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

In the future, Leus hopes to grow her business as well as improve the living conditions of her family and give her children a better education. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 31 years old and married with two children. With one child still in school, Janice works very hard to provide for them.

Janice runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like noodles, coffee, canned goods and other groceries.

Janice has been in this business for seven years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like noodles, coffee, canned goods and other items

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 63 years old and married with children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

Cristina has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products

loans.name: Maryuvis Matilde

texts.es:
Ella es Maryuris una empresaria que sueña ser exitosa, con poder tener un almacén gigante de calzado, prosperar, que su familia siempre este unida, por cierto ella es madre de dos hijas de 7 y 9 años de edad, sus pequeñas princesas que representan todo para ella y una de las razones por las cuales en el año 2014 decidió montar su negocio de venta de calzado, iniciando como informal ya que carece de recursos para montar un almacén pero la idea es llegar a hacerlo.

Maryuris es una mujer casada, pero al ver que su esposo ya no podía generar los recursos suficientes para mantener el hogar inicio con su negocio y en este encontró una pasión.

Sus metas son generar recursos para pagar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar las condiciones y en un futuro montar un almacén.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de sandalias (producto que sostiene en la foto), que inicialmente es la línea que más se está amoviendo debido a su economía y que combinan con muchas prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
This is Maryuris, she is a businesswoman who dreams of being successful, and being able to have an enormous warehouse full of footwear, to prosper, and that her family can be together. She is the mother of two daughters who are 7 and 9 years old. Her young princesses mean everything to her, and one of the reasons that in the year 2014 she decided to open her footwear business, starting informally as she does not have the resources to have a warehouse, but the idea is to achieve this.
Maryuris is a married woman, but upon seeing that her husband could no longer generate enough income to maintain the home, she started the business and found her passion.
Her goals are to generate an income to pay for the education of her children, improver their condition, and in the future build a warehouse.
She asks for a loan to purchase a stock of sandals (product she holds in the photograph), which initially is the most sold line of footwear, as they are cheap and can be combined with many outfits.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sandals.

loans.name: Abner Abel

texts.es:
Abner es una persona muy entregada a su trabajo, sencillo, humilde, trabajador, honrado, respetuoso y responsable, atienda un negocio donde oferta alimentos y bebidas en un local que adecuo.

Inicio con su negocio a inicios del presente año lleno de ilusiones y sueños, ser una empresa modelo, generar buenos ingresos, no tener que pasar necesidades, comprar vivienda, ha querido crecer, vender más productos pero la falta de capital para invertir en esto ha sido su principal impedimento.

Abner quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá valiosamente en mercancía para expandir su portafolio de servicios, con este préstamo podrá ofrecer mayor variedad de bebidas, como refrescos, jugos naturales, comidas como palos de queso, pasteles de pollo, sanduches, entre otros.
texts.en:
Abner is a person very dedicated to his job, straightforward, humble, hard-working, honest, respectful, and responsible, he tends his business where he offers foods and drinks in a venue that he adapted.

He started his business at the start of this year, full of hopes and dreams, to be a model business, generate good income, not have to pass on necessities, buy a house, he wanted to grow, sell more products, but he lacks capital to invest; this has been his main impediment.

Abner wants to ask for a loan which he will invest valuably in merchandise to expand his portfolio of services. With this loan he will be able to offer a wider variety of drinks, like soft drinks, fresh juice, food like cheese sticks, chicken pies, sandwiches, among others.

loans.use: to increase his portfolio to offer his clients (drinks, like soft drinks, fresh juices, foods like cheese sticks, chicken pies, sandwiches, among others)

loans.name: Ma. Consuelo

texts.en:
Ma. Consuelo sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 40,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stocks of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Ma. Consuelo hopes that her business will continue to flourish. She dreams that her family will always be completely happy. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lanylyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Lanylyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Lanylyn is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy additional utensils and other ingredients such as meat, fish, chicken, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Lanylyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and other ingredients such as meat, fish, chicken, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Eveling Jannet

texts.es:
Eveling Jannet, tiene 24 años de edad, es estudiante de la carrera universitaria de Contabilidad, actualmente se encuentra en el cuarto año de su carrera. Paralelamente trabaja en una empresa pequeña como asistente contable. Eligió esta carrera porque le gustaba mucho la organización y llevar cuentas y actualmente le agrada mas ya que hay mucha mas demanda de profesionales contables.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el pago de un curso de especialización de contabilidad que requisito para avanzar en sus estudios y lograr su titulo profesional.
texts.en:
Eveling Jannet is 24 years old and a university student studying accounting. Now she is in the fourth year of her major.

At the same time, she is working at a small company as an accounting assistant. She chose this major because she really liked organization and managing accounts. Now she is more pleased because there is a lot more demand for accounting professionals. 

She will invest the loan she receives in paying for an accounting specialization course that is required to advance in her studies and to earn her professional title.

loans.use: to pay for an accounting major specialization course

loans.name: Juvilte

texts.en:
Juvilte is 34 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are still in school and Juvilte works very hard to provide for them.

Juvilte runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, milk and other personal care products.

Juvilte has been in this business for seven years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, milk and other personal care products

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa hails from the town of Antequera, Bohol.  She is a mother of six grown children. She makes and sells native baskets made of palm.  She has been engaged in weaving baskets for more than 10 years. Her husband earns a living by farming. 

Rosa has requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to buy materials like nito (palm), uway (twisted rope), and wicker (pliable twigs).  These are very essential tools that are needed in the production of baskets. In this way, Rosa could weave and sell more baskets to her customers. Thus, her daily income will increase and she can handle her finances.

She hopes that, with the capital she borrows, she can really help to improve the family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy materials like nito( palm), uway (twisted rope), and wicker (pliable twigs)

loans.name: Sherilyn

texts.en:
From Silang Cavite, Sherilyn has been an active member of CCT for almost three years now and she was able to acquire several loans to make a good profit from her business. At the age of 33, she is helping her husband to provide for their daily needs and she was inspired to improve their lives because she wants to give her children the best for their future. She works hard each day and she is pretty sure that she is closer to reaching her goals.

Sherilyn owns a variety store. She believes that business is her stepping stone to making her dreams happen. She knows how important it is for her neighbors and daily consumers to have a nearby store where they can buy a sachet of shampoo, a bar of soap, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, an egg, a toothpaste or even an ice tube. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price and then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to have profit.

She desires to manage a bigger store someday so she is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan, which she will use to buy additional groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She is positive that she will become a successful businesswoman in the future and she looks forward to seeing her children finish their studies through all her hard work and perseverance.

Sherilyn meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Fe is 42 years old and three of her children are currently in school.

Ma. Fe has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Fe has requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Medelyn

texts.en:
Medelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy kitchenwares and utensils for her restaurant business.

Medelyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Medelyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy kitchenwares and utensils for her restaurant.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en: Delfina is taking a loan of $1,500 USD to improve her business. She runs a minishop that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy shoes, socks, bags, shirts and pants to sell. She opened her minishop a year ago with her own working capital of $600.  She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy shoes, socks, bags, shirts and pants to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a used clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Rosalie is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more used clothes to resell.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dreams of saving money to expand her business and continuing to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Maria Mae

texts.en:
Maria Mae is 37 years old and married with four children. With three children still in school, Maria Mae works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Mae runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, noodles, milk, coffee, spices, cooking oil and other groceries.

Maria Mae has been in this business for six years.

She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, noodles, milk, coffee, spices, cooking oil, and other groceries

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela es una mujer de 62 años, soltera, tiene un hijo independiente y su negocio es la venta de refrescos y empanadas.
Ella es emprendedora, optimista, de buena actitud, comprensiva, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Plan 3000’ que se caracteriza por los orígenes de sus pobladores, que son inmigrantes; Aymarás, Quechuas y Guaraníes, localizado al sur de la ciudad, donde se asentaron y formaron un gran comercio, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados. 
Micaela es de tez morena, ojos pardos, estatura mediana, cabello blanco lo usa largo, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus familiares que son mayores de edad, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de forma ambulante de empanadas y refrescos. Las empanadas son alimentos fritos en aceite rellenos de carne de res o carne de pollo con huevo y papas, mayormente son consumidos antes del mediodía. Su forma de trabajo es independiente, por lo que debe cargar y cocinar sola y sin ayuda de nadie, “mi negocio es muy conocido, por las mañanas la mayoría de los que trabajan por el lugar se acercdan a saciar su hambre...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que ya lleva bastante tiempo en el lugar y los clientes son continuos, la desventaja es que todo el trabajo lo realiza sola. Su sueño es tener un puesto fijo de venta para no tener que cargar con su carro todos los días, ella desea reparar un cuarto de su casa para poder vender comida. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 11 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Micaela solicita un préstamo para refaccionar un cuarto de su casa para abrir un puesto de venta de comida y dejar de vender ambulantemente.
texts.en:
Micaela is a 62-year-old woman, single, who has an independent son, and her business is selling drinks and empanadas. 

She is enterprising, optimistic, with a positive attitude, compassionate, responsible, and hard-working. She develops her business in the 'Plan 3000' zone which is characterized by the origins of its inhabitants, who are immigrants; Aymarás, Quechuas and Guaraníes, located in the south of the city, where they settled and formed high-value trade. It is a warm tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade. 

Micaela has a dark complexion, brown eyes, medium height, white hair she wears long, robust physical composition. Her mother tongue is guaraní which is spoken in the family and she speaks Spanish in the general public and in the business that she does. She shares her life with her relatives who are older in age. They live in their own house constructed from brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof that has potable water, electricity, and plumbing.

Her business is selling empanadas and drinks by foot. Empanadas are food fried in oil filled with beef or chicken meat with egg and potatoes. Usually they are consumed before midday. Her form of work is independent, so she has to carry and sell herself and without the help of anyone, "My business is very well-known, in the morning most of those who work in the area come by to satiate their hunger..." she comments.

The advantage of her business is that it has been in that place for a long time and the customers are continuous. The disadvantage is that she does all of her work alone. Her dream is to have a fixed stall to sell so that she does not have to carry her cart every day. She wants to prepare a room in her house to be able to sell food. This is the second in the sequence of loans with the institution in the 11 years that she has been doing this work. 

It is for those reasons that Micaela asks for a loan to remodel a room in her house to open a food stall and stop selling by foot.

loans.use: to remodel a room in her house to open a food stall and stop selling by foot.

loans.name: Faatupu

texts.en:
Faatupu is 48 years old and married with six children. She runs a small business selling noodles, popcorn, ice cakes and snacks in her community and has been doing this for three years. 

Faatupu has requested a loan to buy cooking oil, shopping bags, corn flour, cooking pots, etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faatupu will use her profit to support her family and her children as well.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, cooking pots, shopping bags and sugar.

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
This is Luzvilla. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has enriched her business. She was able to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is positive that she could improve her business more if you will again loan her an amount of 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go to buying additional supplies of accessories and spare parts for their tricycle units. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family if the units are regularly maintained and in good condition.

Luzvilla wants to buy another tricycle for her transportation business. She only dreams of a simple, yet healthy life for her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of their two tricycle units.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is 28 years old and married with two children; both of them are being sent to school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gerlie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Gerlie has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Gerlie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 33 years old and married with one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marivic has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

Marivic has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Iusitina

texts.en:
Iusitina is 27 years old and single with 2 children. For 3 years she has run a small business selling pancakes in her community. Iusitina has requested a loan to buy a frying pan, sugar, flour, and yeast. 

She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Iusitina will use her profits to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her business.

loans.name: Percys

texts.en:
Percys is a young mother and businesswoman from Tudela. She operates a store for a living. She has this business for four years.

In 2013, she signed up for her membership in Paglaum for access to capital. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities. She wants to purchase inventory of sugar, milk, oil and canned goods.

In the future, she wants to open a bigger store to welcome more business opportunities.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
This is Eufemia. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 19,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of accessories and spare parts for the jeepney. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family if the unit is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Eufemia hopes that her business will continue to operate and expand. She also dreams that her children will be able to complete their studies. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, accessories and maintenance for her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 30 years old and has two children. She has coco land that she cultivates and integrates other commodities for more income. Veronica plans to disperse goats on her farm. She approached Paglaum MPC to buy more head of goats for dispersal. She wants to take advantage of the high demand of goats for butchering. In the future, Veronica hopes to sustain her business and would love to open an eatery.

loans.use: to buy more head of goats for dispersal

loans.name: Antonieto

texts.en:
Antonieto is 59 years old and from Tudela. He owns a drugstore in his hometown that sufficiently provides for his family. Antonieto has operated his drugstore for more than a decade now, and he wants to expand his store to other nearby towns. 

The reason that he applied for another loan is to restock inventory of medicinal drugs for retailing.

loans.use: to restock inventory of medicinal drugs for retailing

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 58 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Sofia has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Sofia has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Sofia would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Corazon works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Corazon is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dyna

texts.en:
Dyna is 29 years old and single.

Dyna works hard to provide for herself. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Dyna has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from e-loading (phone credits) and a personal products businesses.

Dyna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Peru

texts.en:
Peru is 28 years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling ice cakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Peru has requested a loan to buy sacks of sugar, Tang, papers, etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Peru will improve her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar, foam cups, Tang, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria manages her time for her family and business. As a Microfinance Member, she sells various cosmetic products and other personal hygiene items. She makes a meager income of PHP 4,000 per month that sufficiently provides for her five children. She is a widow and doubles her effort to make a living. 

Recently, she took a loan to restock her cosmetics supplies for resale. She hopes to open a display outlet for her products in the near future.

loans.use: to restock her cosmetic supplies for resale

loans.name: Luisa Maria

texts.es:
Luisa es una joven de 20 años de edad, tiene una hija de 1 año, se dedica a la venta de comida la cual realiza en la cocina de su casa vende fresas con lecherita y galletas con arequipe (dulce de caña muy parecido al chocolate), su actividad la inicio por necesidad económica en vista de que es una madre joven y quería colaborarle a su pareja para su sostenimiento mutuo.

Su meta con su negocio es clara, crecer, generar el capital para tener un puesto de ventas, de momento trata de ahorrar para comprar un carro de comidas rápidas y luchara por este objetivo, es una joven de verdad que se le notan las ganas de luchar por su hijo.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar galletas ducales, fresas, lecherita, arequipe y leche.
texts.en:
Luisa is a 20-year-old young woman who has a 1-year-old daughter. She makes a living by selling food out of her house's kitchen. She sells strawberries with sweetened condensed milk and cookies with arequipe (a sugary sweet very similar to chocolate sauce). She started the business out of economic necessity, as she is a young mother and wanted to assist her partner in supporting each other.

Her goal for her business is clear: to grow, to make enough money to have a location to sell from. Right now she is trying to save up to buy a food truck and fight for that goal. She is an authentic young woman with obvious determination to work hard for her child.

She is requesting a loan to buy Ducales cookies, strawberries, Lecherita sweetened condensed milk, arequipe, and milk

loans.use: to buy Ducales cookies, strawberries, sweetened condensed milk, arequipe, and milk

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own direct selling business for three years and she earns well from this. She had to work hard, with the determination of having a better income, to provide their children with a better education. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children.

To improve sales, Nenita would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional merchandise to increase her product inventory. At an amount of PHP 15,000, she could already purchase more quantities of clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, she hopes for her business to grow bigger, for her family to always be happy and to have sufficiency in everything. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans. .

loans.use: to pay for supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of paint for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Epi

texts.en:
Epi is a 31-year-old woman who is married with 5 children. 

She runs a business sewing and selling clothes in her community, and she has 4 years of experience with this business. She has requested a loan to buy materials, a sewing machine, needles, threads, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially and to save for unexpected emergencies. 

She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, a sewing machine, needles, threads, etc.

loans.name: Enecita

texts.en:
Enecita is a mother of four children and the only one who provides for her children. 

She is engaged in banana farming as a source of income for her family. She wants to give her children a good living, and for this reason she has decided to take out a loan to buy fertilizer for her banana farm. This will result in a good harvest and can generate more income.

Enecita wants to save money from her business and meet her children's needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her banana farm.

loans.name: Tulelei

texts.en:
Tulelei is 42 years old and married with 6 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes, chips, buns, doughnuts, etc. in her community, and she has been doing this for 3 years. 

Tulelei has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, yeast, oil, etc. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to capital. 

Tulelei will use her earnings to improve her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, yeast, oil, etc.

loans.name: Satuala

texts.en:
Satuala is a 70-year-old widow with 10 children. She has a small plantation and grows vegetables like cabbages, beans, cucumbers, egg plants, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. 

Satuala has requested a loan to buy wires, seeds, chemicals, spades, rakes, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. 

With her profits, Satuala hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy wires, seeds, chemicals, spades, rakes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of meat for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Marilou has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to pay for spare parts and maintenance for her motorcycle. She has been in this business for 6 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for her motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy fertilizer and crop protection products, pay for weeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, yeast, and oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Odinabibi

texts.en:
Odinabibi is a strong woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1971 and she lives in a remote district. She is married. 

For almost six years she has been doing business buying and selling textiles for clothing in the market. She is well-known among sellers and friends. She has permanent clients and attracts customers with the accessible prices of her goods. Her husband is a car trader. 

Odinabibi is planning to buy a new assortment of goods for the coming season. She is appealing to IMON and Kiva lenders for a loan to buy these goods, and she really hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of textiles for the coming season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru: Это Зебинисо. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем и имеет детей.  Зебинисо жительница района Шахритус. Ее дети загранице. Они зарабатывают на жизнь. Зебинисо серьезная и шустрая женщина. Она домохозяйка и не имеет работу. Зебинисо решила открыть свой бизнес у себя дома. Она планирует заниматься шитьем женской одежды. Зебинисо обратилась за креитом, чтобы приобрести больше ткани для начала бизнеса. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку. Подержите ее.
texts.en: Meet Zebiniso.  She is 50 years old, married, and a mother.  Zebiniso lives in the Shahrituz district of Tajikistan.  Her children are migrant workers, making a living abroad.  Zebiniso is a serious and intelligent woman.  She is a homemaker and doesn't have a job.  She has decided to start her own business at home, sewing women's dresses.  Zebiniso is taking a loan to buy a large quantity of fabrics and start her new business.  She hopes that you will support her.  Please help her.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fabrics and start a new business.

loans.name: Gabriel Antonio

texts.es:
Gabriel un hombre de 50 años de edad, casado, padre de 3 hijos de 17, 15 y 12 años que se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino la cual ejerce desde el año 1992 e inicio por falta de oportunidades laborales en alguna empresa.

Sus conocimientos en esta actividad los aprendió gracias a su padre y se siente muy orgulloso de ser hijo de campesino, ya que la tierra es la que le ha dado de comer a su familia.
 
Para Gabriel sería un sueño hecho realidad poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus condiciones de la vivienda y bueno se encuentra trabajando fuertemente para cumplir con esto.

Solicita un préstamo el cual desea invertir en la compra de cerdos y el alimento para engordarlos, busca abastecer sus cocheras y tener buena cantidad de animales para negociar y convertirse en un mayorista que sería su ideal.
texts.en:
Gabriel is 50 years old and married. He has three children ages 17, 15, and 12. He has made his living raising pigs since 1992, having started the business because of the lack of employment opportunities in local businesses.
He learned about pig raising from his father, and he is very proud to be the son of a country farmer and to feed his family off the land.
For Gabriel, it would be a dream come true to be able to pay for his children's education and improve his family's living conditions, and in fact he is working hard to accomplish these objectives.
He is applying for a loan that he will invest in buying pigs and feed to fatten them. He wants to fill up his pens and have a large number of animals so he will have a stronger negotiating position and can become a wholesaler, which is his ultimate goal.

loans.use: to buy pigs to stock his pens, along with pig feed.

loans.name: Sohibjamol

texts.en: Sohibjamol is a brave woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1985. She is living in a district in a small village. She is married and has children. They have a family business keeping livestock and planting cereals. She has eight years of experience doing business in agriculture. They are all together helping each other in their activity doing hard work like processing land and feeding livestock. Each year, they sell the livestock at the animal market and buy new livestock. Sohibjamol is saying that they want to increase the number of livestock and wish to have a farm. They are interested in agriculture and have good conditions at their house to keep the livestock. She appealed to IMON, asking for financial support to buy two more livestock. Now, she awaits the Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy two more livestock

loans.name: Sulusamoa

texts.en: Sulusamoa is 32 years old and married with six children. She runs a small business selling chips in her community and has been doing this for three years. Sulusamoa has requested a loan to buy cooking oil, a pound of paper, bananas, taro, a gas oven etc. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sulusamoa will improve her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, paper, bananas, taro, and a gas oven

loans.name: Leslie Ann

texts.en: Leslie Ann is from Tangub City, Philippines. She is married and has four children. Leslie Ann is managing a direct selling business, selling assorted products of different brands for men, women and children like soap, lotion, perfume, clothes, shoes, sandals, cosmetics and other items. She has had this business for seven years. She finds it interesting because she can earn income in an easy way through her good salesmanship and characteristic effort. She requested a loan to purchase more stocks to offer more to her customers. Expanding her inventories would also mean an increase in her income. Leslie Ann has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family and earn adequate income from her business to sufficiently provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to offer more to her customers

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 32 years old and a mother of two children who are both in school.  She joined Hand in Hand East Africa to benefit from the training, especially on record keeping and financial management.

She operates a pharmacy and is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more medicines to add stock to her pharmacy, which will enable her to meet her customer's demands and increase her income levels. 

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders.

loans.use: To buy more medicines to add to her pharmacy, which will enable her to meet her customers' demands and increase her income levels.

loans.name: Amukeni Tabot Bee Keeping Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is John, a member of Amukeni Tabot Bee Keeping Self Help Group. He is 48 years old, married and blessed with six children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

He does vegetable farming as his economic activity. After undergoing Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise development and financial management, John commercialized his farming, which now earns income that caters to his family’s food, clothing and school fees for his children. He is borrowing from Kiva to buy fertilizer and seeds in order to increase his income to cater to his family needs with ease.

John is grateful to Kiva and the lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds in order to increase his income to cater to his family needs with ease

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Sagrada Familia está en su ciclo número 9no° Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lidia.
Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group named “Sagrada Familia” (Sacred Family) is in its ninth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members have taken the poverty elimination survey.

One of the members is Sra. Lidia, who sells food that she prepares herself. She conducts her sales as a street vendor. Lidia is a hardworking and determined woman who wants to get ahead so that she can help her family. She is requesting a loan in order to buy greens, meats, condiments, vegetables, and other supplies so that she can continue her sales just as before. Lidia appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can keep growing.

loans.use: to buy greens, meats, condiments, vegetables, and other supplies.

loans.name: Gustavo Egidio

texts.es:
Él es Gustavo un hombre de 33 años de edad, una persona alegre que gracias a su negocio logro darle rienda suelta a sus sueños y esperanzas con su familia, porque no solo puede brindarle estudio a su hija de 7 años de edad, logro mejorar las condiciones de vivienda de su familia.
Gustavo tiene una tienda de abarrotes y su deseo no es solo quedarse con lo que tiene hasta ahora, no descanzara hasta ver convertido su negocio en un supermercado que compita fuertemente en el sector y la ciudad, tener sucursales y llevar su historia a muchos emprendedores para que se motiven y crean en sus negocios.

El desea solicitar un préstamo, el cual invertirá en la compra de surtido de gaseosas,  cervezas, dulces, frituras en bolsa.

Tu préstamo ayudara a Gustavo a abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
This is Gustavo, a 33-year-old cheerful man who has been able to fulfill his dreams and hopes together with his family, thanks to his business.  Not only is he able to give his 7-year-old daughter an education but also has improved the family's living conditions.

Gustavo runs a grocery store and his goal reaches beyong maintaining his business to converting it into a supermarket that can compete strongly in the sector and the city.  He wants to have branch stores and make his story known to many entrepreneurs as motivation for starting their own businesses.

He is requesting a loan to buy a variety of sodas, beers, sweets and snack foods.

Your loan will help Gustavo stock his store.

loans.use: To buy a variety of sodas, beers, sweets and snack foods.

loans.name: Juan Guillermo

texts.es:
Quien ve en la foto es Juan Guillermo un veterano hombre que nunca dejo de soñar, que siempre tuvo fe de que algún día la vida iba  a jugar a su favor y le llegó el momento, en el momento se encuentra a un paso de iniciar un sueño que será tener su propio negocio y tú puedes apoyarlo para cumplirlo. 
Juan Guillermo desea iniciar en su casa con la venta de alimentos, estará muy enfocado a productos de panadería, wafles entre otros.

En la foto se ve lo poco que ha podido comprar, algunos implementos, moldes, etc., y como para iniciar necesita una mesa de acero inoxidable, waflera, insumos y utensilios y por este motivo se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar dichos productos e iniciar lo más rápido posible con su actividad.

Tu préstamo será muy significativo porque será el principio de la nueva vida del señor Juan Guillermo, quien a sus 65 años quiere darse y darles a su familia conformada por su pareja y dos hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The person in the picture is Juan Guillermo, an older man who never stopped dreaming.  He always had faith that one day life would turn in his favor and that day has arrived.  He is now only one step away from starting his dream of having his own business, and you can help him fulfill it.

Juan Guillermo wants to start selling food from home with a focus on bakery products, waffles, etc.

A few of the items he has been able to buy are seen in the picture, such as utensils and pans, etc.  He is requesting the loan because he needs a stainless steel table, waffle iron, supplies and other utensils to start the business as soon as possible.

Your loan is very important because it will be the beginning of a new life for Juan Guillermo who, at age 65, wants to give his family a better quality of life and living conditions.  He has a partner and two children.

loans.use: To start selling bakery products.  He wishes to buy a stainless steel table, waffle iron, supplies and utensils.

loans.name: Ol Rongai Upendo Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Tabitha; a member of Ol Rongai Upendo Women Group. She is 41years old, married and blessed with seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013.

Tabitha does maize, beans, poultry and dairy farming. She benefited from the HiH EA enterprise and financial development training by acquiring skills that help in running and managing her business well.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and seeds that will help increase the quantity and quality of her yields, thus maximizing her profit. Income from this enterprise will help take care of her family's basic needs such as education and medical care. 

Tabitha is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds that will help boost farming and provide more income to cater to family needs.

loans.name: Ol Rongai Upendo Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Mary, a member of Ol Rongai Upendo Women Group. She is 70 years old, married and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013.

Mary does maize, beans, poultry and dairy farming. She benefited from the HiH EA enterprise and financial development training by acquiring skills that help in running and managing her business well.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and seeds that will help increase the quantity and quality of her yields, thus maximizing her profit. Income from this enterprise will help take care of her family's basic needs and medical care. 

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to improve her crop yield.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: Faustino de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijas, el posee una tienda desde hace 5 años el cual inicio con capital propio, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando las paredes, puertas y ventanas pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por eso solicita un crédito para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena, hierro, puertas, balcones y pago de mano de obra y así el su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en: Faustino, 34, lives in his own house with his partner and their two daughters.  For five years he has been running a store which he started with his own capital and the income he earns is able to cover some of the household expenses.  But he wants to remodel his house by changing the walls, doors and windows, and does not earn enough to carry out the project.  So he is requesting a loan to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron, doors and railings, as well as pay labor costs so his family will have a safer, more comfortable living environment.

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, sand, iron, doors, railings and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Samuel De Jesus

texts.es: Samuel de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijoles y también se dedica a la carpintería desde hace varios años, comercializa sus producto en los pueblos aledaños, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizante, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía y así poder tener mejores ingresos económico para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Samuel, 33, lives in his own house with his wife and two children.  He works in agriculture growing corn and beans and also has worked as a carpenter for several years.  He sells his products in the neighboring villages and uses his earnings to cover some of the household expenses.  He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, manures, fertilizers, insecticides, etc. to improve the cropland shown in the picture.  This will allow him to increase his income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, etc. to improve his cropland.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
El Sr. Ramón tiene 59 años está casada con la Sra. Digna, hace más de 40 años, es una pareja muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante.
Ramón se dedica a la carpintería hace más de 35 años, es uno de los pioneros de la ciudad en este trabajo. Comenta que comenzó desde muy abajo con la ayuda de su familia ahora ya tiene una mini empresa con todas las infraestructura montada.
Ramón  comenta que su mayor sueño en este momento es abrir un salón de venta. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la reparación de su local para ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Sr. Ramón is 59 years old and has been married to Sra. Digna for more than 40 years. They are a hardworking couple who want to get ahead.

Ramón has worked in carpentry for more than 35 years and is one of the pioneers of this trade in his city. He says that he started out with very little, but with the help of his family he now has a small business with a completely established infrastructure.

Ramón says that his greatest wish is to open a retail shop. He is requesting this loan so that he can make repairs to a shop where he can offer better service to his customers.

loans.use: to make repairs to a carpentry shop where he can sell his goods.

loans.name: Tuiyo -Gaa Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Pauline, a member of Tuiyo-Gaa Women Group. She is 55 years old and married with 10 children. Pauline lives with her husband and her 10 children.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from the course on financial management. This improved her knowledge in business management and she is able to advance her poultry farming through proper recording and using the profits prudently.

With these skills, she is able to educate her children and provide them with enough food and clothing. Pauline is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase more chicken and poultry feed to help boost her farming.

She appreciates Kiva for the support and promise to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and more chickens to  expand her farming and earn more income.

loans.name: Sellie

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Sellie, 43 years old and married with six children.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This improved her knowledge in business management.

Sellie is able to advance her business of water selling through proper recording and prudent financial management. With these skills, she is able to educate her children and provide them with enough food and clothing. Sellie is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy another donkey so that she can supply more water and meet the increased demand for water in the area. She appreciates Kiva for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy a donkey to help carry water, thus boosting her water selling business.

loans.name: Luis Edinson

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 31 años de edad que se dedica a las actividades agrícolas casi desde que tiene memoria pues su padre lo llevaba al campo a producir, inicio en el año 2005 cultivando aguacate y cacao el cual distribuye en la plaza de mercado, con el capital aporta para el sostenimiento de su familia que la constituye su pareja y un hijo de 2 años de edad. 

Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de vivienda y por eso cada año trata de que su negocio tenga un valor agregado sea que se expanda o aumente su producción.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agropecuarios para el sostenimiento de sus cultivos, como aún no está en cosecha, no puede vender y necesita un capital para abonar, regar gallinaza, y rociar con algunos exterminadores.

Tu préstamo ayudara al señor Luis a cuidar sus cultivos, esperando que al final tenga un excelente producto y lo más importante que se abundante.
texts.en:
Luis is a 31-year-old man who has worked in agriculture for nearly as long as he remembers, since his father used to take him out on the cropland.  In 2005 he started growing avocado and cocoa which he sells in the market square.  With his earnings he is able to support the family, consisting of his partner and a 2-year-old son.

His goal is to improve the conditions of his home so every year he tries to insure his business acquires added value, whether it be by expanding the land or increasing production.

He is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies to care for his crops since it is not yet harvest time and he cannot sell anything to earn capital to buy manure, nor irrigate or spray exterminator products.

Your loan will help Luis care for his crops in the hopes that he will achieve an excellent, abundant harvest.

loans.use: To buy manures, natural fertilizers, irrigation supplies and exterminators for his avocado and cocoa crops.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras 3 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Luchadoras 3 está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder seguir luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Rufina es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, comenta que sus ventas lo hace de manera ambulante, y por medio de este trabajo tiene los medios para poder darle un mejor estilo de vida para su familia.  Ella es una persona muy sacrificada que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo ha ido creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas varias para la venta, como ser camisas, jeans, remeras, pantalones y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group named “Mujeres Luchadoras 3” (Determined Women 3) is in its third loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are also participating in the poverty elimination program so that they can become familiar with their living situations. This will help them to continue in their efforts to improve their living conditions.

Rufina is one of the members who earns her living by selling various types of clothes. She says that she conducts her sales as a street vendor. Through her work, she has the means to provide a better lifestyle for her family. She is a self-sacrificing person who has given up a lot in her effort to keep growing.

Rufina is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of various types of clothes to sell such as shirts, jeans, T-shirts, trousers, and other garments. This will help her to continue her sales just as before. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can continue her work.

loans.use: to buy shirts, jeans, T-shirts, trousers, and other garments.

loans.name: Candida Ceferina

texts.es: Cándida de 45 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y pupusas desde hace 3 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de construir el muro que muestra en la fotografía pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, ladrillos, arena y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su hijo puedan vivir mas seguros y cómodos.
texts.en: Cándida, 45 years old, is a single mother and lives in her own house with her son. She has worked selling tortillas and pupusas for the past 3 years. With what she gets from her sales, she manages to cover some of the household expenses. She wants to improve her house, finishing the construction of the wall that is shown in the photo, but with what she earns from her sales, she doesn't have enough to do it. For this reason, she asks for a loan to purchase cement, bricks, sand, and pay labor costs so that she and her son can live more securely and comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, sand and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Las Vegas Group

texts.es:
Adela es una mujer de 56 años de edad, casada, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta ambulante de cosméticos.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en diferentes ferias y mercados de la zona ‘Sur’ de la ciudad, un área residencial y marginada, casas rústicas y antiguas, muchas sin acceso a agua conviven formando un lugar de manufactura en todas las áreas. De clima sub tropical, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-34 grados centígrados.  
Adela es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello castaño lo usa corto, estatura mediana, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada en la sillas viste blusa y falda azul). La necesidad de ampliar su negocio para generar mejores ingresos económicos la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; tienda de videos, venta de vajillas, venta de celulares, venta de carne de pollo, venta de flores, servicio de té y taller de costura, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta ambulante de cosméticos, como; lápiz labial, sombras para los ojos, cremas hidratantes, perfumes, etc.; su día inicia cargada de un bolso grande, abastecida de productos y de forma ambulante recorre ferias y mercados en busca de sus clientes, a los que encuentra trabajando en locales comerciales, oficinas, tiendas, etc. Su jornada diaria comienza a tempranas horas de la mañana y termina por la noche, “inicié mi negocio con una mínima inversión ahora sueño con abrir una tienda de cosméticos...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que conoce a clientes continuos y tiene rutas establecidas, la desventaja es la competencia con precios menores. Su sueño es abrir una tienda donde pueda exhibir y vender sus cosméticos, ella desea realizar la compra de perfumes y cosméticos por mayor, para consolidar su cartera de clientes y contar con un amplio stock. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Adela solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos y perfumes por mayor para abrir una tienda.
texts.en:
Adela is a 56- year-old woman, married, without children, and her business is selling cosmetics as a street vendor. 

She is enterprising, independent, patient, responsible, and very hard-working. She does her business as a street vendor in different fairs and markets in the "Sur" zone of the city, a residential and marginal area, with rustic and old houses, many of them without access to water, which, together, make a place of manufacturing in all areas. It has a subtropical climate, with a temperature that varies during the day between 21 and 34 degrees centigrade. 
 
Adela has brown skin, dark eyes, brown hair she keeps short, is of medium stature, an average physique, her native language is Guaraní which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business she does (she is seated in the chairs and is wearing a blue blouse and skirt). The need to expand her business to generate more income brought her to lead a bank of people with businesses such as a video store, silverware sales, cell phone sales, chicken sales, flower sales, tea service, and a sewing shop, to ask for a loan and improve their work. Her business is the sales of cosmetics as a street vendor, such as lipstick, eyeshadow, moisturizing creams, perfumes, etc. Her day begins by filling up a large bag, stocked with products, and she walks around fairs and markets looking for customers, who she finds working in the commercial spaces, offices, stores, etc. Her day begins in the early hours of the morning and ends at night. "I began my business with a small investment and now I dream of opening a cosmetics store..." she says. The advantage of her business is that she knows the regular customers and has established routes. The disadvantage is the competition with better prices. Her dream is to open a store where she can show and sell her cosmetics. She wants to purchase perfumes and cosmetics in bulk, to strengthen her customer base and have a broad stock. This is her third loan cycle with the institution in the 10 years she has been doing this work. 

For these reasons, Adela asks for a loan to purchase cosmetics and perfumes in bulk to open a store.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and perfumes in bulk to open a store.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el año 1985 inicio con sus servicios de latonería y pintura el señor José un hombre de 53 años de edad, que se dedicó a esta actividad por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente y que aprendió de este gracias a que en su adolescencia trabajo en empleos similares.

Vive con su pareja con la cual tienen 2 hijos ambos mayores de edad, pero que no dejan de ser sus niños consentidos por ello cada que lo necesitan, acude y les trata de ayudar en lo que puede.
José por su largo recorrido en su hombre reconocido, muy querido en el sector, en su trabajo es muy correcto, responsable, y su experiencia le da el aval de considerarse un experto en su trabajo.

Su propósito en el momento es tratar de expandir su negocio, tener sostenibilidad, mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, todo esto con el claro propósito de dejar en un futuro el negocio a sus hijos.

José quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual quiere invertir en productos de latonería y pintura para vehículos.
texts.en:
In the year 1985, José, a 53-year-old man, began with his auto repair services. He worked in this field by preference and vocation for independent work, and he learned it thanks to working in similar jobs as a teenager.

He lives with his partner with whom he has 2 children, both of whom are adults, but they are still his children, spoiled by him for everything they need, he goes to them and tries to help them with whatever he can. 

José, for his long time working, is a well-known man and is very well-liked in the area. He is very precise and responsible in his work, and his experience gives him the guarantee of considering himself an expert in his work. 

His goal at the moment is to try to expand his business, have sustainability, improve his sales, expand his customer base, all this is with the clear goal of leaving the business to his children in the future.

José wants to ask for a loan which he wants to invest in auto repair products.

loans.use: to purchase auto repair products, he wants to leave a future the business to his children in the future.

loans.name: Maria Rosa Evelia

texts.es: María de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frijol, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años el cual inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas,  etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three children. She works in agriculture, growing corn and beans. She has been working in this business for several years, which she started with her own money. She sells her products in the surroundings of the area where she lives. 
With what she earns from her sales she manages to settle some household expenses. 

She is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc., and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph to continue her work and therefore have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc., and to improve the land.

loans.name: Enelda Ester

texts.es:
Ella es Esnelda una carismática, tierna, adorable abuelita pero sobre todo muy responsable y una guerrera de mil batallas, ella es una mujer de 67 años de edad que vive en un rancho, es separada de su esposo pero a lo largo de su vida tuvo la cantidad de 6 hijos todos ellos mayores de edad que le ayudan siempre que ven a su madre en dificultades.

Esnela siempre se caracterizó por ser una mujer que no le gusta que le den nada, ella trabaja desde su hogar para generarse su propio sustento, un pensamiento que llego con la separación de su esposo donde demostró que no necesitaba nada más que ella para mantenerse y a sus hijos.

Esnelda se dedica a la venta de plátano y coco, tiene sus clientes, esta increíble abuela, carga su productos y lo lleva al lugar de encuentro, da gusto ver trabajar a una mujer de su edad con tanto empeño y ganas.

Esnelda se encuentra solicitando un préstamo y tú puedes ayudarla a mejorar su calidad de vida, ella busca su auto sostenimiento y trabajar hasta que su salud se lo permita, con el préstamo comprara surtido de platano y coco.
texts.en:
Esnelda is a charismatic, loving, adorable grandmother. Above all, she is very responsible and a veteran of a thousand battles. She is a 67 year old woman who lives on a farm. She is separated from her husband but during her life she had 6 children. All of them are grown and they always help her, when they see that their mother has problems. 

Esnela has always been described as a woman who doesn't like to be given anything. she works from her home to support herself. She began to think this way when she was separated from her husband, when she showed that she didn't need anyone but herself to support herself and her children.  

Esnelda sells plantain and coconuts. She has her customers, and this incredible grandmother carries her products to the meeting place. It is wonderful to see a woman her age work with so much dedication and eagerness.  

Esnelda is asking for a loan and you can help her improve her quality of life. She is seeking to support herself and work for as long as her health allows. With the loan, she will buy inventory of plantains and coconuts.

loans.use: a 67 year old woman, to sell plantains and coconuts.

loans.name: Maria Daysi

texts.es: María de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la agricultura principalmente a la siembra de maíz, se dedica a esta actividad  desde hace mas de 15 años, cuando sus cosechas ya están listas las almacena en sacos como muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlas en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizante, controles de plagas, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
María is 51 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and son. She works in agriculture, mainly growing corn. She has been in this business for more than 15 years. 

When her crops are ready, she stores them in sacks, as shown in the picture, to later sell them in the different markets found close to her house. With what she gets from her earnings, she manages to settle some household expenses. 

She is asking for a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, pest control, etc., and therefore be able to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, pest control, etc.

loans.name: José Leobardo

texts.es:
José Leobardo es un joven de 25 años de edad que desde pequeño apoyaba a su familia en las actividades productivas de café. Ahora, cuenta con su propia finca en la cual vive con su esposa y su hijo. Las buenas prácticas que implementa este joven en su finca, le ha permitido obtener las certificaciones Comercio Justo, C.A.F.E. Practices y UTZ, promovidas por la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria.

En época de cosecha, este joven productor emplea a personas de su comunidad. En los últimos años, ha logrado producir entre 60 y 80 quintales de café.
