Su visión empresarial, le ha ayudado a ir mejorando los ingresos familiares, lo cual es una de sus metas cada año para llegar a cumplir su sueño de darle una mejor de calidad de vida a su familia.

Para este año, la meta de José Leobardo es incrementar la productividad de su finca, mejorando la nutrición de las plantas de café, para ello está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita asegurar la compra y aplicación oportunidad de los insumos agrícolas que requiere su cafetal. Te animamos a contribuir con la meta de este joven.
texts.en:
José Leobardo is a young man, 25 years old, that from a young age was supporting his family in the coffee production business. Now, he relies on his own farm, where he lives with his wife and son. The good practices that he implements on his farm have allowed him to earn the Comercio Justo, C.A.F.E. Practices and UTZ certifications, sponsored by the Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria association. 

In recent years, he has managed to produce between 60 and 80 quintales of coffee. His business vision has helped him to continue improving his family income. One of his goals each year is to be able to fulfill his dream of giving his family a better quality of life.

For this year, José Leobardo's goal is to increase the productivity of his farm, and improve the nutrition of the coffee plants. For this, he is asking for funding that allows him to ensure the purchase and timeliness application of the agricultural supplies that his coffee plantation requires. We encourage you to contribute to the goal of this young man.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies that improve the nutrition of the coffee plants.

loans.name: Pedro Luis

texts.es:
Responsable, servicial, cordial y experto en su trabajo son algunas de las cualidades del señor Pedro quien tiene un taller de mecánica donde asiste principal motocicletas el cual es el vehículo principal en el departamento de Antioquía.

Inicio con su negocio en el año 2013, por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente, sus conocimientos los aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de un buen amigo, con el cual trabajo por varios años, pero solo en el año mencionado (2013) tomo la decisión de iniciar su negocio y le ha ido muy bien pues pensó en esto por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y aunque su negocio actualmente se está equilibrando económicamente ha visto cambios muy positivos y desea seguir por ese buen camino.

La familia de pedro está constituida por su pareja y sus dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad, que son su felicidad, siempre espera a terminar labores para ir a verlos y claro no se olvida de su madre a la cual le envía dinero para que cubra algunas de sus necesidades y se compre sus cosas de madre.
 
Solicita un préstamo el cual quiere invertir en la compra de repuestos de motocicleta, como inicio hace relativamente poco tiempo todavía no cuenta con el capital para cubrir un pedido de esta magnitud.
texts.en:
Responsible, helpful, cordial and an expert at his job are some of the qualities Pedro has. He has a mechanics shop where he mainly services motorcycles, which is the main vehicle in the department of Antioquía.

He started his business in 2013, because he liked it and because he had a vocation for independent work. He learned his knowledge thanks to the teachings of a good friend with whom he worked for several years. But it was just in the aforementioned year, 2013, that he decided to start his business and it has gone very well for him. He thought of this to improve his standard of living and although his business right now is getting financially balanced, he has seen some very positive changes and he wants to keep going down this good road.

Pedro's family is made up of his spouse and their two children, aged  4 and 2. They are his happiness and he always looks forward to finishing his work to go see them. Of course, he doesn't forget about his mother, to whom he send money to cover some of her needs and so she can buy the things she needs as a mother.   

He is asking for a loan that she wants to invest in motorcycle replacement parts. He started a relatively short time ago and he still doesn't have the capital to cover an order of this size.

loans.use: to buy the most used motorcycle replacement parts, because every day he has prospective customers and he wants to have stock in his store.

loans.name: Pajomel Ajtikonel, Tzununá Group

texts.es:
Esquipulas es un hombre de 36 años de edad, es casado y se encuentra profundamente agradecido por el crédito anterior, pues gracias a Dios el logro comprar sus fertilizantes y logro darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café a tiempo, con esta producción logro mejorar sus ingresos y con ello la calidad de vida de su familia; Esquipulas ahora junto a su grupo solicitan nuevamente un crédito que lo invertirán en la compra de fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de café.
Esquipulas y su grupo tienen las esperanzas de poder contar nuevamente con el crédito para que sus vidas siga cambiando y comprar más terrenos.
texts.en: Esquipulas is a 36-year-old, married man. He is extremely grateful for his previous loan because, with God's help, he was able to buy fertiliser and tend his coffee crops. The crops that he grew enabled him to boost his income and his family's quality of life. Esquipulas and his group are now seeking another loan which they will use to buy fertiliser to look after his coffee crop. Esquipulas and his group hope to be able to obtain a new loan so that they can make changes to their lives and buy more land.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser.

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
Juan Ramón es productor de café de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Desde hace más de 40 años se dedica a la producción de este rubro, y con su esposa y tres hijos ha logrado ir mejorando su pequeña finca, la cual está certificada por Comercio Justo, C.A.F.E. Practices y UTZ, a través de la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria. 

Para este año, su meta es incrementar el rendimiento productivo de su finca, bajo un plan de manejo integral, para ello está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar los fertilizantes que requiere su cafetal, a fin de tener una mejor cosecha y con ello mayores ingresos para su familia.

El sueño de Juan Ramón es dejarle a sus hijos una finca rentable que ellos puedan aprovechar para tener mejores oportunidades que las que él tuvo cuando era joven.
texts.en: Juan Ramón a coffee producer in the north of Nicaragua. He has been growing the crop for over 40 years and, with the help of his wife and children, he has managed to make improvements to his small estate, which is certified by Comercio Justo, C.A.F.E. Practices and UTZ, through the Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria association. His goal this year is to boost his production by means of an integrated management plan. And so, he is applying for loan to buy the fertiliser he needs for his coffee plantation so he can have a better harvest and better income for his family. Juan Ramón's dream is to leave his children a profitable estate which they can use to ensure they have better opportunities than he had when he was young.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser for his coffee plantation and ensure a good harvest

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es:
José Alejandro vive en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua, junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos con edades 12 y 6 años, los cuales asisten a la escuela de su comunidad.

Siempre se ha dedicado a actividades agrícolas y  desde hace más de 7 años al cultivo de café, como principal actividad económica, el cual maneja bajo la certificación de Comercio Justo. La producción de café  de José Alejandro en los últimos 3 años, ha pasado de 35 a 60 quintales, y para este ciclo su meta es continuar incrementando su producción, para lo cual solicita un préstamo que le permita adquirir los fertilizantes que requiere su cafetal.

El sueño de este productor es que sus hijos puedan continuar estudiando, y que si él solo pudo estudiar el primer grado de primaria, sus hijos puedan tener mejores oportunidades y contar con una profesión o mayores conocimientos para potenciar los recursos de su finca.
texts.en:
José Alejandro lives in a community in the north of Nicaragua with his wife and two children, ages 12 and 6, who attend school in the community. He has always worked in agriculture and for more than 7 years he has worked growing coffee as his main job, which he operates under the Comercio Justo certification. 

José Alejandro's coffee production in the last 3 years has gone from 35 to 60 quintales, and for this season his goal is to continue increasing his production, for which he is asking for a loan that allows him to purchase the fertilizers that his coffee plantation requires. 

This producer's dream is that his children can continue going to school, and that if he was only able to study until the first grade, his children could have better opportunities and rely on a profession or more knowledge to enhance the resources of his farm.

loans.use: to buy the fertilizers that will allow him to ensure a good coffee harvest this season.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Mary. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. She is sixty-seven years old, married and has seven children. Mary sells fruits and vegetables, and she has been in this business for thirty six years. She is happy for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa savings training she received which enabled her to save and improve her enterprise.

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. This will enable her meet her customers' rising demand and earn more income. She intends to use part of the profit to provide food to the family and pay school fees. Mary is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables to help meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Mohiniso

texts.en:
Mohiniso is a hardworking woman. She was born in a remote district in the northern part of Tajikistan. She is living with her family in the village. After the death of her husband, she was responsible to raise and feed their family. She has three children. 

Mohiniso has ten years of experience working at a company producing batter as a controller. She then started her new business of trading fruits and vegetables in the domestic market. Her husband used to trade coal and after his death, Mohiniso continued his business. Now, she serves people with coal by taking orders and delivering coal to their houses. She has a permanent demand for her goods because winter is cold in the district where she lives and people are saving coal if necessary. 

Mohiniso is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders in order to buy coal and trade. She hopes to be supported because her business will help her to earn money and feed her children.

loans.use: to buy coal and trade.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 38-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of one son, and she maintains her household activities properly. 

She has been running a beauty salon for the last few years, and she is a good trained beautician. Due to her efficient and good work, her number of clients increases day by day. As a result, she needs to purchase additional beauty salon related items such as facial creams, combs, and furniture items like dressing chairs and mirrors.  Musarat contacted Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, whose staff visited her enterprise and issued her a loan. 
She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to buy facial creams, combs, and furniture items like dressing chairs and mirrors for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Maturui Economic Empowerment Group

texts.en:
The man raising his hand in the photo is Vincent, a member of Maturui Economic Empowerment Group. He is thirty-four years old and married with three children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped him improve his knowledge in business management.

Vincent's economic activity is dairy farming. He needs a loan to buy high quality fodder for his cows. This will increase their milk production and help him keep up with the increased demand for milk. He hopes this will increase his level of income so he will be in a position to continue supporting his family and to improve their living conditions in the long run, including obtaining quality housing.
Vincent is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy fodder that will help boost his cows' milk production.

loans.name: David Flaminio

texts.es: David de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijas, el se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maicillo y frijol, se dedica desde hace 12 años a desempeñar el trabajo como agricultor, adicional a eso también trabaja como jornal cuidando ganado, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y su trabajo es como logra salir adelante con su familia, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, controles de plagas, etc. y así seguir con su trabajo para poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
35-year old David lives in his own house with his wife and three daughters. For 12 years he has earned his living as a farmer growing corn and beans. He also works as a day labourer looking after livestock. With what he earns from his two jobs he manages to support his family.

David is seeking a loan to buy fertiliser, manure, seeds, insecticide etc. Then he will be able to continue his work and improve his income.

loans.use: buy fertiliser, manure, seeds, insecticide etc

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la agricultura principalmente cultiva maíz y frijol desde hace 5 años, adicional a eso también trabaja como ayudante de albañil, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y su trabajo ayuda en los gastos del hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su madre, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para continuar con su trabajo y asi poder seguir ayudando en su casa sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: The young man whose face is blurred is 29 years old and lives in a high risk area. He's earned his living growing corn and beans for five years; he also works as an assistant construction worker. With the money he earns from his two jobs, he helps with household expenses. He lives in his own house with his mother. He is seeking a loan to buy fertiliser, manure, seeds etc. so he can improve his land which can be seen in the photograph. Then he will be able to continue his work and helping with household expenses.

loans.use: buy fertiliser, manure, seeds etc. so he can improve his land

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir e zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de carnes, frutas y verduras desde hace 12 años y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar y quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía pero como no tiene suficiente capital está solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de los materiales necesarios como: ladrillos, arena, cemento, hierro, laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir más cómodos.
texts.en: This young woman is 27 years old. Her face has been pixelated as she lives in a high risk area. She has earned her living selling meat, fruit, and vegetables since she was 12. With what she earns, she manages to pay for some of the household expenses. She lives in her own house with her family. She wishes to improve her home by building a bedroom in the area shown in the photograph. However, she doesn't have enough money so she is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL to buy the necessary materials such as bricks, sand, cement, rebar, corrugated sheeting, and beams, and pay for labourers to build it. Then she and her family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: buy construction materials such as bricks, sand, cement, rebar, corrugated sheeting, and beams, and hire labourers

loans.name: Farangis

texts.en:
Farangis is a cheerful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1987. She is living in the capital of the country. She is married and has one child. 

She has been doing a business since 2008. She is sewing traditional women's dresses. She takes orders at home and has permanent clients every day. Farangis is a responsible, hardworking and kind person. She sews on time ordered dresses and clients are satisfied with her work. She wants to enlarge her business and buy a sewing machine that does embroidering. Clients are ordering new fashions and up-to date-designs, and she wants to satisfy their wants. 

She is asking for a loan from IMON and KIVA lenders to buy a sewing machine. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine that does embroidering

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various commodities like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, toiletries, condiments and soft drinks.  She is a 64-year-old married woman from Maribojoc, Bohol. She has one grown child. Aside from running a store, she also engages in a tuba (coconut) vending business. 

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted stock for the store and purchase more supplies of tuba. This will enable Edwina to improve the content of her store and be able to attract more buyers to shop. 

She is hoping that her sari-sari (variety) store will expand and it will cause an improvement in the status of living.

loans.use: to buy assorted stock for the store and purchase more supplies of tuba

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is grateful that she was granted a 60,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Her store earnings helped her to be independent and to be able to support her daily needs and assist her aging parents. 

She would now like to apply for another 60,000 PHP loan which she will use as part of her working capital to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, instant noodles, and toiletries which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her and for a good return on her investment for it will surely cover her and her parents' daily sustenance. 

Rose dreams of having a General Store in a commercial area. She prays for a good health and a quiet life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of items like rice, instant noodles, frozen foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 51-year-old mother of four children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer and owns a vegetable shop near his town. He offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers and feeds his family with the income his shop generates.
 
Recently, the needs of the family suddenly increased but Nargis' husband did not have any other means of meeting these needs, so he decided to expand his business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales. Thus, Nargis has requested a loan so that her husband will be able to buy more vegetables to sell.

Nargis is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for her husband's shop

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is the age of 30, the mother of three children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. 

He wants to buy more stock of vegetables so that he can maximize sales from the vegetables. Therefore, Sumaira, his wife, has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy additional seasonal vegetables. 

Sumaira says thanks to Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for her husband's shop

loans.name: Basheeran

texts.en:
Basheeran is a 49-year-old married woman and responsible mother of one son and one daughter. She is living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is doing embroidery work by hand at home and financially supporting the family.

Basheeran belongs to a poor family; her husband’s income is very poor so her son also decided to start embroidery work at home. Her son has been learning these arts in his childhood, now he has adopted hand-embroidery for his occupation. 

Basheeran requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, to purchase stocks of thread, silk, fancy sequins, and pearls of various colors for her son's embroidery work. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her son's work. Basheeran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of thread, silk, fancy sequins, and pearls of various colors for her son's embroidery work

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: María de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar,  ella se dedica a la agricultura principalmente cultiva maíz desde hace 15 años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarle en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside,  ella está solicitando un crédito para comprar de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos
texts.en:
Maria is 57 years old and lives at home with her family group, she earns a living mainly from agriculture, she has cultivated maize for 15 years.  When her harvest is ready she stores it in silos which are shown in the photograph, to later sell it it the zone around where she lives. 

She is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, compost and fertilisers etc. in order to be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost and fertilisers, etc.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1964. She is living in a small village in the nearby mountains. She is married and has two children. Zamira is an honest, goal-oriented and responsible person. She has been doing business almost 10 years. Her business is buying and selling women's clothing. She has a store in a domestic market and has permanent clients every day. She tries to have each season’s clothes for women. 

Now, the season is coming and she requests a loan from KIVA lenders and IMON to buy a new assortment of clothes for women. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of clothes for women

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 47 years old, married, and has five children.  

She is in the agricultural business  in the Philippines. Elvie requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins.

Elvie has been in business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins

loans.name: Helario

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Helario works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and buying and selling dried fish. Helario is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net, gasoline, nails, bamboo, etc for her fishing business.

Helario has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, gasoline, nails, bamboo, etc for her fishing business

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children, two of whom are in school.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like raising pigs.

Editha dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a second motorcycle for  his transport business.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
The man in the photo is Geofrey, 41 years old and blessed with three children. He  earns a living through dairy and crop farming of potatoes and maize. He is happy for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa enterprise training he received, which equipped him with the skill to manage his business.  

The high demand in the market has made him to apply for a loan to purchase fodder and nappier grass. This will boost his business and also increase his supply and thus be able to meet his objective of educating the children.

He is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fodder and napier grass for the dairy cows to help boost milk productivity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry feed and dairy feed that will help boost farm output, thus more income to meet family needs.

loans.name: Ukulima Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Virginia, a member of Ukulima Women Group. She is married and has two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management. 

Her economic activity is dairy and potatoes farming, which she has been doing for the past 20 years. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to boost her farming by buying fodder and fertilizer, which she hopes will increase her level of income in order to continue providing for her family’s needs.

She is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support, and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fodder and fertilizer that will help boost farming.

loans.name: Bibisaroya

texts.en:
Bibisaroya is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1971. She is living in a district where beautiful hills are surrounding. She is married and has a child. She has 10 years experience doing business. She is trading women's underwear. She rents a store where she sells her goods. She buys her goods from wholesalers. She always tries to enlarge her assortment and attract more clients. She needs to do business in order to feed her family. 

She requests a loan to buy a new assortment of women's underwear. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of women' s underwear

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina engages in tailoring services. She accepts dress making services for the locals in her place. She is a married woman with four grown children from Loon, Bohol. She has been engaged in tailoring services for more than 10 years already.

She is asking for a loan to buy materials like sewing thread and needles. These will help Marcelina cater more orders to her respective customers. Thus, she could sew more dresses and be able to augment her income. In this way, she could now start to handle her finances and able to pay her obligations.

She hopes that she could manage her tailoring services for a sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy materials like sewing thread and needles

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is 30 years old, married, and has one child. She wants to provide for the needs of her family and help her husband make a living, so she engages in a sari-sari store business. 

Melody decided again to take a loan amounting of P 12,000 to buy additional goods for the sari-sari store to increase her store inventory and have more sales.

In the future, she wants to save money out from her business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Kusiima Women's Group

texts.en:
Firidah is a hard working Ugandan widow living in Kagadi, aged 44 with two children. She owns a retail shop to supplement her daily income from a government job. She hopes to grow her business into a wholesale shop and educate her children with the returns, despite challenges of competition from similar businesses.

She intends to use the credit to buy sugar, soap, shoe polish, and other merchandise for selling. 

She is a member of Kusiima Women's Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, shoe polish, and other things

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy, the gentleman appearing in the photo, is 32 years old and a father of one child. Kennedy’s economic activity is shoe repair. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in July 2013, and has received training on enterprise development and financial planning, which equipped him with skills to effectively manage his enterprise. 

He is borrowing a Kiva loan to add more stock of shoe sewing thread and soles to his enterprise. He hopes this will help him boost his business by providing timely and efficient services to his customers, hence an increase in his income. He will therefore be able to support his family and improve their overall living standards. 

Kennedy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support, and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of shoe sewing thread and soles to help provide efficient and timely services.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 45-year-old married woman living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her son owns a butcher shop; he earns insufficient income for his family. His daily practice is to buy beef from the market and sell it at his butcher shop. Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills, which discouraged his purchasing power for new inventory of his butcher shop.
 
Therefore Yasmeen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son can buy a bull calf for getting beef. 

She dreams to provide all facilities of life to her children. 

She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a bull calf for her son's butchery shop

loans.name: Barginoy

texts.ru: Баргиной 44 летняя женщина с большим сердцем и светлой душой. Баргиной счастливая жена и мать. Баргиной активная женщина. Она успевает накормить четверых детей подростов, мужа и ухаживать за старой свекровью. Несмотря на это, Баргиной еще и занимается растениеводством. Она выращивает овощи. Баргиной занимается земледелием более 20 лет. Она раньше помогала родителям каждый год посеить урожая и теперь в доме мужа она самостоятельно стала заниматься этой деятельностью. Баргиной в этом году планирует посеять урожай больше чем обычно, но ей не хватает достаточных средств для купли семян и минеральных удобрений. Она узнала о проекте Kiva в "Хумо" поддерживающих сельских жителей и решила обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en: Barginoy is a happy wife and mother. She is an active woman and manages to feed her husband and four adolescent children and care for an aging mother-in-law. In addition to this, Barginoy also grows vegetables. She has been farming for over 20 years. She used to help her parents plant and harvest every year and now does the same thing herself in her husband's home. Barginoy plans to plant a larger crop than usual this year, but she does not have the resouces to buy seeds and fertilizers. She learned about the Kiva project with Humo from her fellow villagers and decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy es un hombre de 34 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos varones de 2 y 8 años y 2 hijas mujeres de 5 años y 2 meses, y su negocio es la producción de estuco.
Él es buen padre, paciente, comprensivo, optimista, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Vichaya’ a una distancia de 86 kilómetros de la ciudad, caracterizado por albergar a importantes estructuras funerarias denominadas ‘Chullpares’ y sitios defensivos de la época de los “Señoríos Aymaras” 1100 - 1400 dc., estas chullpas se pueden observar desde el camino. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 5-16 grados centígrados.
Freddy es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que trabaja en el mismo negocio y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela y los 2 menores aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante una bomba eléctrica, no existe alcantarillado en el lugar. Su negocio es la producción de estuco que consiste en extraer la roca encontrada en estado natural, convirtiéndola en una pasta flexible para ser mezclada con agua y aplicada sobre superficies como; muros, cielos rasos y cementos, con la que se pueden hacer rellenos y revestimiento de acabados de la construcción. “inicié mi actividad hace 6 años como ayudante, hace 5 años que trabajo junto a mi esposa independientemente, contamos con un ayudante para extraer la roca…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que es un trabajo continuo que deja ganancias constantes, la desventaja de su negocio es la carencia de agua y para recogerla debe transportarse hasta el riachuelo. Su sueño es vender estuco por mayor y comprar un camión para transportarlo, el desea realizar la compra de leña y combustible para la explotación de estuco. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Freddy solicita un préstamo para la compra de leña y combustible para la producción de estuco para vender por mayor.
texts.en: Freddy is a 34 year old man. He lives with his partner. He has two sons, 2 and 8 years old, and 2 daughters, 5 years and 2 months old. His business is to produce stucco. He is a good father, patient, understanding, optimistic, responsible and hardworking. He has his business in the town of ‘Vichaya', 86 kilometers from the city, known for having important funeral structures called ‘Chullpares’ and defense places from the times of the “Señoríos Aymaras” 1100 - 1400 a.C. These "chullpas" can be seen from the road. It is cold and dry here, with temperatures varying from 5-16 degrees Celsius during the day. Freddy is dark skinned, with black short hair, brown eyes, short and thin. His native language is Aymara, which is spoken in the area. He speaks Spanish as general culture and because of his work. He shares his life with his wife, who works in the same business, and with his children. The two oldest go to school, and the 2 youngest are not yet in school age. They live in their own house, built with adobe with corrugated iron roof, electricity and well water extracted through an electric pump. There is no sewerage in the place. His business is to produce stucco: extracting stone found in natural state and converting it into a flexible paste to be mixed with water and applied over surfaces such as walls, ceilings and cement, used to fill gaps and finish up construction projects. "I started my work 6 years ago as a helper. For five years I have been working with my wife independently. We have a helper to extract the stone", Freddy comments. The advantage of his business is that it is continuous work that brings constant earnings; the disadvantage is the lack of water, and to get it one has to go to the creek. His dream is to sell stucco wholesale and to buy a truck to transport it. He wants to buy log and fuel to mine stucco. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the six years he has been working in this activity. These are the reasons why Freddy is requesting a loan in order to buy log and fuel to product stucco to sell wholesale.

loans.use: to buy log and fuel to produce stucco in order to sell wholesale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 35 years old, married, with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, coffee, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

Irene has borrowed and paid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Irene aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, coffee, milk, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Nakuru East Mulembe Self Help Group

texts.en:
Wilfred, the gentleman raising his hand in the photograph, is a member of Nakuru East Mulembe Self Help Group. He is 36 years old, married, and a father to three children. Wilfred’s economic activity is a retail shop. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in July 2013, and has received training on enterprise development and financial planning which have equipped him with skills to effectively manage his enterprise.

He is borrowing a Kiva loan to add more stock of foodstuffs to his enterprise. He hopes the loan will help him boost his business, hence increase his income. 

He will therefore be able to support his family and improve their overall living standards. 

Wilfred is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support, and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of  food stuffs for the retail shop to help boost sales.

loans.name: Inobathon

texts.en:
Inobathon is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1986. She is living in the city. She is divorced and has one child. It is not easy to raise her child alone.

She has 11 years experience in doing business. She has a business of buying and selling nutrition products. Her mother helped her start the business. Now Inobathon earns good profit from it and has permanent clients every day. She does business at her home. 

Inobathon is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy goods like sugar, candies, cakes, coffee, macaroni, etc. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy goods like sugar, candies, cakes, coffee, macaroni, etc.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 38 years old, married, and has six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This improved her knowledge in business management. Stella is able to advance her dairy farming through proper recording and using the profits properly.

Stella is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy dairy meal to help improve her productivity. With the anticipated income, she will be able to educate her children and provide them with enough food and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase dairy meal that will help boost productivity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Cherina

texts.en:
Cherina is 57 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are sent to school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Cherina has a general store business in the Philippines and has been in this business for twelve years. She requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, etc., at her sari-sari store.

In the future, Cherina would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, etc., at her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Marvin Adelmir

texts.es: Marvin de 32 años de vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura principalmente a la siembra de granos básicos desde hace 10 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos para la producción de granos básicos (abono, semillas, fertilizantes, etc.) y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y así seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Marvin is 32 years old and lives in his own home with his spouse and their 2 children. He has made a living in agriculture, mainly basic grains, for 10 years. He sells his products around the area where he lives and the income he makes covers some household expenses. He is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for the production of basic grains (manure, seeds, fertilizers, etc.) and improve the land shown in the photograph, thus continuing with his work to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like manure, seeds, fertilizers, etc. and improve the soil

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Her name is Gina, 39, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Roque, a family driver.  They have three children, two of whom are in elementary school and the other one is already working. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to increase their income in order to support and meet the family's daily personal and household needs as well as send the children to school. 

Gina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns a profit by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of 800 PHP a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy grocery items such  as rice, canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, soda and other grocery things. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are the family's income source to meet their daily expenses and to send the children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Gina hopes to maintain and grow her business so they can have a better life and give her children a college education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase stock like groceries, beverages and toiletries for her store.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 53 years old and married with six children. Adelaida works very hard to provide for them.

Adelaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Adelaida has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old, married and has five children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural poultry business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her chicks.

Josephine has been in poultry for six years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her chicks

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 38 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She operates a dried fish making business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 13 years. 

Mary Ann requested a loan from NWTF for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more fish, sacks of salt, and other materials for her dried fish making. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish, sacks of salt, and other materials

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 8 years. She earns additional income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Amada Pastora

texts.es:
Amada es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, pues hace más de 6 años inició con una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación, que poco a poco fue ampliando y hoy, se trata de un negocio próspero y variado, con una amplia demanda por sus productos. 
Ella solicita un crédito para invertirlo en su pulpería con la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, gaseosas, salsas de tomate, avena, papel higiénico, etc.  Así podrá ofrecer mayor variedad y con las ganancias podrá ampliar su casa.
texts.en: Amada is an entrepreneurial, hard-working woman. She started a small convenience store more than six years ago in her own home. Little by little she expanded this business and today it is a prosperous and diverse business with a large demand for its products. She is requesting a loan to invest in her small store by purchasing basic grains, candy, soft drinks, ketchup, oatmeal, toilet paper, etc. This will allow her to provide a greater variety and with the profits she will be able to expand her home.

loans.use: purchase basic grains, candy, soft drinks, ketchup, oatmeal, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Shalom Self Hep Group

texts.en:
Jecinta is the name of the lady raising her hand in the photograph. She is a member of the Shalom Self Help Group. She is 36 years old and a mother of three. She operates a cafe where she sells local foods and beverages.

She has greatly benefited from the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa trainings, which equipped her with skills to effectively manage her business. In June 2014, she borrowed 10,000 KES from Kiva lenders, which she used to add stock to her hotel. She has since completed repaying this loan and is borrowing more via Kiva to add stock of foodstuffs. She trusts this will help her further increase her income. This will enable her to be in a position to provide for the basic necessities of her family, like quality housing, with ease. 

Jecinta is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of foodstuffs for the cafe that will help meet customers' rising demand.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Mary. She is 57 years old and married.  She is living with her six children and husband who supports her in raising the family. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 and has benefited from the savings mobilization, entrepreneurship and financial management trainings.

She practices mixed farming and grows potatoes, cabbages, peas and also does dairy farming. Mary is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy cattle feed.  This will enable her to increase milk production and thereby earn more income to pay school fees for her children and buy better clothing.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the great financial support.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed which will enable her to increase milk production and thereby earn more income to enable her to pay school fees for her children as well as better clothing.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 26 years old and has one child. She joined Hand in Hand in 2014 and has been able to benefit from training especially on enterprise and financial management.  She operates a general store where she sells items such as flour, sugar, salt, cooking fat, and other household goods. 

Susan is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more foodstuffs, adding stock to her general store so as to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs such as flour, sugar, salt, and cooking fat

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Monica, forty years old, who is the married mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2014.

She has gained skills in enterprise development, business record keeping and financial management rendered by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa. This training have helped her to operate her tailoring business that she does to earn her living. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase additional fabric to help meet customers' demand, thus creating more income. This will therefore help improve her living standards and those of her family and also pay school fees for her children.

Monica is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
The lady appearing in the photo is Damaris. She is forty-six years old, is married and has six children.
She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) so as to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial planning. This has helped her improve her knowledge of business management. 

In July 2014 she applied for a loan of Kshs 10 000/- from HiH EA’S Enterprise Incubation Fund (EIF) which she has since completed repaying.  She used her first loan to invest in her enterprise of maize and beans farming by purchasing farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds. She is borrowing more from Kiva in order to purchase farm inputs like irrigation equipment and storage sacks. She hopes this will enable her to boost her production and hence increase her income. She will therefore be able to improve her living standards such as with modern housing and quality health care. 
Damaris is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as irrigation equipment and storage sacks to help boost farm proceeds

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 40 years old, married, and has two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2011 to benefit from training especially enterprise management to boost her enterprise. Her economic activity is vegetable farming and green grocer shop. 

Eunice is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and manure to enable her increase her vegetable production thereby increasing the stock in her green grocer shop.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde desea realizar sus siembras que ese el que muestra en la fotografía y asi poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: The youth who has his face blanked out is 27 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. He has worked in agriculture for a number of years planting corn and beans. He sells his product in the area surrounding his residence. With what he makes from his sales he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He lives in his own house with his family. At present he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc. to improve the land where he wants to grow which is shown in the photograph and be able to have higher economic revenues.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc. and improve the earth.

loans.name: Imelda Lorena

texts.es: Imelda de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la agricultura y tiene un taller de costura desde hace 39 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Imelda quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía pero no tiene de suficiente capital para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos, hierro entre otros materiales y pago de mano de obra y así ella y su esposo puedan vivir mas cómodos.
texts.en: Imelda is 56 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. She works in agriculture and has had a small sewing workshop for 39 years. With what she makes from her sales she manages to pay some of the household expenses. Imelda wants to improve her house constructing a room in the place shown in the photograph. But she doesn't have sufficient capital to do so, so she is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand and re-bar amongst other materials and pay for labor. Then she and her husband can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks and re-bar amongst other materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Leonarda Angelica

texts.es: Leonarda de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas y su nieta, ella se dedica a la agricultura principalmente cultiva maíz y frijol desde hace 30 años cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas entre otras cosas y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Leonarda is 63 years old and lives in her own home with her 2 daughters and her granddaughter. She makes a living in agriculture, mainly cultivating corn and beans for 30 years. Her crops are stored in the silos shown in this photograph and then sold in different markets close to her home. She is requesting this loan to buy more seeds, compost, fertilizer, pest controls, etc., thus improving the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy more seeds, compost, fertilizer, and pest controls among other things

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esa actividad de la cual logra obtener buenos ingresos, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para seguir con sus cultivos y así tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: The youth who has his face blurred is 29 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. He works in agriculture growing basic grains (corn and beans). He has been doing this for 10 years which allows him to have good income. He lives in his own house with his wife and daughter. He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc. to improve the land shown in the photograph and thus have higher economic income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc and improve the land.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en: Matluba is a strong woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1983. She lives in the city with her family. She is divorced and has one child. She tries to raise her child without any difficulties. Since 2012 she started to do business in order to feed her family and raise her child. She has a business of selling and buying food products. She wants to earn money to live better. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders and IMON to buy food products. She is hoping to be supported.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre de 53 años, casado,  tiene 2 hijos varones de 8 y 15 años y 2 hijas mujeres de 4 y 10 años, y su negocio es la tapicería.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, constante, independiente, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘cruce villa Adela’ un área caracterizada por conectar a varias zonas de la ciudad, dónde el transporte público tiene paradas, desde este lugar las personas se pueden movilizar a otras zonas alejadas, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-14 grados centígrados.
Julio es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la disfruta junto a su esposa que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos; los 3 mayores estudian en la escuela, la menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la tapicería, específicamente al tapizado de sillas y asientos de movilidades como; autos, buses, motos, etc., su taller se encuentra en la carretera camino a la localidad de Viacha, “Inicié mi negocio como ayudante, trabajando para la familia de mi esposa,  luego me independicé y ahora toda mi familia trabaja en el negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que toda su familia ayuda en la labor, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para la compra de telas de tapiz. Su sueño es ampliar su taller, el desea realizar la compra de tapiz para forrar los asientos de autos para cumplir con sus contratos pendientes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos dentro de la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad independientemente. 
Es por esos motivos que Julio solicita un préstamo para la compra de tapiz por mayor para cumplir con las fechas de sus contratos pendientes y entregar los pedidos a tiempo.
texts.en:
Julio is a 53 year old man, he's married and has two sons ages 8 and 15 and two daughters ages 4 and 10. He makes a living working in upholstery. He is a good father, entrepreneurial, constant, independent, responsible and hard-working. He works in the "Cruce Villa Adela" area which is characterized by joining various of the city's zones, having public transport stops from which people an mobilize to and from far away areas. It has cold and dry weather with a temperature that varies between 2-14 degrees centigrade. 
Julio is of dark complexion, brown eyes, short black hair, short stature and medium physical complexion. His mother tongue is Aymara which he speaks with his family and he speak Spanish as is the general culture and for the business he works in. 
He enjoys his life together with his wife who works in commerce and his children; the eldest three of whom are students, the youngest is not yet of school age. They live in a home belonging to the family, built out of bricks and cement with a calamine roof which has potable water, electricity and a sewage system.
His business is upholstery, especially the upholstery of chairs and seats for vehicles such as cars, buses, motorcycles, etc. His shop is on the road en route to the Viacha locality. 
"I started my business as a helper, working for my wife's family, eventually I became independent and now my whole family works in the business..." he shares. His business' advantage is that the whole family helps in the labor, the disadvantage is the lack of investment capital for the purchase of textiles.
His dream is to expand his shop, he wishes to purchase tapestry to line car seats to be able to fulfill his pending contracts. This is the second sequence of loans within the institution in three years during which he has been working independently in this business. This is why Julio is requesting a loan for the purchase of wholesale tapestry to meet his current contracts' deadlines and deliver the orders on time.

loans.use: purchase wholesale tapestry to meet his current contracts' deadlines and deliver orders on time

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various commodities, including biscuits, noodles, canned goods, cooking oil, soap, condiments and beverages. She is 40-year-old married woman with four children with ages from 3 to 19 years. She has been engaged in her sari-sari store business for 10 years. 

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted goods like canned goods, soft drinks and wine. This stock will help Maribeth improve her store content and attract more buyers to shop. Thus, her daily income will be augmented and she can continue to finance the schooling of her children.

Maribeth hopes that she will prosper in managing her livelihood for brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods like canned goods, soft drinks and wine

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 56 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Edith works very hard to provide for them.

Edith runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Edith has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, sardines, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Edith would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
Lenita is 44 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are in school. Lenita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, coffee, egg, chips, etc.

Lenita has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Lenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, coffee, egg, chips, etc.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is a 32-year-old dairy farmer from the Kericho area of Kenya. Kericho experiences a cold and wet climate throughout the year. This makes it a hub for tea farming and other high altitude crops. The challenge, however, is that most vegetables that are consumed daily by the population cannot fare well in such cold conditions. 
Duncan's solution to this challenge is building a greenhouse. Due to the costly nature of putting up a greenhouse, Duncan needs help from Kiva loans to raise part of the construction costs. 
With your investment, Duncan will be able to plant vegetables and other crops in the greenhouse, which provides warmth and other conditions necessary for them to flourish. This will benefit his family with a wider variety of food and increased income.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe works hard to support her family. Maria Fe  is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Maria Fe  has been in this business for 3 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Rosell Trinidad

texts.es:
Rosell expresa su felicidad mostrando sus instrumentos de trabajo como mecánico automotriz, mientras cuenta lo bien que le ha ido después de su ultimo préstamo, con el cual compró una bomba central de frenos para ofrecer un mejor servicio. Durante 30 años, este señor de 58 años de edad ha logrado crecer personal y profesionalmente con su familia y con su negocio, por lo que no duda en agradecer a todos lo que le han apoyado, en especial en el crédito anterior que lo llevó a incrementar la cantidad de clientes. 
Ahora, un año después, se siente listo para hacer una nueva inversión y seguir creciendo junto con su negocio. En estos momentos Rosell está solicitando un préstamo para comprar repuestos y herramientas para su taller automotriz, con las cuales podrá seguir mejorando cada vez más su servicio con la ayuda de uno de sus hijos. Con este nuevo préstamo crecerá económicamente y mejorará la calidad de su vida. En un futuro considera ampliar la instalación y adoquinarla.
texts.en: Rosell expresses his happiness displaying his instruments for his work as an automotive mechanic, while considering how well he has fared after his last loan (which he used to buy a new master break cylinder to offer better service). For 30 years, this man of 58 years has managed to grow personally and professionally with his family and with his business. Without doubt, he is grateful to all who have helped him, especially with his previous loan which led to an increase in customers. Now, one year later, he feels ready to make a new investment and continue growing with his business. At present Rosell is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts and tools for his automotive workshop, so he will be able to continue improving his service with the help of one of his sons. With this new loan he will grow economically and improve the quality of his life. In future he is considering expanding the facility and workshop.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Jane. She is 53 years old, married and living with her husband and her three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 and has undergone all its training on entrepreneurial skills and financial management.
She operates a general retail shop where she sells foodstuffs like sugar, cooking oil, salt, bread, milk and much more. She has applied to Kiva for a loan to add stock to her shop to increase sales and also meet her customers' demands. 

Jane is very happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva and her lenders. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs e.g. sugar, cooking oil, salt, bread and milk so as to add stock her general retail shop to increase sales and meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el trabaja como empleado informal desde hace 5 años y con lo que obtiene de su trabajo es como logra salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando las paredes de su casa pero con lo que obtiene de sus trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra y asi el y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y en lo limpio.
texts.en: Manuel is 36 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and their child. He has been working as an informal employee for the past five years and his income from work has allowed him to provide for the expenses at home. He wants to improve his residence by plastering the walls of his house, but the income from his work is not enough to pay for it, which is why he is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and pay for labor allowing him and his family to live more comfortably and cleanly.

loans.use: purchase sand, cement and pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de comida y también posee una tienda, tiene 9 años de tener dichos negocios, los cuales le dejan buenas ganancias, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar,  ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, huevos, bebidas, frutas, pollos, carnes, entre otros productos por mayor para sus dos negocios y asi poder tener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This 29-year-old woman has pixelated her face because she lives in a high-risk area. She makes a living selling food and also has a store. She has had these businesses for 9 years, which leave her good profits. With the sales she makes she is able to cover some household expenses. She lives in her own home with her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase basic grains, eggs, drinks, fruit, chicken, meat, and other products in bulk for her two businesses. This will enable her to have better economic income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, eggs, drinks, fruit, chicken, meat, and other products in bulk

loans.name: Lucel

texts.en:
Lucel is 32 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, soap, soft drinks, etc.

Lucel has been in this business for 10 years.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, soap, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Samson, a 36-year-old smallholder farmer from the rain-fed Rift Valley escarpments in Kenya. Samson has been married for 7 years and now he has 2 children, aged 1 and 6. To provide for his growing family, Samson keeps 2 dairy cows and 10 heads of poultry and grows tea on his 1.2 acre farm. He dug a well for water and dozens of trees to provide shelter, timber and fuel for cooking. 

Samson is seeking a KES 80,000 loan to purchase a plot of land to fit his farm operations. Currently, the space he has is fully utilized and he wants to acquire more space to facilitate the growth of his business. 

With your loan, Samson will be able to grow his dairy, poultry and tea farm without squeezing everything together. This will lead to sustainable growth of his farming activities and family income.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman, 50 years old, and has seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Mary Ann has a furniture making business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase wood, nails, varnish and other materials for her furniture making.

Mary Ann has been in this business for three years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, varnish and other materials for her furniture making

loans.name: Luisa Emilia

texts.es:
Luisa es una mujer humilde y trabajadora, tiene cuarenta y nueve años de edad. Posee una mente creativa que ha explotado para elaborar preciosos bolsos, billeteras, mochilas entre otros. Luego ella  comercializa sus productos de forma ambulante en dos ciudades del país. Apoyada por su esposo, empezó este negocio como un emprendimiento que ayudase a sacar a sus cuatros hijos adelante. 
Las manos de luisa están marcadas por un arduo trabajo, en estos momentos ella solicita la ayuda de Kiva junto a MiCrédito para que se le brinde un préstamo que le permita cambiar su letrina por un inodoro y con esto mejorar la condición en la que vive, no contaminar el suelo y tener una mejor higiene para ella y sus seres queridos. En un futuro Luisa desea primeramente que su negocio se fortalezca cada vez más, para luego hacer poco a poco mejoras a su hogar y poder iniciar una tienda de variedades en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Luisa is a humble and hard-working woman. She is 49 years old. She has a creative mind which she uses to make precious handbags, wallets and back-packs amongst others. Later she sells her products itinerantly in two cities of the country. Supported by her husband, she started this business as an undertaking to help raise her 4 children. Lusa's hands are marked by her hard work.

At this time she is requesting the help of Kiva together with MiCrédito to give her a loan which would allow her to change her outhouse for a toilet and doing this improve the conditions in which she lives, stop polluting the earth and enjoy better sanitation for her loved ones. In the future Luisa wants to strengthen her business more and then make improvement to her home little by little to be able to open a variety store in her house.

loans.use: to buy a toilet, washbasin and tiles.

loans.name: Daliva

texts.en:
Daliva is 62 years old, married and has six children.

Daliva is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Daliva has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Daliva has been in this business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Malinche Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras (María Auxiliadora, Francisca y María Emelina)  que se organizaron hace 1 año, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y condiciones de vida de sus familias.

Francisca: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario Malinche, es una mujer cordial, con cualidades de líder. Tiene 45 años de edad, casada con 1  hijo de 10 años de edad, no asiste al colegio porque tiene problemas psicomotores. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia, desde hace 2 años vende en su vivienda de tambo y madera frijoles cosidos, queso, carbón. Gracias a los créditos anteriores otorgados por Pana Pana y financiados por Kiva le han permitido diversificar sus productos, actualmente estableció una pequeña pulpería donde vende granos básicos y chiverías. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar más mercadería y surtir con nuevos productos su pequeño negocio y así incrementar sus ingresos. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en: This group is made of three determined women (María Auxiliadora, Francisca and María Emelina) who organized 1 year ago with the purpose of obtaining financing for their small businesses, improving their incomes, and improving quality of life for their families. Francisca is the coordinator of the solidarity group Malinche. She is a friendly woman with leadership qualities. She is 45 years old and married, with one 10-year-old son who does not go to school because he has pyschomotor problems. In order to raise her family, 2 years ago she began selling cooked beans, cheese, and charcoal out of her home. Thanks to previous loans granted by Pana Pana and funded by Kiva she has been able to diversify her products, and established a small grocery store where she sells basic grains and snacks. She is requesting this financing to buy more merchandise and fill her small business with new products, thus increasing her income. Her dream is to have a thriving business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, beans, cheese, and charcoal among other products

loans.name: Maryam's Group

texts.en:
Maryam is a 57 year old lady.  She is the mother of two sons.  One son owns a workshop in which he provides services to maintain autos.  He is expert in his techniques and can easily fix the autos in no time. He has to use various types of tools for the repair.  A few days ago, he shifted his workshop to another place.  Due to the move, some important and expensive tools have been misplaced.

Maryam requested a loan for her son so that her son would be able to compensate against this loss. He will buy repairing tools, spare parts, tires, break shoes, etc., for the auto repair workshop. She is hopeful that her son will utilize this amount in a positive way and his monthly income will increase. She thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy repair tools, spare parts, tires, etc.

loans.name: Women / Men Of Hope Group

texts.en:
The man raising his hand in the photo is John. He is 57 years old, is married and is the father of ten children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2014 and has undergone the trainings which helped him manage his business better by having proper records.

John practices banana farming and is applying for Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, soil supplements and banana suckers to enable him to expand his banana farming and in future earn more income to help him provide better education to his children.

He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, soil supplements and banana suckers to add stock to his banana farm

loans.name: James

texts.en:
The person in the photo is James, aged 37. He is married and a father of five children. He joined Hand in Hand in 2014 to benefit from its training, especially in enterprise development and financial management. 

He has practiced mixed farming for the last ten years, where he keeps livestock and farms food crops such as maize, beans, potatoes, cabbages, etc. James is applying for a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer for his crops and animal feed for his dairy cows which will help him increase his income levels and meet customers' demands.

James is happy with Kiva and its lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his food crops and animal feed for his dairy cows which will help him increase his income levels and meet customers' demands.

loans.name: Rimen Yoel

texts.es:
Rimen Yoel tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.
