El se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente, una bebida tradicional de la sierra del Perú, su elaboración se realiza en base al proceso artesanal mediante el trapiche, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de mayor cantidad de caña de azúcar la que es materia prima para la elaboración de aguardiente y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rimen Yodel is 23 years old, he lives with his wife and children in the district of Callayuc, a community which is dedicated to agriculture, trade and livestock. It is located in Jaen province, belonging to the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountain range of Peru. 

He earns a living distilling aguardiente, a traditional drink from the Peruvian mountains. It is produced throguh an artisanal process using a 'trapiche' sugar mill. Rimen Yodel has asked for a loan in order to purchase a bigger quantity of sugar cane, the primary material for the production of aguardiente. Through this he will be able to earn a larger income for his family which will help to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a bigger quantity of sugar cane which is the raw material used for the production of aguardiente (liquor)

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is married and works hard to support her family. She operates a dried fish making business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for one year.

Merly requested a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more fish, sacks of salt, and other materials for her business. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish, sacks of salt, and other materials

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
17 son la mujeres que integran este grupo, ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, y por medio de ello quieren poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ayudar a su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Zulma, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir que está en una pobreza extrema. Ella se dedica a la venta de mandioca y por medio de su humilde trabajo lucha para poder tener los medios y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar mandioca en cantidad, y con ello poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo y cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of 17 women.  They are part of the elimination of poverty program.  Through the program they want to be able to improve their living conditions and help their families.

Zulma is one of the members.  On the survey her degree of poverty was within level one.  That means that she is in extreme poverty.  She sells cassava.  Through her humble work she struggles to be able to have the means to help her family.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy cassava in bulk.  With this she will be able to continue with her work as she has been doing, and she will fill her customers’ orders.

loans.use: to buy cassavas to sell.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María Mercedes tiene 64 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su esposo en casa propia en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de Nueva Arica y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio y está ubicada en el distrito de Cayalti, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

María Mercedes se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de cerdos, desde hace más de 10 años de antigüedad en el negocio, el mismo que se encuentra en la parte posterior de su domicilio. María Mercedes solicita préstamo para la compra de cerdos y alimento de engorde balanceado para los mismos y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio aumentando su stock para poder atender toda la demanda de su público consumidor, lo que en un corto plazo se verá reflejado en mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende en una mejora de su calidad de vida y la de su familia
texts.en:
María Mercedes is 64 years old, she lives with her partner is her own house in a small community. It is in the rural zone Nueva Arica and she has good working and personal relations with her neighbours. Her community earns a living from agriculture, livestock and trade, and is located in the Cayalti province of the Chiclayo region, Lambayeque, Peru's northern coast region. 

María Mercedes earns a living raising and selling pigs, she has done this for more than 10 years, running her business from the back of her home. She is asking for a loan in order to buy pigs, and nutritious, fattening foods for them in order to grow her business and increase her stock to be able to meet the needs of her consumers. In a short time this will be reflected in a larger revenue, better earnings and therefore will help to improve the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and fattening, nutritious foods for them

loans.name: Willy

texts.en: Willy is a 41-year-old farmer from the Kapsowar area of Kenya where farming is almost the only economic activity. More specifically, his farm is situated in Moiben, where dairy farming is the most common economic activity. Crop farming is generally done for subsistence, which leads to shortages of vegetables in the market. Willy is seeking a loan to venture into crop farming. He has adequate land space to start this business. The fact he is seeking a loan means he is going to treat crop farming not merely for subsistence but as a commercial activity. This will not only diversify his agri-business, but also act as a proof of concept for other farmers to emulate.

loans.use: to venture into crop farming

loans.name: Dedicacion Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario DEDICACIÓN, está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras de la etnia Miskita (Yessica, Julieta, Petrona), viven en Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron hace aproximadamente 4 años, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana, para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios. 

YESSICA: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una joven sonriente de 27 años de edad, amable, con cualidades de líder. Está casada con 2 hijos: El mayor de 10 años estudia su quinto grado de primaria y un pequeño de 4 años de edad. Con el propósito de apoyar con los gastos del hogar, desde hace 7 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo y madera. Solicita financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, chivería, materiales de limpieza, pan, huevo, entre otros productos. Su sueño es construir un anexo de madera, para utilizarlo como local de su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
The solidary group Dedicacion, is formed of three enterprising Miskitan women, Yessica, Julieta, and Petrona. They live in Bilwi, in the municipality  of Puerto Cabezas. They came together approximately 4 years ago, in order to access funding with a joint guarantee en Pana Pana, to improve their living conditions, to cover the basic needs of their homes, to ensure the education of their children and to expand their businesses. 

Yessica is the leader of the solidary group, she is a young and friendly 27 year old, with leadership qualities. She is married with 2 children, the eldest is 10 years old and studies in 5th grade, the younger is 4 years old. With the intention of helping out with the household expense, she set up a small grocery stall 7 years ago in the entrance to her wooden home, 

She is asking for financing to buy basic grains,   chivería (dairy products), cleaning materials, bread, and eggs amongst other products. Her dream is to build an adjoining wooden shop to use as the premises for her small business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains,   chivería (dairy products), cleaning materials, bread, and eggs amongst other products

loans.name: La Esperanza 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Esperanza 2 está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, todas y cada una quiere ir mejorando sus vidas e ir superando su situación de pobreza cada día y por medio de su esfuerzo.
La Sra. Cintia es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles, ella misma se encarga de hacer sus comidas, y después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Solicita de este préstamo para invertir en sula compra de verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, y así continuar con la  venta de comestibles. Cabe destacar que las integrantes de este grupo han trabajado y logrado unirse más entre ellas.
texts.en:
The group La Esperanza 2 (The Hope 2) is in its third loan cycle of the women's committee program. Each and every member wants to keep improving their lives and trying daily to overcome their poverty through their efforts.

Cintia, one of the members, sells food items. She herself is in charge of making meals and then going out to sell them on the street. She is requesting this loan to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, produce and more in order to be able to continue selling meals. Note that the members of the group have worked and managed to become more unified.

loans.use: buy vegetables, meat, condiments, produce and more for making food.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Primavera, está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty,  es una zona que aún se encuentra en crecimiento, eminentemente rural, donde todas quieren crecer.
La Señora, Justina, es una de las integrantes, ella es comerciante, tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que trabaja todos los días para poder tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella es una persona que se esfuerza para poder ganarse la vida de una manera digna y honesta.
Solicita  este préstamo para la compra de productos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, carne, hortalizas, enlatados, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group is called Primavera, they are in their first cycle of the women's committee program. They are from the city of Curuguaty, an area that is developing, very rural, where everyone wants to grow. 
Justina is one of the members. She is a businesswoman, she has a well-stocked store where she works every day in order to have the means to help her family. She is a person who works hard to earn a living in a dignified, honest way. 
She is seeking this loan to buy various products for her store, such as vegetables, meat, produce, canned goods, baked goods and other items, so she can continue on with her work.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, produce, canned goods, baked goods and more

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Roque está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una de ellas quieren ir mejorando cada día para poder ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Deolinda es una de las integrantes de este grupo,  ella es modista, y comenta que tiene muchos clientes que siempre le hacen muchos pedidos. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere ir creciendo y superándose cada día. Solicita este préstamo para invertir en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, cierres y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y luchando cada día.
texts.en: The San Roque Group is in its first cycle of the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other to progress. They are having a poll for poverty elimination, where each of them wants to improve day by day in order to help their families. Deolinda is one of the group members. She is a seamstress, and she says that she has many customers who always order a lot from her. She is a very hardworking and tenacious woman who wants to keep on growing and progressing. She is requesting this loan to buy fabrics, threads, rubber bands, zippers, and other things, so she can continue sewing as she has been doing so far. She is grateful for the opportunity she gets to keep on growing and striving every day.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, rubber bands, zippers and other things.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel tiene 64 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío El Chingue, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a caseríos aledaños a su comunidad, ocasionalmente brinda servicios agrícolas mediante el arado con su yunta. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para su mototaxi ya que se encuentra en mal estado y de esta manera seguir brindando este servicio, esto le generará mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José Manuel is 64 years old and lives together with his wife and children in Caserio El Chingue, a rural zone in the district of Pucara, a community of warm climate. Its population earns a living from agriculture, trade and livestock, it is located in Jaen province which belongs to the Cajamarca region, in the northern Peruvian mountains. 

He provides public transport in his of motorbike taxi, moving passengers to nearby, surrounding villages, occasionally he provides agricultural services using the plough with his team of oxen.

He has asked for a loan to buy spare parts of his motorbike taxi which is in bad condition. This will enable him to carry on providing this service, which will generate him more revenue in order to improve the quality of life for his family and for himself.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi which is in poor condition.

loans.name: Praxedes

texts.en:
Praxedes is a resident of the town of Loon, Bohol. She is a 63-year-old married woman, with six grown children. She earns a living by selling bahalina (aged coconut wine). She is in need of capital to continue to operate her business.

Praxedes has requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy additional stock of tuba (coconut wine), tungog (which gives tuba its bitter taste and maroon color), and gallon containers (for storage). These materials  are important in producing more tuba. With this loan, she will be able to cater to her customers' needs, and her income will grow.  

Praxedes dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and successful in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of tuba (coconut wine), tungog (which gives tuba its bitter taste and maroon color), and gallon containers (for  storage)

loans.name: Edward

texts.es:
Edward tiene 34 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus 2 menores hijos, él es natural de la zona, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. Edward vive en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves menores como gallinas, patos, pollos, entre otros, las compras las realiza en caseríos cercanos y vende en el distrito de Pucará, tiene 6 años de experiencia en esta actividad y buenas referencias en su distrito. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de aves para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esto le generará mayores ingresos y así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Edward is 34 years old, he lives in his own house made of crude materials, with his spouse and their 2 children. Edward lives in the rural part of the Pucara district, a community dedicated to agriculture, trade and the raising of livestock. He is a native of the region and has good working and personal references. The region is located in Jaen province, in the Cajamarca region in the northern Peruvian mountains. 

He earns a living raising and selling birds such as hens, ducks, and chickens among others. He buts them in nearby villages and sells them in the district of Pucara. He has 6 years of experience doing this, and good references in the region. The loan will be used to buy a bigger umber of birds to increase the stock of his business, this will generate him more revenue and will help him to be able to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a bigger quantity of birds to increase the stock of his business,

loans.name: Ma. Erma

texts.en:
Ma. Erma is a hard-working female entrepreneur, with one child.

She has a business making candy in the Philippines, and has requested a 60,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has successfully repaid her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Erma dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Aida Esperanza

texts.es: Con 36 años de edad Aida está casada y tiene 4 hijos  de 9, 12,17 y 19 años de los cuales uno va al colegio y 2 van la escuela,  Aida se dedica a criar animales menores y a la ganadería desde que era muy joven, Aida comenta que le va bien en este negocio y que le gustaría mejorarlo, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y a trabajar al jornal, con el crédito va a comprar una vaca que la tiene en hierba por la que paga arriendo, la  meta de  Aida es seguir cuidando  adecuadamente a sus animales para que su negocio sea rentable y pagar los gastos de educación y alimentación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aida, 36 years old, is married and has four children, ages 9, 12, 17, and 19.  Among them, two attend school, while one goes to a college. 

Aida has raised small livestock and cattle since she was very young. She comments that the business is going well and she would like to improve it. Her husband is a farmer and day laborer.

With the loan she will buy a cow which she currently has in pasture on land she rents. 

Aida's goal is to continue providing adequate care for her livestock, so that her business may be profitable, and to cover the educational costs and food needs of her children.

loans.use: purchase a cow.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “DIOS ES AMOR HABASPATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Sabina se dedica al negocio de ganadería , la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar ganado.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She is a member of the “DIOS ES AMOR HABASPATA” communal bank, located in the Vilcabamba district, La Convencion province, and Cusco department.

Sabina raises livestock, fattens them up and sells them at different fairs.  She works from 8:00am to 6:00 pm and wants to get ahead through this work.  Her dream is to expand her business and is asking for this loan to buy livestock.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: José Bayardo

texts.es:
José Bayardo tiene 34 años de edad, y vive junto a su esposa y sus 4 pequeños hijos en la zona norte de Nicaragua. Desde hace 10 años, la producción de café es su principal actividad económica, y en los últimos tres ha logrado incrementos importantes en los rendimientos de su producción, producto de la implementación de las recomendaciones técnicas que recibe del equipo de la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), a la cual está afiliado.

Las mejoras de su finca y sus ingresos en estos años, ha motivado a este pequeño emprendedor a continuar implementando buenas prácticas, lo cual incluye la aplicación de insumos agrícolas para garantizar la nutrición de sus plantas, por lo que para este año él está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita garantizar la compra de estos insumos para lograr una mejor cosecha y con ello mayores recursos para el bienestar de su familia.

El sueño de José Bayardo, es lograr producir un café de alta calidad para poder acceder a mercado diferenciados, y darle a sus hijos mejores condiciones que las que él ha tenido.
texts.en:
José Bayardo is 34 years old and lives with his wife and his 4 small children in an area of the North of Nicaragua. For 10 years growing coffee has been his main economic activity and in the last 3 he has made great increase in the level of his production. This through implementing the technical recommendations that he has received from the team at a asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC) of which he is a member.

The improvements in his plantation and his income in these years has motivated this small entrepreneur to continue using good practices which includes applying agricultural inputs to guarantee the nutrition of his plants. So this year he is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy these inputs to reap a better harvest and with that more resources for the well-being of his family.

José Bayardo's dream is to manage to produce a coffee of high quality to be able to access the discerning markets and provide his children better living conditions than what he had.

loans.use: to buy inputs to ensure the nutrition of his coffee crops which is his main source of income.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a 57-year-old widow, with five children.

Perla works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, and other groceries, to sell.

Perla has previously borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF. She has been running her general store for 3 years, and also earns an income from food vending.

Perla aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to purchase ingredients like coconut milk, salt, sugar, etc.

Melinda has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Melinda would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as coconut milk, salt, sugar, etc

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “DIOS ES AMOR HABASPATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Bernardino se dedica al negocio de venta de artesania,el socio vende mantas y telares, el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante y ser un empresario prospero, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de artsania.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar mantas y telares.


El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
He is a member of the “DIOS ES AMOR HABASPATA” communal bank, located in the Vilcabamba district, La Convencion province, and Cusco department.

Bernardino sells arts and crafts, blankets and knittings, and wants to get ahead and be prosperous through this business.  His dream is to expand his business and is asking for a loan to buy blankets and knittings.

He is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy blankets and knittings.

loans.name: Randelyn

texts.en:
Randelyn works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a business making dried fish in the Philippines.

Randelyn has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to purchase more fish, sacks of salt, and other materials for her business. She has been in this business for 2 years.

Randelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, sacks of salt, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Renerose

texts.en:
Renerose works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a business making dried fish in the Philippines.

Renerose has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to purchase more fish and other materials for her business. She has been in this business for 5 years.

Renerose would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en:
Nelinda works hard to support her family. She is married, and has business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.

She has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF, to purchase more stock of bananas to sell. Nelinda has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Nelinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of bananas to sell

loans.name: Jaime José

texts.es:
Jaime es un joven emprendedor de 26 años, y junto a su esposa se dedica a trabajar su finca en la cual cultivan principalmente café. Para el manejo de sus cafetales, recibe asistencia técnica de parte del equipo de la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), a la cual está afiliado.

El ciclo pasado, este joven tuvo la oportunidad de contar con un financiamiento  para el mantenimiento de sus plantaciones, con lo cual pudo obtener buenos resultados y logró cancelar  sus obligaciones financieras en tiempo y forma. 

Para este año, la meta de Jaime es incrementar su producción de café, para ello está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar y aplicar los fertilizantes y abonos que le ayudarán a mejorar la nutrición de sus plantas de café a fin de asegurar una buena cosecha.

El sueño de este visionario joven es ir aumentando el área de su finca y de café y tener mayores ingresos para ir mejorando las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is a young 26 year old entrepreneur who, along with his wife, work on the farm and primarily raise coffee.  He receives technical assistance from the “Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC)” team, of which he is a member, to manage his crops.

Last cycle this young man had the opportunity to obtain a loan to maintain his plants, and he was able to obtain good results.  He was also able to pay his debts on time.

This year Jaime’s goal is to increase his coffee production, so he is asking for a loan to buy and apply fertilizer and compost that will help feed his coffee plants and provide a better harvest.

This visionary’s dream is to increase his farm’s size and income so he can improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Titus, a 22-year-old farmer from the Kaibarak location in Kenya. 

Titus is a hard-working horticultural farmer, who grows maize on his small piece of land. Last year's harvest was great, and he used part of the money to buy a motorcycle, so that he could eliminate brokers and sell his produce directly at the markets, at far better prices. It was a wise decision on his part.
 
For this season, Titus needs some help from external financing to plant maize once more. He will make initial loan repayments from the income generated by offering transportation services on his motorcycle to the members of his community. Income from these services will also help him with part of the input expenses, as he prays for an equally successful season this year.

loans.use: to plant crops this season

loans.name: Thalia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “DIOS ES AMOR HABASPATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia se dedica al negocio de venta de gas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.,m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender gas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar gas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She is a member of the “DIOS ES AMOR HABASPATA” communal bank, located in the Vilcabamba district, La Convencion province, and Cusco department.

She sells gas and works from 8:00am to 4:00pm.  She has been working this business for five years and things are going well for her.  Her dream is to have a shop to sell gas from.  She is asking for a loan to buy gas.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy gas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy vegetables, fruits and more.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
20 son las mujeres que integran este grupo llamado Nuevo amanecer, lleva este nombre, ya que cada una ve como un nuevo amanecer, no solo para ellas, sino también para sus familias por medio de esta oportunidad, además están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elena quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de bebidas que hace, está luchando para ir superando su situación de pobreza, y poder ayudar a su familia a tener una mejor calidad de vida. Ella se destaca por ser una persona sacrificada que quiere salir adelante.
La Sra. Elena  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de bebidas en general gaseosas, cervezas, vinos, jugos, etc. lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: Twenty are the women who form this group called " Nuevo amanecer" (New dawn). It has this name, because each of these women sees the group as a new dawn, an opportunity, not only for them, but also for their families. Also, they belong to the program of poverty elimination. Elena is one of its members. Thanks to her effort and continuous work, and through the sale of drinks, she is struggling to overcome her poverty situation and be able to help her family have a better quality of life. She is characterized for being an unselfish person who wants to move ahead. Elena is requesting this loan to buy drinks in general, sodas, beer, wine, juices, etc., which will help her to implement her business plan, that will help her improve her income and keep on helping her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks in general, sodas, beer, wine, juices, etc.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Loreta works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell gasoline. Loreta is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell in her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Loreta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: a loan helps Maryum to purchase garments to fulfill the demand.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Theresa is 37 years old and has two children, who are still in school.

Theresa has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. She has requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to pay for spare parts for her computers and maintenance for her business.

Theresa has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts for her computers and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Leyla Del Socorro

texts.es:
Leyla es una mujer y  madre admirable, que ha logrado destacarse en su trabajo y brindarles a sus hijos un hogar saludable. Desde hace más de diez años, ella se dedica a la producción de café con el apoyo de sus dos hijos mayores, y en los últimos tres años ha logrado incrementar la producción de su finca.

El esfuerzo de esta mujer en la implementación de las buenas prácticas, le ha permitido lograr certificar su finca con Comercio Justo, C.A.F.E. Practices y UTZ, lo cual reconoce que es muy importante para el desarrollo sostenible de su actividad, y el acceso a mejores mercados.

Para este año, Leyla se continúa proponiendo el incremento de los rendimientos y la calidad de su café, para ello está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita asegurar la compra de insumos agrícolas para el mantenimiento de sus plantaciones. Asegura, que este tipo de inversiones son las que le ayudarán a construir la herencia que sueña dejar a sus hijos, que es la educación, el amor al trabajo y una finca productiva que ellos continúen tecnificando.
texts.en:
Leyla is an admirable woman and mother who has managed to stand out in her work and provide her children with a healthy home.  She has been raising coffee for ten years, with the help of her oldest children and has managed to increase production on her farm in the last three years.

Her use of good practices has allowed her to certify her farm through C.A.F.E. and UTZ, which recognize that it’s very important for her sustainable development and access to better markets.

This year Leyla wants to continue increasing production and quality of her coffee, so she is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies to maintain her crops.  She says that this is the type of investment that helps build the inheritance that she dreams of leaving for her children, such as education, love of work, and a productive farm that they can continue to work.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Mburukuya Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mburukuya está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité de mujeres integrado por 17 mujeres todos ellas vecinas, amigas y algunas parientes hacen todo lo posible para sobresalir y llevar adelante con sus familias.
Teodora se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, tiene todo tipo de marcas y clases de productos que siempre gusta a sus clientas, ella quiere seguir creciendo y es por eso que pone todo su entusiasmo para poder mejorar por medio de las capacitaciones y las charlas. Es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de cosméticos variados, y con ello poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes y seguir luchando por generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
The “Mburukuya” group is on its fifth loan cycle as part of the women’s committee programme. The group has 17 women as members, all neighbours, friends and some related to each other. The members are doing everything that they can in order to get ahead and help their families.

One member is Teodora, who makes a living selling cosmetics. She sells all types of brands and products that her customers like. Teodora wants to keep on growing and therefore puts in all her enthusiasm at her business in order to improve through training and presentations. Teodora is very hard-working and wants to get ahead.

Teodora is applying for this loan in order to buy different cosmetic products and thus fulfil orders from her customers and continuing working hard to earn a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que permite que cada una de las integrantes del grupo conozca su situación de vida, y luego por medio de las capacitaciones vayan mejorando.
La Sra. Lourdes es una de las integrantes de este grupo, quien solicita de este préstamo para invertir en la venta de ropas, ya que quiere implementar este trabajo como un medio para generar ingresos y poder ayudar a su familia.
Es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante y pone todo de sí para poder lograrlo y cumplir con su meta. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Unidas ("Women United") forms part of a program to eliminate poverty. It allows members to understand their life situations and to later improve themselves through trainings.

Lourdes is one of the group members. She is requesting a loan to invest in clothing sales. She wants to work in this capacity as a means to generate income and help her family. She is hardworking and wants to succeed. She puts 100% effort into achieving and fulfilling goals. She is grateful for the opportunity to keep growing and getting ahead.

loans.use: buy various items of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Oñondivepa  está en su ciclo número 6º  del programa, es un nuevo grupo que quiere salir adelante, cada una de ellas pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante. Son mujeres jefas de familia muy luchadoras.
Sabina es integrante de este grupo, ella es costurera, tiene mucho trabajo de confecciones y comenta que poco a poco ha ido creciendo y mejorando y hoy día ya es muy conocida en todo su barrio. Su meta es poder seguir con su trabajo e ir creciendo y mejorando y todo esto lo podrá conseguir por medio de las capacitaciones que ira recibiendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas, botones, y otros.
texts.en:
The “Oñondivepa” is on its sixth loan cycle. It is a new group and its members – all women – want to do well. Each member puts in her hardest work in order to grow and mover forward. The members are all hard-working heads of family.

Sabina is a member of the group. She is a seamstress and has a lot of dressmaking jobs. She says that she has gradually grown and improved. Today she is well-known in her local area. Her aim is to be able to continue with her work, and expand and improve her business. She can do this through the training that she will receive.

Sabina is applying for this loan in order to buy threads, materials, glue, buttons and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy threads, materials, glue, buttons and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en:
Zahraa is a 20-year-old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her parents and three siblings. She is working hard and trying her best to be as helpful as she can in her family. She started her own job and opened a beauty salon in her house in 2014. She has her loyal customers, and is glad with the results she has attained so far.

Today, she is looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase beauty tools. In that way, she will be able to serve her customers with good-quality products.

loans.use: to purchase beauty tools.

loans.name: Firma

texts.en: Firma earns a living by selling snack foods like banana cue (deep fried bananas coated in caramelized sugar) and  fruit-flavored juice at the local school in her community. She is 59 years old, married and the mother of two children. Her younger child is 18. In addition to selling food, she runs a tuba (or coconut) wine vending business. She has requested a loan to buy stocks of tuba and soft drinks and to have additional capital for food-vending business. These supplies will help Firma augment her income. Her goal is to build a more successful business in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy food to sell.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is a single 20-year-old Lebanese woman who lives with her parents and two siblings. She’s really proud of her family and ready to do her best to offer them a respectable life. Because she knows that her father’s income does not satisfy their needs, she has decided to help him and to open her own clothing shop. To better develop her business, she’s requesting a youth loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise to sell and to renovate her shop. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and thus increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell and to renovate her shop.

loans.name: Yaquelin Del Socorro

texts.es:
Con una sonrisa encantadora y actitud muy hospitalaria, te recibe Yaquelin, una mujer de cincuenta y un años de edad que se ha dedicado toda su vida a trabajar muy duro, para salir adelante por ella y su único hijo. Ella dedica su día a día a ser supervisora de docentes, además ha logrado acondicionar habitaciones en su casa de habitación para alquilarlas y con esto mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Yaquelin ha recurrido a Kiva y MiCrédito para que se le otorgue un préstamo, con el cual ella pueda comprar materiales para hacerle mejoras en la cocina de las habitaciones que alquila, para brindar un mejor servició y lograr incrementar sus ingresos. En un futuro ella pretende hacer un hostal de dos plantas, con mayor capacidad para alojar personas.
texts.en:
With a charming smile and a hospitable spirit, 51-year-old Yaquelin has spent her life working very hard in order to do better for herself and for her only son. Yaquelin supervises teachers for a living. She also has rooms in her house that she rents out and earns money from in order to improve her quality of life.

Yaquelin has come to Kiva and MiCrédito in order to apply for another loan. She will use it to buy materials to make improvements to the kitchen at the rooms she rents out and provide better service. She can thus increase her income. 

In the future, Yaquelin plans to open a hostel with two storeys in order to host more people.

loans.use: to buy materials to make improvements to the kitchen at the rooms she rents out.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his farm

loans.name: Ann's Group

texts.en:
Ann is a 52-year-old proud mother of seven children. She is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing her group of fifteen farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Ann has noticed that she has been able to save more money.

Ann described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Ann’s Group will be able to plant a total of 9.5 acres of land and purchase a total of ten solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Los Cuatro Group

texts.es: Mario, tiene 38 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos, reside en una comunidad de Gracias, Lempira. Desde hace 12 años Mario decidió cultivar café ya que es una zona apta para el cultivo y ha obtenido buenos resultados. Este café lo vende en la misma zona. Actualmente está solicitando el cuarto ciclo de préstamo en la institución y en forma grupal, el cual es por 8,000 lempiras para comprar abonos y fertilizar la parcela de café. Tiene como meta ampliar su parcela sembrando mas café para obtener mejores ingresos. El grupo a que pertenece se llama Los Cuatro, y esta integrado por 4 personas que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura. Ellos solicitan un préstamo por 23,000 Lempiras para fertilizar sus fincas de café. En la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta Mario, sigue Blanca, Amada y Roselia a la derecha.
texts.en:
Mario is 38 years old, married and has three children. He lives in a community in Gracias, Lempire. At the age of 12 Mario decided to grow coffee, given that the climate is suited for cultivation. He has had good results. This coffee is sold in the same area.

He is requesting his fourth loan through the institution in the form of a group loan. The loan is for 8,000 lempiras to buy fertilizer to fertilize his coffee plot. He aims to expand his plot by planting more coffee in order to improve income. The group he belongs to is called Los Cuatro ("The Four") and is comprised of four people who live in the same area and work in agriculture. They request a loan of 23,000 lempiras to fertilize their coffee farms. Pictured in the photo from left-to-right are: Mario, Blanca, Amada and Roselia.

loans.use: buy fertilizer to fertilize the coffee crop.

loans.name: Kiganjo Ushindi S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Margret, a member of Kiganjo Ushindi S.h.g Group. She is 48 years old, married and a mother of two children.

Margret joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014. She has benefited from training on savings and enterprise management. She was able to get skills for better saving methods and enterprise development. Margret has also gained skills on how to run her poultry enterprise well and how to manage her income from the enterprise well.
She is borrowing from Kiva to buy more chickens and chicken feed to expand her poultry enterprise which will earn her more income that she can use to provide for her family.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the assistance and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Lino Andres

texts.es:
Don lino tiene 54 años y tiene 3 hijos de(32-26-17)años, es una persona muy entusiasta que participa en todas las reuniones y capacitaciones realizadas por la Asociación (APT del Norte), le gusta mucho la agricultura orgánica porque gracias a ella contribuye al cuidado del planeta y le trae grandes ingresos con los cuales ha podido educar a sus hijos los cuales tienen las siguientes profesiones: técnico eléctrico, técnico agropecuario y su ultima hija que quiere formarse como doctora.El Sr. lino cuenta con certificado orgánico en "vainas de tara", emitido por Controlunión. con 17 años en el Negocio y el asesoramiento técnico de la asociación de productores de tara se garantiza el éxito del negocio.
el préstamo ayudara a mejorar la producción de tara, generando mayores ingresos en la economía familiar y el cuidado del medio ambiente.
texts.en:
Lino is 54 years old and has three children of 32, 26, and 17 years of age. He is a very enthusiastic person who participates in all of the meetings and trainings conducted by the association APT del Norte. He loves organic agriculture because it contributes to environmental conservation and brings him great income. This could educate his children who have the following professions: electrical technician, agricultural technician, and his youngest daughter who wants to train as a doctor. Mr. Lino has certified organic "tara pods", issued by the control union. With 17 years in the business and technical advice from the producers association of tara, business success is guaranteed.

The loan will help to improve the production of tara, generating higher income in the household economy and the care of the environment.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for tara.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a new client to UGAFODE MICROFINANCE LTD.

He is 42 years old, married to Annie and together they have seven children aged 10 through 20 years old. All the children go to school. Geoffrey is a businessman and a farmer with a banana plantation and he is a resident of Kyempene, Rugarama, Rushenyi Ntungamo.

Geoffrey has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to help him buy dry grass that he will use to mulch his banana plantation. As a result of the recent sunshine, the soils lost a lot of moisture and he believes the grass will help to restore it and therefore increase his yields. Geoffrey is hard working and honest, and thanks the Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy mulch.

loans.name: Tone

texts.en:
Tone is a villager who lives in the northern part of the country. She is a married mother of three, and in the photograph above she is preparing the land for spring planting. The reason why she is asking for a loan from you is that she wants to buy 200 olive trees and 100 scion vines to plant. 

Her plans for the future are to expand on arboriculture. “Other villagers here have been selling fresh fruits to wholesale buyers, who then sell them in the nearby country. From this activity they have made an okay income for the moment, and realizing that made me focus on this same activity as well,” said Tone. 

Agriculture has been her focus for years, planting mainly grains such as wheat and corn, which she sells; seasonal vegetables are only for her family’s needs. The only other source of income for the family is from some rental units.

loans.use: to buy olive trees and scion vines for planting

loans.name: Sitte Hava

texts.en: Sitti Hawais is married and works hard to support her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar. Sitti Hawa has been in this business for 12 years and successfully repaid her previous loan. She is seeking a new loan to further build up her businesses and save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Juan Blas

texts.es:
El amor que tiene Juan por su trabajo de agricultor y ganadero es incondicional. Por más de 27 años, este hombre trabajador ha producido muchos cultivos que le han permitido salir adelante con su familia. Anteriormente, Juan había solicita un préstamo para comprar semilla de maíz y abono, además aprovechó el dinero para comprar dos cerdos para criarlos y venderlos para tener más ganancias. Con mucha humildad, agradece a todas las personas que hicieron que tuviera esa inversión para llevar cabo este cultivo. 
Ahora Juan está en una nueva temporada y quiere volver a invertir en su negocio, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar semilla de maíz, abono y una bomba para fumigar. Con este crédito podrá tener una excelente cosecha y seguir mejorando su calidad de vida. Al cancelar considera seguir invirtiendo en su finca y así seguir proporcionándole a sus tres hijos y a su esposa un fututo prospero.
texts.en:
The love that Juan has for his work as a farmer and as a rancher is unconditional.

For more than 27 years, this hard-working man has grown many crops, which have allowed him to do well for himself and his family.

Juan had previously asked for a loan to buy maize seed and organic fertilizer. In addition, he used the money to buy two pigs to raise and sell, and, thus, have more income. With great humility, he thanks all the people who made possible for him to get that loan so that he could grow his crop.

Now, this is a new planting season, and Juan wants to reinvest in his business. For this reason, he is requesting a new loan to buy maize seed, organic fertilizer, and a fumigation pump. This loan will help him to have an excellent harvest and to keep on improving his quality of life. 

He is considering reinvesting in his farm once he pays off the loan. In this way, he will keep on providing his wife and their three children with a future.

loans.use: to buy maize seed, organic fertilizer, and a fumigation pump.

loans.name: Jose Guillermo

texts.es:
José, de 45 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, creció con sus padres, quienes le enseñaron está actividad, está casado y su esposa le apoya con los oficios domésticos, ya que sus hijos tienen su propio hogar, pero le colaboran en el desempeño de sus actividades.

José, se levanta a las 5:30 a.m. para ir a trabajar, durante la mañana trabaja en la parcela que alquila y en la tarde trabaja en otras parcelas o cuidando sus animales.

José, necesita el crédito para comprar semilla, veneno, abono y rastreada para sembrar una parcela, con esto espera que su producción sea buena.

José, desea sembrar jícama y espera lograrlo, con el involucramiento de su esposa y la colaboración de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose, 45 years old, works in agriculture. He grew up with his parents, who taught him this trade. He is married, and his wife helps out with the household chores, now that their children have their own homes, but they still help with their work. 

Jose gets up at 5:30 in the morning to go to work. In the morning, he works on the parcel of land he rents, and in the afternoon he works on other parcels or takes care of his animals. Jose needs the loan to buy seeds, pesticides, manure, and tools to plant a parcel of land, and with this he hopes production will be good.

Jose would like to plant jicama, and he hopes to do so with his wife and the help of their children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides, manure and tools to plant a parcel of land

loans.name: Lucy's Group

texts.en:
Lucy, pictured above, has eight children and is always described as a very reliable person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Lucy is representing her group of 11 farmers in Butere District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Lucy has been a farmer for 18 years, and in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Lucy is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 4.5 acres will be planted by Lucy's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Frida's Group

texts.en: Frida is 57 years old, has seven children and leads a loan group formed by 16 farmers in the Butere District of Kenya. Frida has been farming with the One Acre Fund for some time now, having joined the program in 2011. Her decision to join was largely a result of a desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. And though she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside the One Acre Fund. Frida also decided to buy a solar light with part of her loan. She is very excited by this, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours so her children can study. Obtaining this loan means that Frida's Group will be able to receive a total of 10 solar lights, as well as farming supplies to plant a total of 12 acres.

loans.use: to buy a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zainabu is a hardworking woman who lives in Kamukuzi in the Mbarara district.  She grew up with her parents, both of whom died last year and left her with the responsibility of looking after her family. She got married shortly after her parents' death but her husband abandoned her with two children. She decided to live her own life and accepted that she had to find solutions to many problems, especially financial ones. Immediately she started a retail shop, but the profits are still marginal so in order to supplement her income she has ventured into transport and is renting a car to carry people around. She has requested a UGX 5,000,000 loan to buy a second car for this business since she has experience and this will save her the cost of renting. Pictured is Zainabu and a UGAFODE staff person with the car she intends to buy. She is grateful to have the support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en: Nisrine is a 22-year-old single woman. She is living with her parents and three siblings. Nisrine and her mother cooperate together in order to supplement the family’s income. She decided to start her own work as a farmer beginning in 2010. Today, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l for land reclamation.  She said that this will increase her business productivity by a large percentage, which will give her higher profits.

loans.use: for land reclamation

loans.name: Las Franciscanas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Fransciscanas es un grupo nuevo, que se encuentra haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, es un conjunto de mujeres muy trabajadoras, amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, quienes vieron una oportunidad de mejorar sus vidas con este programa.
Una de las integrantes es la Gloria quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que está en una pobreza extrema. Ella a  través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de las ventas que hace en su pequeño copetín tiene los ingresos para ayudar a su familia. Comenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que hoy día ya es conocida y tiene ya muchos clientes.
La Sra. Gloria solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos para su copetín, como ser golosinas, galletitas, jugos, y otros el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named Las Franciscanas is a new group whose members are taking part in the poverty elimination survey. This is a group composed of very hard-working women—friends and residents of the city of Mariano Roque Alonso—who saw the opportunity to improve their lives with this program.

One of the members is Gloria, who in her latest survey showed a poverty level of one—this means that she lives in extreme poverty. Through her constant efforts and hard work, and the sales she makes at her small fast-food counter, she generates the income to help out her family. She mentions that she started with her business not long ago but that now she is well known and has many customers.

Gloria is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her small fast-food counter such as snacks, cookies, juices, and the like. This purchase will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her small fast-food counter such as snacks, cookies, juices, and the like.

loans.name: Los Amigos Del Norte Group

texts.es:
Marina es una mujer de 42 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 6 hijos de 5, 8, 10, 17, 20 y 24 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, comprensiva, buena oyente, optimista, de buena actitud, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en la zona ‘plan 3000’ una ciudadela que nació por una riada en la década de los ochenta y que dejó a tres mil familias sin un lugar donde vivir, se convirtió en el nuevo inicio de vida de miles de personas, y miles de sueños que volvieron a comenzar y empezar a construir la ciudadela.
Marina es de tez morena, ojos pardos, baja estatura, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (la segunda de la izquierda, viste blusa beige y pantalón negro). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja en construcción y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian y trabajan, los 3 que siguen estudian en la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad de ampliar su negocio para generar mejores ingresos económicos la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de vajillas, venta de carne de pollo, venta de flores, servicio de té, taller de costura, tienda de videos y venta de celulares, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, como; majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, huevo frito y plátano frito), locro carretero cruceño (sopa de: carne deshidratada, carne cortada en pedacitos, yuca y huevo), Sopa de Remojado (sopa de huesos), Chicharrón de Taitetu (Chanchitos de monte ”taitetú” frito), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno puede ser de papa y churiqui),  y otros. Actividad que realiza de forma ambulante, transportando toda su comida en ollas cargadas en un carrito de 2 ruedas y que empuja hasta encontrar un lugar donde instalarse. “mi labor diaria es sacrificada, ahora quiero abrir un puesto de venta fijo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sabe cocinar muy bien y los clientes la prefieren, la desventaja son las distancias que debe recorrer hasta encontrar un puesto de venta. Su sueño es abrir un puesto de venta fijo para dejar de ambular, ella desea construir un techo para su puesto de venta fijo para la venta de comida. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marina solicita un préstamo para la construcción de un techo para abrir un puesto de venta fijo de comida tradicional.
texts.en:
Marina is a 42 year old woman who lives with her husband. She has 6 children of 5, 8, 10, 17, 20, and 24 years of age. Her business is in the sale of traditional food. She is a good mother, understanding, a good listener, optimistic, has a good attitude, and is responsible and hardworking. She developed her business in itinerant form in the zone "plan 3000", a citadel that was born from a flood in the eighties and that left three thousand families without a place to live. It became the new beginning of life for thousands of people, and thousands of dreams started again and began as they began to construct the citadel. 

Marina is of dark complexion, brown eyes, short stature, long black hair that is tied, and a robust physique. Her maternal language is Guaraní which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish in general culture and for the business that she does (the second from the left, wearing a beige blouse and black pants). She shares her life with her husband who works in construction and with her children. The two oldest study and work, and the next three study in school and the youngest is not yet of school age. They live in their own home made of brick and cement with a tin roof that has potable water, electric energy and sewage. The necessity to expand her business to generate better economic income led her to lead a bank of people with businesses such as: sale of china, sale of chicken, selling flower, tea service, sewing, video store and selling cell phones, to request for a loan and improve their activities.

Her business is in the sale of traditional food, such as: majadito de charque (majadito jerky: dried meat, rice, fried egg and fried plantain), locro carretero cruceño (Santa Cruz road locro: soup: jerky, cut pieces of meat, cassava and egg), Sopa de Remojado (soaked soup: soup of bones), Chicharrón de Taitetu (crackling of taitetu: fried chanchitos bush "taitetú"), Cogote relleno (filler neck: creole chicken neck, stuffing can be potato and churiqui), and others. She does this activity in rounds, transporting all of her food in pots on a cart with two wheels which she pushes to find a place to settle. "My daily work is sacrificed, so I want to open a permanent stall..." she says. The advantage of her business is that she knows how to cook very well and her clients prefer it, and the disadvantage is distances she must cross to find a stall where she can sell. Her dream is to open a permanent stall and she wants to build a roof for her permanent stall so she can sell food. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 3 years she has been doing this activity.

It is for these reasons that Marina requests a loan for the construction of a roof to open a permanent stall for the sale of traditional food.

loans.use: for the construction of a roof to open up a permanent stall to sell traditional food.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina owns and operates a variety store business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for years now, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by selling meat products. 

She wants to improve her business. Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of PHP 50,000 to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family. She also envisions having her own computer shop someday to increase her sources of income. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 67 years old, married and a mother of nine children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2011. 

She has undergone training on enterprise development through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa that has helped her manage the business more effectively. She had previously benefitted from an enterprise incubation fund which she used to start her chicken enterprise. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy more chicken and chicken feeds to expand her business.

Mary is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay well.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feeds that will boost poultry farming.

loans.name: Reverien

texts.en:
Raverien is 38 years old. He is married with five children aged between 4 and 17 years. They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 17 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is a hardworking Ugandan married lady with four children. She lives in Kagadi, Uganda.

She sells clothes in a boutique to supplement her daily income from growing cabbages and tomatoes. She hopes to grow her business despite challenges of competition from similar businesses and changes in tastes and preferences of her customers, which affect her income projections.

Agatha intends to use the loan to buy clothes and suitcases for selling.

loans.use: to buy clothes and suitcases for selling.

loans.name: Penninah

texts.en:
Penninah is 29 years old, married, and has one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2011 to benefit from trainings on savings mobilization, enterprise development, and financial management. Her economic activity is vegetable farming. She also operates a green grocer where she sells vegetables and fruits. 

Penninah is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more fruits and vegetables, such as onions, kale, oranges, and mangoes. This loan will enable her to earn more income to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables, such as onions, kale, oranges, and mangoes

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina hails from the town of Maribojoc, Bohol. She engages in a food vending business. She sells ice candy, hot cake, and shakoy (a kind of twisted, fried donut coated with caramelized sugar).

She is a 44-year-old married woman with two children, ages 16 and 24 years old. Her husband earns a living by being a fish vendor.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, and cellophane. These will help Cristina to produce more snack food and sell it to the locals in her place. She could now be able to improve her earnings, and thus continue to support the needs of her growing children.

She is determined to be able to successfully manage her business for the improvement of her status of living.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, and cellophane.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en: Faten is a 21-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and two sibling-aged schoolchildren. She has worked as a private teacher since 2011 to offer her family additional financial support. She loves her profession and always gives the best education she can. She arranged a special room in her house to receive students and she also visits them at their places. Today, she is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a new laptop and a scientific encyclopedia to improve her teaching skills and therefore increase her income. She notes that these purchases will facilitate her work preparation and wishes to receive additional students in the coming school season.

loans.use: to purchase a new laptop and a scientific encyclopedia

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Sonia is 27 years old and has two children who are in school.

Sonia has a water purifier business in the Philippines. Sonia requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her water purifier like a water tank, pipe, etc.

Sonia has been in this business for eight years.  In the future, Sonia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her water purifier like a water tank, pipe, etc

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 37 years old. She is married with six children aged between 7 and 18 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past eight years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a goat.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize.

loans.name: Xavier

texts.en:
Xavier is 52 years old. He is married with eight children aged between 12 and 29 years. Six of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past eight years. His wife is a farmer also. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Erika Johana

texts.es: ERIKA JOHANA: Es una joven sonriente, luchadora de 22 años de edad. Originaria de Puerto Cabezas, pertenece a la etnia miskita, soltera, con deseos de superacion. Habita en casa de sus padres en una vivienda de tambo y madera. Con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, está solicitando su primer financiamiento para construirle a sus padres poco a poco su vivienda de concreto. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción: bloques, cemento, hierro, arena, zinc, clavos, madera y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella sueña con brindarle a sus padres una vivienda digna, segura, que cuente con las condiciones adecuadas.
texts.en:
Erika Johana is a 22-year-old, smiling and hard-working young woman. Originally from Puerto Cabezas, she is of Miskita ethnicity, she is single and hopes to better herself. She lives with her parents in a house made of wood on stilts.

With the purpose of improving the quality of her family's life, she is requesting her first loan to build a concrete house for her parents, little by little. With the loan, she will buy construction materials: cinder blocks, cement, iron, sand, zinc, nails, wood, and cover labor costs. 

She dreams of giving her parents a respectable, safe home with suitable conditions.

loans.use: to build her parents a concrete home, little by little.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah, the lady in the photo, is 40 years old, married and a mother of four children who are all attending school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in order to benefit from the training, especially on enterprise development.

She is a vegetable farmer growing potatoes, cabbages, tomatoes, carrots and she also has a milking cow. She is borrowing a loan to buy dairy feeds and certified seeds which will enable her to increase her production of vegetables and also milk. This will help her to increase sales and satisfy her customers' demands. 

She is very happy with Kiva and the lenders and promises to repay her loan well.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds and certified seeds which will enable her to increase her production of vegetables and also milk. This will help her to increase sales and meet her customers' needs

loans.name: Ana Claribel

texts.es:
Claribel, de 55 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está casada, tiene hijos pero todos viven en otro lugar.

Claribel, se levanta de madruga, para realizar sus actividades diarias junto a su esposo, que es quien le colabora en el ordeño de las vacas y en la siembra.

Claribel, trabaja en la parcelas junto a su esposo y en el transcurso de la tarde ella se dedica a elaborar queso y venderlo entre sus vecinos.

Claribel, necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca, para producir más leche para la elaboración de queso y así incrementar sus ingresos para su sustento.

Claribel, sueña con continuar en la elaboración de queso y en la siembra de maíz, además sueña con comprar vacas, para comprar un terreno donde pastar sus animales.
texts.en:
Claribel is 55 years old and has a fifth grade education.  She is married and has children, but they live somewhere else.

Claribel gets up early in the morning to do her daily activities with her husband, who helps with the milking of the cows and with the farming.

Claribel works the land with her husband and in the evenings she makes cheese and sells it to her neighbors.

Claribel needs this loan to buy a cow to produce more milk and make cheese.  This will allow her to increase her income for her own support.

Claribel dreams of continuing to make cheese, raise corn, and buy cows so she can buy a plot of land to graze her animals.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John, featured in the picture above, is representing his farming group formed by five farmers in Butere District, Kenya. He is 75 years old and a married father of six children, and he is often described as a very reliable person. 

Although John has been a farmer for more than 40 years, he is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because he really wanted to get the best-quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Even though he is new to the program, John wanted to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, John hopes to be able to save more money for the future.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 2.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of one solar light, as, even though John decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Abigael

texts.en:
Abigael, a 38 year old woman, joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management.

Her economic activity is vegetable and dairy farming. She is borrowing a loan to buy fertilizer and animal feeds to enable her to increase milk and vegetables production. This will help her earn income to meet her family's basic needs, e.g., food and access to better healthcare.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and animal feeds, hence increase milk and vegetables production to earn more income to meet her family's basic needs, e.g., food and access to better healthcare.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in:  cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a retaining wall at her house.

loans.name: Reyna Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Reyna está integrado por 4 mujeres laboriosas, que luchan por el bienestar de su familia, la coordinadora es Sandra de 54 años de edad, casada, quien se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa desde hace 26 años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de  ropa nueva como camisas, pantalones, chores y faldas. Con los financiamientos anteriores logro aumentar la oferta de sus productos, con la compra de uniformes y de esa manera logro satisfacer la demanda de la temporada escolar.
