La segunda socia es Martha de 51 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado usado, doña Sandra de 48 años se dedica al estilismo y patricia de 26 años de edad se dedica a la venta de zapatos nuevos.
texts.en:
The group called Reyna is made up of four hardworking women who strive for their family’s wellbeing.  Sandra is the group’s coordinator.  She is 54 years old, married, and has been buying and selling clothing for 26 years.

She is asking for this loan to buy new clothing such as shirts, pants, shorts, and skirts.  She was able to increase the number of products she offers with the help of her previous loan.  She bought uniforms and was able to satisfy the seasonal demand for the school year.

The other member is 51 year old Martha who sells clothing and used shoes.  Sandra is 48 years old and does styling.  Patricia is 26 years old and sells new shoes.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in:  cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a retaining wall at her house.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 32 years old, is married and has four children. To earn a living, she engages in a transport business to help her husband in providing for her family. She decided again to take a loan to purchase motor parts for motor maintenance so that her motorcycle will be in a good condition to cater to more passengers and earn her more income.

Nancy wants to buy another motorcycle in the future to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Balbina

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Balbina works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.  Balbina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Balbina has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a diversified farmer who hails from Kenya, in a village called Nduruma. He has been married for 15 years, and he has four children, the eldest being 14. 

John started farming from scratch 14 years ago. Today, he has two dairy cows, four goats, 15 heads of poultry and 20 trees. To further diversify his farming activities, he is looking to start crop farming this year. In order to meet his objective, John is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders that he is going to use to start horticultural farming. 

With your loan, the horticultural farm will complement John's livestock farm in many ways, including proper utilization of by-products in an environmentally friendly and sustainable manner.

loans.use: to venture into horticultural farming

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a retail rice grain business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 62 years old and married. She has eight children, one of whom is in school.

Alicia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Alicia has been raising pigs for seven years, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Alicia would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Sara's Group

texts.en:
Sara, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 11 farmers in Butere District. She is 50 years old, is married and has eight children.

Sara likes to think of herself as a very reliable person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to save more money. Sara plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Sara’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 7.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Abidah's Group

texts.en:
Abidah is a 62-year-old proud father of eight children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of seven farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Abidah has noticed that he has learned a lot from farming training.

Abidah described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Abidah’s Group will be able to plant a total of 3.75 acres of land and purchase a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Ayub's Group

texts.en:
Ayub is 42 years old and has five children. He has been a farmer for five years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Ayub is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by sixteen farmers in Butere District, Kenya.

Ayub started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve, especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers.

Ayub’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of ten acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Ilirjan

texts.en:
Ilirjan is a 26-year-old married man and has a 3-year-old son. He wants to start up a livestock business, and this is the reason why he is requesting a loan from you. Currently Ilirjan has two cows, as seen in the photograph, but he wants this to become his main activity from now on. From the two cows he has, he sells raw milk to some nearby restaurants.

“I realized how easy was to find people to buy the dairy. Albanians consume a lot of dairy, thus the market is always in demand for such products. During summer times, I have been going to Greece for seasonal work, and I don’t have to do that anymore if I have my own thing here,” said Ilirjan to the loan officer who disbursed to him.

loans.use: to expand his livestock activity by buying  dairy cows

loans.name: Lydia's Group

texts.en:
Lydia, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 12 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Lydia will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Lydia plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Lydia’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 8.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Soline

texts.en:
Solina is a 62-year-old married woman with seven children between the ages of 20 and 35. She has grown maize for 10 years, her husband is also a farmer. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer.

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth is a 50-year-old 8-member group leader with 6 children. 

Ruth has farmed with One Acre Fund since 2011. This decision to join was due to her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. She described her last harvest as good but believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Ruth also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

 Ruth's Group will be able to receive a total of 6 solar lights and plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, hybrid seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 23 años de edad habita en vive junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeño hijo de 1 año de edad. Él es un hombre emprendedor que desde hace 6 años se dedica a la colocación de cielos falsos, actividad que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. Miguel desea construir su vivienda, ya que cuenta con una pequeña parcela, pero no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir su vivienda y de esta manera brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, sabiendo que lograra cancelar las cuotas que el crédito implica apoyado en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Miguel is 23 years old, and lives with his life partner and his young 1-year old son. He is an enterprising man who, for the past 6 years, has made his living putting in dropped ceilings, a business which has allowed him to get his family ahead.

Miguel would like to build his house, since he already has a small plot of land, but he doesn't have the financial resources he needs. That is why he is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron, in order to build his house and thus give his family a better quality of life. He knows that he will be able to make the payments required by the loan because of his job.

loans.use: to invest in:  cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Vecinos Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VECINOS EMPRENDEDORES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Soledad ella es conviviente y tiene 34 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "VECINOS EMPRENDEDORES" [Enterprising Neighbors] community bank. This bank is located in the Echarate district, which belongs to the La Convención province in the department of Cusco.

The member is Soledad. She is a live-in partner, is 34 years old, and has 2 children. She works in her restaurant business, and makes various dishes such as baked chicken, soups and meat stir-fry. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. She has had this business for 7 years, and it is going very well for her. She is applying for a loan to buy ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

The other members make their living in an animal sales business, clothing sales business, grocery store business, and a food sales business.

The member is grateful to everyone who forms part of this dream through this loan, and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
46-year-old Elizabeth engages in fishing. She catches and sells fish. She is a married woman with one grown child. Together with her husband, she has been engaged in fishing for more than ten years.  She is in need of capital to continue her fishing livelihood.

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing net. These tools are very essential in augmenting Elizabeth's on-going catch. In this way, she could be able to sell more fish in the market and thus afford to purchase healthy diets and expand her fishing business.

Elizabeth hopes that she will become successful in her line of business someday.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 67 years old and married. To earn a living she is engaged in a sari-sari store business as a source of income for her and her husband. She decided to request another loan to buy additional goods to sell in her sari-sari store. This will help her increase her store inventory so that it can generate more income.

Luzviminda wants to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional goods to sell in her sari-sari store.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Liwayway

texts.en:
Liwayway has been operating her own rental-housing business for a year, and she gets good earnings from this. She is from Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is 69 years old, and is married to Walterio. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs. Liwayway and her husband are working hard and they are determined to have more income than they currently have.

To improve her profit and to pay for the maintenance of the boarding house, Liwayway would like to ask for loan assistance. An amount of PHP 15,000 could help her in the renovation and beautification of their place, so that her regular boarders will choose to stay there for a longer period of time. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Liwayway hopes that they could attract more boarders. She also desires to start up another business so they could have an additional source of income. Liwayway meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfFinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the boarding house

loans.name: Gerry

texts.en:
Gerry, a 53-year-old father, is a very passionate entrepreneur from Pasay city, Metro Manila. He has two children who are currently in college. Rosalina, his wife, works as a vendor in the community. He manages a buy-and-sell business, and his income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenses.

What he basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and then sell them piecemeal with a little profit. His products are usually appliances like a coffee maker, ice cream maker and other distinguished appliances. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they offer. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. 

Gerry is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan to purchase more products and merchandise to sell. He will use his loan to increase his sales and his additional revenue so he can improve the general living conditions of his family. In the future, he hopes to prosper through his business and become professional in his field. He also still wants to finish his studies even at his age.  

He meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God is studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to improve sales through buying additional products and merchandise

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is married and works hard to support her family through a fishing business that she has had for 10 years.

She requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase a fishing net.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is a 40-year-old  married woman with five children, four attend school.

She has earned a living raising pigs for 4 years and is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vaccines.

She earns additional income selling personal products.

She  works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save money, expand  her business, and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Alvin

texts.en:
Alvin is from  a small village in the Chuka region of Kenya. He  farms 5.5 acres  with his wife and 4-year-old child. He has 2 dairy cows, 3 dairy goats, 5 heads of poultry and coffee plants. 

Alvin seeks a loan to buy a motorcycle to facilitate transportation of his farm and taking produce to the market. He will repay the loan with income from dairy farming and  transportation services.

Your loan will enable Alvin to save costs, easily and conveniently transport produce to the market, and to have an additional source of income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a 48-year-old married woman with four children, two children attend school.

Cristina has raised pigs for 4 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 3 times  from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Cristina would like to save money, expand her business, and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a 33-year-old married woman with two children, both attend school.

Francisca has raised pigs for 3 years and requests 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 3 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Francisca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Aaron

texts.en:
Aaron is 34 years old. He is married with four children aged between one and eight years. Two of them go to school. He and his wife are farmers, and he has been growing maize for the past five years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for growing maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for growing maize

loans.name: Glady's Group

texts.en:
Gladys is 50 years old and has 6 children. She is a group leader and represents a group formed by 9 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. 

Gladys has been farming with One Acre Fund fsince 2011. This decision was due to her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods.  She described her last harvest as good and believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Gladys also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan because it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Gladys's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights and plant 4 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light,  hybrid seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Usafi Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is a group member of the above group. She is 38 years old and married with three children, ages 18, 16, and 12, all of whom go to school. She is a resident of Ndeeba working in Usafi market selling secondhand clothes as her source of income.

She started the business six years ago, and it helps her pay school fees and provide for the family's needs. However, with future plans of growth and expansion she decided to borrow for the first time. She will use the loan to buy a bale of secondhand clothes to sell. This will increase her income and profit.

Her major challenges are limited capital, stiff competition at the market, the high tax levied by the city authority and seasonal changes which affect prices.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 32 years old. He is married with three children aged between 3 and 7 years, two of whom go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past four years. Also his wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for growing maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house and to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for growing maize.

loans.name: Everline's Group

texts.en:
Everline is a 48-year- old woman with 7 children. She is a group leader  representing 10 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. 

Everline has been with One Acre Fund since 2011. She joined to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods.  She described her last harvest as good and believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Everline also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Everline's Group will be able to receive a total of 6 solar lights and plant 4.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, hybrid seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mildred's Group

texts.en:
Mildred is 28 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has four children and is married. As a group leader, Mildred is representing her group of 11 farmers in Butere District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Mildred's desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

Mildred and her group will receive a total of seven solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nipher's Group

texts.en:
Nipher, pictured above, is a group leader representing her group, formed by six farmers in Butere District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011, and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She is married and has two children.

With a portion of this loan, Nipher will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge her phone. Nipher plans to use the profits she gains this year to buy a goat.

In total, Nipher’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of two and a half acres of land. They will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Leopord

texts.en:
Leopard is 45 years old. He is married with five children who are between 6 and 18 years old. They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past seven years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva he would like to buy more fertilizers for growing maize. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for growing maize.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Teresita, 55, has engaged in a direct selling business within her community for almost fifteen years now. Her husband, Nardito, works as a musician and they work hand-in-hand to provide for their needs.

She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

Due to financial insufficiency, Teresita wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products that are needed to increase her product inventory. Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Teresita dreams for her business to grow bigger and hopes to give her family a good life and her children a good education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise products

loans.name: Otilio

texts.es: Otilio de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, el se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, frijol y maicillo, posee 20 años de experiencia en la actividad comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y pago de alquiler del terreno que muestra la fotografía para seguir con sus siembras y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Otillo is 63 years old and lives with her son in his own home.  He raises corn, beans, and millet and has been doing this for 20 years.  He sells his products in different markets near his home and is able to pay some of the household expenses with his earnings.  He is asking for a loan to buy supplies, such as seeds, fertilizers, compost, insecticide, etc. and pay for rent on the land shown in the picture, so he can continue planting and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy supplies and rent the land.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more varieties of merchandise and other items needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy supplies of perfumes, lotion, ready-to-wear clothing, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Eden hopes to see improvement in her business and in her life soon. She desires to own a big distribution company, and she dreams to travel the world. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of supplies like perfumes, lotion, ready-to-wear clothing, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Ana de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace  30 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presenta en el hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando las puertas y ventanas pero como no tiene de suficiente capital por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de puertas, balcones y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su hijo puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en: Ana is 61 years old and lives in a home of her own with her son.  She has been farming for 30 years and is able to pay some of her household expenses with what she earns.  She wants to make improvements to her home by hanging doors and windows, but she doesn’t have enough capital and is asking for a loan to buy doors and balconies, and pay for labor so she and her son can live more comfortably and securely.

loans.use: to install doos and windows.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Perlita has been running a variety store business in her community for almost 10 years now. She is 60 years of age and is blessed with four children. Her husband, William, helps her in their business, and they work hand-in-hand to provide for their needs.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Perlita earns by purchasing merchandise at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, Perlita wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like to avail herself of a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional grocery items that are needed. Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Perlita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to give her children a better life. She meets up with her fellowship group* every week to share stories of her life and business and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items that are needed in her business.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 34 years old. He is married with three children ranging in age from 1 to 8 years; two of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past 10 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for growing maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land and pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for growing maize.

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en:
Philemon, 33, comes from the Koibarar location in Kenya. He is a mixed farmer who once bought a motorcycle to solve challenges he faced when transporting his produce around the farm and to the market. Once he had the motorcycle, he realized that many other farmers faced the same challenges he had. He started offering transportation services and the demand went through the roof.

Today, Philemon is seeking a loan that he will add onto his savings to buy another motorcycle. Having two of them will enable him to serve a wider client base and make more income for growing his businesses and family income.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es:
Rosa, de 48 años de edad, posee varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura y al comercio de granos básicos como frijol y maíz, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres, ya que se dedicaron a estas actividades durante toda su vida; ella estudio hasta noveno grado, su familia se compone por sus hijos, ya que ella es madre soltera.

Rosa, comercializa los granos básicos que produce y compra en los alrededores de su vivienda, ella se levanta las 4:00 a.m. para llegar temprano a su trabajo, ya que vive bastante retirado de donde lo comercializa.

Rosa, necesita el crédito para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y necesita comprar semilla, abono y venenos, para obtener una buena producción.

Rosa, sueña con seguir comercializando los granos y seguir sembrando y comprar un terreno en donde poder construir una vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is 48 years old and has been farming and selling basic grains, such as beans and corn, for several years.  She learned this from her parents who did this all their lives.  She has a ninth grade education and her family includes her children and she is a single mother.

Rosa sells the grains and makes her purchases around her home.  She gets up at 4:00am so she can arrive early at work, since it’s far from where she makes her sales.

Rosa needs this loan so she can plant 7,000 square meters of corn and needs to buy seeds, compost, and poisons, so she can have a good production.

Rosa dreams of continuing to sell grains and planting and buying some land on which she can build a house.

loans.use: to buy seeds.
